loans.name: David

texts.es:
David:

David tiene 30 años y nació en Cali, Valle del Cauca, población ubicada en el suroriente de Colombia. Es hijo único y vive con su madre, su tía y su primo. Su madre y su tía ya están retiradas y su primo trabaja en la Alcaldía de Cali, vinculado a proyectos sociales. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron y gracias a las becas de padrinazgo que obtuvo por su excelencia académica, David se pudo graduar como Comunicador Social/Periodista en la Universidad del Valle.

David tiene el sueño de realizar una Maestría en Guion en University College of London y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, David anhela trabajar haciendo cine documental para contribuir al desarrollo del país y poder mostrar no solo las situaciones que se viven en Colombia, sino también para mostrar las posibles soluciones. 

Aquí está su historia: 

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente, soy parte de un grupo de investigación  y trabajo como voluntario en una junta de acción comunal. Durante los últimos años de mi carrera en Comunicación Social y Periodismo trabajé en la Cinemateca de Universidad del Valle, junto con el profesor y realizador Oscar Campo y la Directora Luisa González, con quienes coordinaba la programación del área de no ficción. Allí presenté, investigué y publiqué textos sobre los trabajos presentados, que esencialmente se caracterizaban por los cruces que se generaban entre las coyunturas sociales de la educación y medio ambiente y el documental. 

Esta experiencia me motivó a desarrollar como tesis de grado un documental-ensayo llamado “con una gota empieza el aguacero” sobre la Conservación las cuencas que surten de agua diversas ciudades de Colombia, el cual hice apoyando a la Junta de Acción Comunal de la vereda La Carolina-Corral de Piedra. Este trabajo fue premiado con la Beca Colombia Biodiversa de la Fundación Alejandro Ángel E. El haber trabajado en la Cinemateca y haber participado del Diplomado en Documental de Creación “Mirada de dos mundos” en el año 2008, me llevaron a profundizar más sobre la representación de la realidad, mediante el uso de nuevas tecnologías, soportes y formas de contar.

Al realizar estudios de Maestría en el exterior podré tener otros referentes culturales. El cambio de perspectiva puede ayudarme a ver con otra óptica las virtudes y riquezas pero también los problemas que la sociedad colombiana tiene aún por solucionar, y las posibilidades de contribuir a estas soluciones sobre todo desde un mundo académico, teniendo como referencia otros modelos sociales. Conocer otra realidad hace parte del intercambio cultural que realizaría a manera de un “embajador”: mostrarle a otras personas, que probablemente conozcan poco acerca de este país, los valores de nuestra sociedad. 
Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior, dado que gracias a Kiva podría realizar los estudios que necesito para perfeccionar mi segundo idioma y poder aplicar a la Universidad que me permitirá cumplir mi proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
David is 30 years old and was born in Cali, in Valle del Cauca department in south-eastern Colombia. He is a single child and lives with his mother, his aunt and his cousin. His mother and his aunt are retired and his cousin works in Cali town hall on social projects. Despite the financial problems they had and thanks to the scholarships he received for academic excellence, David was able to graduate as a social commentator/journalist from the Universidad del Valle.

David's dream is to study a master's degree in screenplay at University College London. To do this, he needs Kiva's help, as this is the only way he can cover the cost of language exams and the university application process. One he has completed his master's degree and returned to Colombia, David wants to work making documentary films, in order to contribute to the country's development and show not only the situation in which Colombia finds itself, but also the possible solutions. 

He recounts his story as follows, "Despite the fact that my family are supporting me to achieve this dream, my parents are unable to cover costs as high as these due to their limited finances. I am currently part of a research group, and I work as a volunteer on a community action council. During the final years of my social communication and journalism degree, I worked at the Universidad del Valle film archive with the lecturer and producer Oscar Campo and the director Luisa González, with whom I coordinated non-fiction programming. There, I presented, researched and published texts on the works submitted, which were mainly characterised by the crossroads generated between the social conditions of education, environment, and the documentary.

This experience motivated me to develop a documentary-essay called “con una gota empieza el aguacero” [a downpour begins with a drop] for my dissertation, about conserving the basins which supply water to various cities in Colombia. I produced this in support of the Community Action Council of the hamlet of La Carolina-Corral de Piedra. This work won me the "Beca Colombia Biodiversa" scholarship from the Fundación Alejandro Ángel Escobar foundation. Working in the film archive and participating in the creative documentary “Mirada de dos mundos” [gaze from two worlds] diploma in 2008, led me to explore in more depth the representation of reality, through the use of new technologies, media and storytelling methods.

By studying a master's degree outside of Colombia, I will gain new cultural references. This change in perspective may help me to see not only the virtues and riches of Colombian society from another viewpoint, but also the problems that remain to be solved, and the possibilities to contribute to these solutions from the academic world, with other social models as a reference. Experiencing another reality forms part of the cultural exchange I will take part in as an "ambassador". I will show other people, who probably do not know much about this country, the values of our society. 

Kiva will be the support I need to take the first steps on this long road, and the impetus to study this master's degree abroad, since thanks to Kiva, I will be able to undertake the studies I need to perfect my second language and apply to the university, so that I can achieve my life project.

loans.use: to study a master's degree at University College London

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 6 hijos; 4 hombres y 2 mujeres, se dedica a cultivar repollo, papa y cebolla, también compra verduras por cuerda y luego los lleva al mercado del municipio para vender, Santiago solicita un prestamos por un monto de Q. 11,000.00, para comprar semilla de repollo y semilla de papa e insumos, Santiago tiene planeado comprar un pick-up para usarlo en las labores agrícolas que realiza.
texts.en: Santiago is 39 and lives in the town of Sololá in the department of Sololá.  He has 6 children: 4 boys and 2 girls.  He earns his living growing cabbage, potatoes, and onions.  He also buys vegetables by the cuerda and takes them to the town market to sell.  He is seeking a loan for 11,000GTQ to buy cabbage and potato seeds and supplies.  Santiago plans to buy a pick-up truck to use for his farming work.

loans.use: to buy potato and cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en:
Theopiste is 53 years old. She is married with two children. 

She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With profits from farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Dorilen

texts.en:
Dorilen has been providing transportation services in her community for more than three years. She earns well from her main source of income. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to renew transportation licenses. 

In the future, she wants to sustain her transportation business and wants to save her profits to use when she gets old.

loans.use: to renew transportation licenses

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, age 38, is happy tending to her little store in Oroquieta City.  Her husband is a minimum wage earner, and she wants to support the income of the family with her store. 

She keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Tessie believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Tessie has reached her fourth year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for several loans and maintained a good repayment record.

Now, she is in need of 10,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.  Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. 

She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested," she said.  

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store. She can then afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has provided for her family from her piggery business for more than six years and she earns well from this. From her income, she was able to sustain it and successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying piglets to raise. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase piglets and feed. Fe wants to expand her piggery to increase their income and to have a general better living condition.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Elvira, 42 years old, residing in Oroquieta. She is a single parent who provides for the family. She started a food production business selling lumpia, a homemade food product.

Elvira wants to expand her food production business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family especially her children. 

In order for her to make her wish possible, she needs additional capital to purchase raw ingredients. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Katty Yadira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 42 años de edad, hace varios años su esposos falleció pero de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 23 y 13 años, el menor estudia en colegio y es el que  aun vive con ella. 
Doña Katty es una mujer que le ha toco trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende pescado por libras, aguas, colas, entre otras bebidas, ella antes tenía una tienda de víveres pero tuvo que cerrarla por la competencia que había en la localidad, por lo cual opto por empezar a vender este tipo de productos el cual le está dejando muy buenos ingresos que le permiten salir adelante y darle una buena educación a su hijo menor. Ya son 5 años que lleva con este negocio y gracias a Dios su negocio esta muy bien. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, aguas y colas. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The loan group Santa Gema meets every 15 days in the Tarqui neighborhood in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons. It is also known for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many attractions.
Here lives Katty, 42, whose husband died several years ago. She has two children from this marriage who are 23 and 13 years old. The youngest son is attending school and it is he who still lives with Katty.
Katty is a woman who has tried to work hard to raise her children. She is a saleswoman. She has a place in her home where she sells fish by the pound, water, and other drinks. She used to have a grocery store but had to close it down due to the competition in the town. She chose to start selling these products and she is making good profits that allow her to move ahead and give a good education to her younger son. Now she has been in this business for 5 years and thanks God that her business is good. This loan to to buy fish, water, and sodas. She has been in the loan group for 3 years and likes it because they help her get ahead. Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to purchase fish and drinks to sell

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has five children. To make a living, he plants, harvests and sells rice and has been engaged in his business for many years and earns well from these activities. Romulo has successfully repaid a previous loan used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Cruz Betty

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de  edad e independientes. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña  Cruz es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende colas, aguas, helados, entre otras bebidas, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas,  ropa interior, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su local, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días.  Este negocio comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo ya hace varios años por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas, colas y aguas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa Gema” meets fortnightly in Tarqui, a neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is famous for its beautiful beaches, popular all year long. Its beauty has no equal and it has many touristic attractions.

This is where Cruz lives. She is 58, married, and has two children who are independent adults. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. Cruz is a housewife who works in order to generate her own income and help her husband with the home expenses. She is a saleswoman and has a small store at home where she sells sodas, water, ice cream and different beverages. She also sells clothes, sheets and underwear, among other things. She sells door-to-door, but also at home. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She started this business with the first loan she received with the group, some years ago. She feels grateful and this is how she makes a living.

With this loan she will buy clothes, sheets, sodas and water. She is a member of this group since it started and likes to be part of it because this is how she started her business. Her dream is to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, no cuenta con su inventario de ropa debidamente surtido para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes es por ello se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior para ambos sexos diversificada en estilos, colores y tallas.
Con el financiamiento anterior adquirió variedad de prendas, con lo que atrajo más clientes, tiene más ganancias, mejoro su situación familiar cancelo la deuda con buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Blanca does not have a sufficient inventory of clothes to satisfy the tastes of her customers. For this reason, she decided to request a new loan in order to buy shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts, and undergarments for both sexes that are in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes.

With the previous loan, Blanca acquired a variety of clothes that helped to attract more customers. She earned more profit, improved her family situation, and achieved a good credit record after repaying her debt.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Gerber Emmanuel

texts.es:
Gerber, continua esforzándose por mantener su negocio funcionando y generar los ingresos que necesita para subsistir junto a su familia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para comprar pantalones, faldas, camisas, trajes, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, vitaminas, analgésicos y reconstituyentes.
El financiamiento anterior le ha permitido tener prendas del gusto de sus clientes y medicamentos que ellos necesitan, sus ventas y ganancias son mayores.
texts.en: Gerber continues to work hard to maintain his business running and generating the necessary income for him to live with his family. He is asking for a new loan which he will use to buy pants, skirts, button-downs, suits, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, vitamins, analgesics and restorative products. The previous financing allowed him to stock articles of clothing according to his clients' taste as well as the medicines which they need, his sales and earnings have grown.

loans.use: purchase pants, skirts, button-downs, suits, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, vitamins, analgesics and restorative products.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad's business is selling local brew from sugarcane, but he has also been engaged in agriculture since 2009. 

He is a resident of Kabuga Muhororo. His previous loan did a great deal to increase his income. 

Therefore, he is applying for 600,000 UGX to buy sugarcane from local farmers that he will squeeze to increase the volume of his local gin sales and increase his profits. 

The income will help him to adequately provide for his family. He is hardworking.

His dream for the future is to increase his business and construct a good residential house for his children.

loans.use: to pay labourers to clear the sugarcane plantation.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es una persona de 44 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 6 hijos; 3 hombre y 3 mujeres, se dedica a cultivar papa, zanahoria, cebolla y maíz, los vende en el mercado del municipio, cuando no esta trabajando en sus cultivos se dedica a la sastrería, él solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 9,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa e insumos, Eduardo comenta que esta haciendo todo el esfuerzo que sus hijos se gradúen de una profesión y es la meta que tiene planeado.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 44 years old. He lives with his family in Sololá, a municipality in the department of Sololá. He has six children: three sons and three daughters. He grows potatoes, carrots, onions and corn and sells them at the local market. When he is not working in agriculture he works as a tailor.

Eduardo is requesting a loan of Q. 9,000 [GTQ] to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies. He says that he is working hard so that his children can become professionals: that is his goal.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар скромная и простая жительница района Яван. Ей 25 лет. Она мать двух детей. Ее муж, братья мужа, свекор и  сама Мунавар работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Мунавар занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур в течение 6 лет. Она благодаря мужу быстро освоила технику выращивания зерновых и огородных культур. Земледелие является основным источником дохода этой семьи. Мунавар усердно работает на грядке, она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Сейчас как вы видите на фотографии, она готовится к сезонному посеву. Чтобы завершить посев, она нуждается в кредите. Мунавар необходимо закупить семена и минеральные удобрения. Она надеется, что ей окажут финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Munavar is a modest and simple resident of the Yavan district. She is 25 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband, brothers-in-law, father-in-law and Munavar work at a dekhan farm. Munavar has been involved in growing agricultural crops for 6 years. Thanks to her husband, she quickly learned the technique of growing cereal and garden crops. Farming serves as the primary source of income for this family. Munavar diligently works in the field; she is a very hardworking woman. Now, as you can see on the photograph, she is getting ready for the seasonal sowing. She needs a loan in order to finish the sowing. Munavar needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. She hopes that she will get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for the seasonal sowing

loans.name: Wenseslao

texts.es: Wenseslao tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, dos hijas de 9 años, 6 años y un hijo de 3 años de edad. Wenseslao es un hombre muy conocido en su localidad como un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable. ÉL se gana la vida trabajando como albañil y soldador y cada día son más los clientes que prefieren sus productos. Con el deseo de brindar un mejor servicio a sus  clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea comprar una pulidora y un aparto para soldar dado que el que posee se ha deteriorado y no brinda un buen funcionamiento. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar mejores servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Wenseslao is 33 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife, two daughters, ages 9 and 6, and his three year old son.  Wenseslao is very well-known man in the area as a hardworking, honest, and responsible man.  He earns a living working as a mason and welder and he gains more customers daily because they prefer his products.  Since he wants to provide better service to his customers, he decided to request this loan through FUSAI so he can buy a polisher and a welder because the one he has is deteriorated and doesn’t work well.  He hopes to get this loan so he can provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 19 year old single lady. Carolina helps her mother to run a family food stall business.  The business has been running since last year.  While she takes care of food stall business, her mother runs a kiosk business. 

Every day she wakes up at 5.30 am to help her mother to cookthe food. She usually starts the food stall business at 8 am to 10 pm every day. She sells rice with side dishes such as fried chicken, fish fried, vegetables, omelets, and tempe (fermented soybean). The income from the business is utilized to help her parents to meet her and young sister education fees.

At the moment Carolina is able to sell up to 15 kilograms rice in a day. She needs more money to purchase more tableware and some ingredients. 
Unfortunately she does not have enough money to do so. She then requested a loan of IDR 6.000.000 from TLM to purchase extra tableware, rice, and kitchen equipment such as a stove and frying pan. 

She looks forward to seeing improvement in her business.

loans.use: to purchase extra tableware, rice, and kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi Group

texts.es: Este es el Nuevo grupo “Virgen De Chapi” conformada por 05  mujeres responsables, la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. Delia se dedica al servicio de luminarias. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su hogar. A futuro le gustaría poner un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de zoquetes, cordones, lacas y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Delia tiene  60 años de edad soltera. El grupo “Virgen De Chapi” agradece el crédito brindado. Delia es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa de color negro.
texts.en: This is the new group “Virgen De Chapi”  and is made up of 5 responsible women, most of them members of the community. Delia makes a living in lights services. She is happy because it was thanks to this effort that she was able to continue to support her home. In the future, she would like to have a restaurant, and she would also like to earn more money. The loan being asked for will be used to purchase boards, cords and lacquers so that she can have something to offer her customers. Delia is 60 years old and single. The group “Virgen De Chapi”  is grateful for the loan offered here. Delia is the third from the left and dressed in black.

loans.use: purchase boards, cords,and lacquer.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
El señor JOSE DANILO de 33  años de edad el vive  con su pareja de hogar y su hijo su residencia habitacional  es en el caserío del Caimito San Lorenzo Valle, su dedicación es vender pan en las pulperías, agua y palomitas de maíz. El se transporta en su carro a los diferentes lugares donde hay negocios para ofrecer sus productos.
Don José Danilo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pan por mayor, agua en fardos, jugos y maíz para palomitas para revender. 
Don José Danilo con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio ya que necesita el capital para mejorar el negocio y tener mejores utilidades que ayudaran a atender mejor a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño de José  es seguir trabajando en su vehículo  para sacar adelante  su familia y emprender otro nuevo negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
JOSE DANILO is 33 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Caimito San Lorenzo Valle settlement.  He sells bread, water, and popcorn in convenience stores and drives his car to the different places where there are businesses so offer his products.

José Danilo is asking for this loan to buy bread, bottled water, juices, and popcorn to sell.

José Danilo wants to improve his business with the help of this loan and needs capital to improve his business and quality of life.  Jose’s dream is to continue working in his vehicle so he can support his family and start a new business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
La señora Noemy de 56  años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, posee casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, doña Noemy se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de elaboración y venta de golosinas como: tacos, enchiladas, almuerzos, cenas, refrescos, y más. Sus clientes le prefieren por su calidad y atención en su negocio. Doña  Noemí es una mujer emprendedora y con deseo de salir adelante.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo de 20,000.00 lempiras ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para capitalizarse en su negocio ya que desea comprar por mayor la materia prima como repollos, carnes, harina, manteca, maseca, condimentos, platos y bolsas desechables y refrescos para elaborar las golosinas. Es un cliente con varios ciclos y está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva.
Doña Noemy sus sueños es mejorar más su vivienda.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Noemy is 56 years old, she is single with two dependent children. She owns her own home in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. 

For several years Noemy has made and sold fast food such as tacos, enchiladas, lunches, dinners, soft drinks. Her customers prefer her because of the quality and her attention to her business.

Noemy is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to get ahead. With the support of this loan of 20,000 Honduran Lempiras she intends to fulfil the capital needs of her business. She wishes to buy wholesale raw materials such as cabbages, meat, flour, butter, corn flour, condiments, disposable plates and bags and soft drinks, to prepare the food she makes.

She has had several previous loans, and is very happy to continue working with Prisma and Kiva. Her dream is to further improve her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy cabbages, meat, flour, butter, corn flour, condiments, disposable plates and bags and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees at her university.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She operates both a  food kiosk and a goat selling business.

She is requests a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar 	vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante. Doña Cecilia es modista aprendió corte y confección hace varios años, como es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y a sacar adelante a su familia instalo un pequeño taller de costura en  su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa ya que conocen la calidad de su trabajo y la seriedad y puntualidad para entregar los mismos. Actualmente está muy ocupada elaborando uniformes ya que se acerca el ingreso a clases de los estudiantes. 
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y otros productos de costura que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Santa Gema Lending Group meets every 15 days in the Tarqui neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many touristic attractions.
Cecilia lives here. She is 62, she is married with four adult children who are independent. Her husband is a businessman. Cecilia is a dressmaker, who learned tailoring several years ago. As a hardworking woman who likes to fend for herself and help her family, she set up a small sewing workshop at home, where she is dedicated to make all kinds of clothes for individuals who come to her house because they know the quality of her work and the and her promptness in delivery. She is very busy right now, making school uniforms since the school year is about to start.
She would like to use this loan to buy yarn, fabric, zippers and other sewing materials to make her clothes. She's been involved with this group for 15 years and she likes it because they provide her with great help. Her dream is to improve and move forward.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabric, zippers and other sewing materials to make her clothes.

loans.name: Santos Leonidas

texts.es:
Santos, está acompañado, junto a su compañera de vida comparten la dicha y responsabilidad de ver crecer a sus dos hijos de 14 y 2 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia. Santos se dedica a la agricultura y atiende una tienda en su tiempo libre, en su negocio le colabora su compañera de vida, en la zona es la única tienda, trabajan todos los días de ocho de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Le ayuda a comprar jugos, detergente, jabón, aceite, arroz, aceite, huevos, golosinas,  gaseosas, pan, etc., ofrecerá más productos a sus clientes, aumentara sus ventas y tendrá más ganancias que le servirán para cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio para mejorar su situación económica y brindar a su familia una mejora alimentación, vestuario, salud y superación academia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is married. Together with his partner, they share the responsibility to see that their 2 children, aged 14 and 2 years, grow. One is studying.
Santos earns his living in agriculture and attends to the store in his free time. The store is the business that his partner works. It's the only one in the area. She works daily from 8 in the morning to 7 in the evening.
The loan will help buy juice, detergent, soap, cooking oil, rice, eggs, candy, soda, bread, and more so he can offer more products to his customers, increase their sales and profits, and have more money that will serve to pay off their debt.
His dream is to straighten his business to improve their financial situation and provide his family with improved food, clothing, health, and education for the betterment of their children.

loans.use: to stock his general store with juice, detergent, soap, and more

loans.name: Om Waled Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Waled and consists of four hard-working women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan 200,000 YER. 

Kobla is a  55-year-old married woman with seven children and lives with them in Sana'a. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She  makes and sells traditional incense. Kobla has run business for many years to help her husband meet the family's expenses. She thinks this business is a profitable. For further expanding, Kobla requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase incense materials.

Kobla expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business  to provide her children with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase incense materials.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
CLAUDIA. Tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su esposo. Sus 3 hijos ya tienen compromisos y desde hace 2 años CLAUDIA atiende su propia papelería que adecuó en la sala de su casa.
Al aproximarse la temporada de clases. Ella precisa un crédito para abastecerse de útiles escolares (cuadernos, esferos, lápices, reglas) y poder atender a los padres de familia que tienen niños en las escuelas y que viven en el barrio.
El barrio donde vive CLAUDIA es algo peligroso. Debido a que varios adolescentes y jóvenes no tienen oportunidades de distracción o trabajo – nos dice CLAUDIA.
Gracias a una amiga, pudimos conocer de los créditos de FODEMI y aprovechando que todos trabajamos juntos, formamos el grupo que hoy tramitamos el tercer crédito. Dando a conocer que nuestros pagos han sido puntuales. Por eso se agradece la oportunidad que se le da a la gente pobre de este sector.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL
Los miembros del grupo viven en un mismo sector, lamentablemente es peligroso ya que se producen asaltos en la calle por parte de adolescentes. De todas formas, los socios de la banca realizan actividades de integración y recreación a través del deporte para distraer a los niños y jóvenes y de esta manera puedan dedicarse a actividades que no atenten la integridad de los habitantes del sector.
NOTA: en la imagen aparecen 3 niños, que acompañan a sus madres quienes autorizan tomar la fotografiacon ellos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 56 years old and lives with her husband. Their three children are already in relationships. For the past two years, Claudia has been managing a stationery shop that is set up in the living room of her house.

Since classes are starting soon, Claudia needs a loan to stock up on school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, and rulers. She will able to meet the needs of parents in her neighborhood who have children in school. The neighborhood where she lives is dangerous. Claudia says that many teenagers and young people do not have work opportunities or other things to keep them busy.

Thanks to a friend, Claudia and her fellow group members learned about the loans from FODEMI. They took advantage of this opportunity by working together and forming a group. As of now, they are on their third loan. They want everyone to know that their payments have been submitted on time. They are grateful for the opportunities that have been given to the poor people who live in this area.

Additional Information: The members of this group live in the same area, which unfortunately is dangerous as a result of street crimes committed by young people. Despite all of this, the members of this Communal Bank engage in integration and recreational sports activities to provide a distraction for children and young people. This prevents them from engaging in activities that threaten the local residents.

Note: In the photo, there are three children who are accompanied by their mothers. Consent was given for them to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, and rulers.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Luz, de 36 años es una persona emprendedora y en busca de ideas de progreso.
Ella se desempeña como vendedora de productos a través de catalogo como lociones, productos de belleza, elementos para el hogar y de aseo, se motivo a iniciar su negocio con el fin de buscar ingresos para su hijo ya que su esposo falleció y a ella le quedo toda la responsabilidad de su hogar.
Siente la necesidad de aumentar su inventario de productos ya que se le agotan muy fácilmente y a veces se queda sin mercancía para vender.
Por eso solicita un préstamo, para comprar mercancía y tenerla siempre disponible para sus clientes.
Al capitalizar su negocio podrá aumentar sus ventas, esto impactara directamente sobre sus ingresos de una manera positiva.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old and is an enterprising woman looking for ideas to help her get ahead.

She sells products, such as lotions, beauty products, and household and toiletry items, via catalog.  She started this business in search of income to support her son because her husband passed away and she took over responsibility for the household.

She wants to increase her inventory of products because they run out quickly and sometimes she has no merchandise left to sell.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise so she can have it on hand for her customers.  She will be able to increase her sales and this will directly impact her income in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have a successful coffee harvest

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio vive en Lima y estudia para ser técnico en electrónica y automatización industrial. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es comerciante ambulante y es pese a su avanzada edad la principal fuente de ingresos económicos en su hogar.
Braulio trabaja eventualmente los fines de semana como mozo en eventos como bautizos o matrimonios para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa a sus padres, ellos lo quieren mucho y lo consideran un muy buen hijo. Sin embargo los gastos superan sus ingresos y pronto tendrá que dejar sus estudios para trabajar a tiempo competo de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Braulio desea culminar sus estudios y laborar en una buena empresa para poder ayudar a su familia y a que su padre pueda tener el descanso que a su avanzada edad merece. El esta sumamente agradecido por toda la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva para seguir sus estudios y lograr sus metas y esta seguro de que tan noble gesto sera recompensado pronto con muchas gracias y bendiciones.
texts.en:
Braulio lives in Lima. He is studying to become a technician in electronics and industrial automation. His mother works as a housewife and his father is a street vendor, who despite his age is the one who sustains the family economically.

Some weekends, Braulio works as a waiter in special events such as baptism ceremonies or weddings in order to help his parents with the home expenses. His parents love him and think that he is a very good son. However, their expenses are greater than their income, so he will have to quit studying in order to get a full-time job unless he gets support from Kiva lenders.

Braulio wants to finish his studies and work for a good company so that he can help his family and take some weight off his father’s shoulders, because he is old and deserves to rest. He really appreciates all the help Kiva lenders give him to continue with his studies and achieve his goals. He is sure that such a nice gesture will soon be rewarded with graces and blessings.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in electronics and industrial automation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tile and iron to build a roof for her house.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis vive en la Ciudad de Chincha junto a su esposa. 
Este joven emprendedor tiene más de 1 año trabajando en una empresa textil para ofrecerle a su esposa todo lo que ella merece.
Sin duda alguna Luis es una persona luchadora que trabaja constantemente para poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Mejorar su vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
Gracias a los prestamistas de Kiva, Luis podrá utilizar ese apoyo recibido para remodelar su vivienda y así tener mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Chincha with his wife.
This young entrepreneur has worked with a textile company for more than one year in order to give his wife everything she deserves. 
Undoubtedly, Luis is a hard worker who is constantly working to fulfill his greatest dream to improve his home an have a better quality of life.
Thanks to Kiva lenders, Luis receives support he can use to remodel his home and, therefore, have greater comfort in his home.

loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Zeidy Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Zeidy de 31  años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, posee casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome  sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de ropa para ambos sexos, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante con los vecinos y amigos de su comunidad.
Doña Zeidy con el apoyo de este préstamo que solicita de 15,000.00 lempiras ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para capitalizarse  su negocio ya que desea comprar por mayor la mercadería para aprovechar la venta del día de las madres ella desea comprar ropa interior, jeans, camisetas, camisas, legins, calcetines y pantalones.
Doña Zeidy es un cliente  con buen comportamiento de pago ya que es una persona muy responsable además está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Zeidy, 31, is single and has no dependent children. She has her own home in the community of Nacaome in the south of Honduras. She has earned her living in the business of selling clothing for both men and women for the past several years. She hits the rounds selling to neighbors and friends in her community. Zeidy requested this loan of 15,000 Honduran Lempiras because she intends to fill her need for business capital. She wants to buy wholesale goods to sell for Mother's Day, including underwear, jeans, t-shirts, leggings, socks, and pants. 
Zeidy is a client with a good payment history since she is very responsible. She is happy to continue working with Prisma and Kiva.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 30 years old. He is single, and enrolled at a private, higher institution. His studies are expected to end in 2014. He has no alternative to pay for his tuition fees. He has requested a Kiva loan to pay for his tuition, since he can’t sit for exams without paying the tuition. After graduation, good opportunities are ahead of him, so he is confident he will be able to repay the loan, help the entire family, and the development of the nation, as well.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees for his studies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old. She has been running a grocery business in Kangundo town for the last two years with a monthly income of 30,000.

She is applying for her fourth loan of KES. 67,500 and she plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables, including potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, for sale. 

She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery shop at the market and supply groceries to her customers. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a green grocer who has been running her business for the past years, with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for her fourth loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, through which she will buy more stocks of bananas, potatoes, and vegetables. This way, she will be able to increase her income. She will use her anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Janet has repaid all of her previous loans. In the future, she wishes to open a general store and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
Jessamin is very thankful for the PHP 50,000 loan assistance extended to him. The loan was utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business. His profits were a big help in the education of his children and in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

Jessamin would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. His earnings from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jessamin hopes to be more financially stable and dreams of owning more hectares of land for farming. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosario Robertina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija mayor de  edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosario y su esposo se dedican al comercio, hace mas de 30 años ellos surtieron una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, la misma que con el paso de los años han ido mejorando y aun mas desde que recibe los créditos los cuales les han ayudado mucho, allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, artículos de bazar y papelería, entre otras cosas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Toda la vida ha trabajo junto a su querido esposo y  así pudieron darle una buena educación a su hija y hoy en les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Santa Gema group meets every fifteen days in the Tarqui neighborhood in the city of Manta.   Manta is known for its lovely beaches that receive visitors every season of the year, and as a city of unequaled beauty with lots of tourist attractions.

Here lives Rosario.  She's 67, married, and she and her husband have an older, independent daughter.  Rosario's husband is a businessman.  

Rosario and her husband earn their living as shopkeepers.  For more than 30 years they have run a small supply store in their house.  Over the years the store has improved, even more so as they have received loans that have helped them a lot.  They sell all types of products, like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, fruit, meat, housewares, stationery items, etc.  They work every day from 6AM until 8PM and sometimes later.  All her life Rosario has worked alongside her beloved husband, allowing them to give their daughter the good education that now gives her the ability to succeed.

Rosario will use this loan to further stock up the store.  She'll buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts, and other basic necessities.  She been with the loan group since it started and she likes it for the helps it provides.  Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Radzhatah

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Radzhatah works hard to support her family.

She has a rice vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a computer shop. Radzhatah is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers for her rice vending business.

Radzhatah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 51-year-old married woman, from the village Zeda Sakara. She lives with her husband, who works at a private company and gets a fixed salary, approximately 400 GEL. Maia is temporarily unemployed, in spite of her high education, and this is the only source of income for their family.  The family belongs to the subsistence-poor category, as they have insufficient income for covering basic needs and everyday expenses. 

According to the above-mentioned situation, Maia lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Maia to get a loan of 500 USD and start a trading business. She plans to purchase various kind of home products at wholesale prices and will sell door-to-door in her community. This will give her a chance to earn an income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program, she will be able to make savings and provide better future. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a trading business with home products

loans.name: Honest

texts.en:
Honest's banana yield increased tremendously over the last season. She made enough profit to pay her children's tuition and meet their other needs, not forgetting to save, in order to buy a cow.

The results from the use of manure were rewarding, and now she wants to buy more manure for fertilizing her banana plantation, thereby increasing her yields. She is hardworking and determined. She thanks the Kiva lenders for standing by her side.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her banana plantation, to improve the yield

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last ten years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly; due to this  he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Maqsood has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Maqsood is so thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of rickshaw maintenance

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 7 hijos: 3 hombres y 4 mujeres, se dedica a cultivar papa, además se dedica a la artesanía, se dedica al cultivo porque  tiene acceso a terreno para realizar esta labor, Miguel solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 4,000.00 para comprar insumos para la siembra de papa (semilla de papa, fertilizante, abono orgánico y otros) el sueño de Miguel es tener una buena cantidad de capital para trabajar y tener menos deuda.
texts.en: Miguel is 37, he lives in the Sololá municipality of the Sololá department. He has 7 children: 3 boys and 4 girls. He makes a living farming potatoes and also makes pieces of handicraft. He practices the farming because he has access to a plot of land to perform this task on. Miguel is applying for a credit of Q. 4000 to purchase supplies for the farming of potato (potato seeds, fertilizers, organic fertilizers and others) Miguel's dream is to have a good amount of capital to work and have less uncertainty.

loans.use: purchase potato seeds and supplies

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.ru: Хуршида ответственная мать 2 маленьких детей. Ее муж шофер. Хуршида хочет заниматься собственным бизнесом и таким образом помочь мужу экономически. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много позитива и новой информации для себя. Хуршида хочет начать бизнес шитьем и продажей женской одежды. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4200 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и тканей. С полученного дохода она хочет улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khurshida is a responsible mother of 2 little children. Her husband is a driver. Khurshida wants to get involved in her own business and help her husband financially. She participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate. She got a lot of positivity and new information for herself. Khurshida wants to start a women's clothing sewing and selling business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4200 somoni to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. She wants to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics in order to start her own business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Haydee sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores y al negocio de kiosco escolar, la socia vende tortas, galletas, entre otros en su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Haydee continues to manage a business of raising small animals. She also has a school kiosk where she sells sandwiches, cookies, and other products from this business. Haydee wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sodas and other products. Haydee is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete the scheduled installments.

loans.use: to buy sodas and other products.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melinda hopes to buy another tricycle unit and still dreams that all her children will finish their studies and get a good life someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Werlyn Jey

texts.en:
Werlyn Jey is the third child, among the five children of Willie and Josephine. At present only her mother supports them, for her father already died. Her mother works as a vendor.

Werlyn Jey wants to pursue her studies, because she wants to prove that she can help her family out from poverty. For her to achieve that dream, she seeks financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI. She requests a PHP 40,000 loan, with which to pay her tuition. Werlyn Jey hopes that KIVA lenders will approve her requested loan.

loans.use: To pay her tuition

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman who has three, school-going children. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 31, is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman with one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase milk, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married, with four children. With three children currently in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, sanitary pads, and toothpaste.

Wilma has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, sanitary pads, and toothpaste. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, sanitary pads, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman, who has seven school-going children. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has been selling goats at the market, to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices.

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Asanairi

texts.en:
Asanairi is 46 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of the children go to school. Asanairi is a teacher, by profession. He works eight hours a day and has been in service for 18 years. He also farms, for additional income. Asanairi joined the teaching profession, because he wanted to serve the community with the love he has for children.

He intends to use this loan to pay school fees for his children. He does this, because he dreams of having informed children with degrees. Asanairi is a hard-working man. Long distance and little salary are some challenges he faces.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married with seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kwekwe operates a cafe business making staple dishes like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality  as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods: maize flour, wheat flour, rice, onions, charcoal,  and cooking oil for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, onions, charcoal, and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh produce such as chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbages, cassava, chayote squash, and other products.

loans.name: Khaled Group

texts.en:
Khaled is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Asia is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old single woman living with her family in Sana'a. She has four brothers and eight sisters. She is a student in a secondary school. Asia's father is an employee in the public sector and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. The money that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Asia says that her house lacks many of home appliances, and she can't afford this. Unfortunately, her father doesn't have enough money to furnish the house. For this reason, Asia is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances for the house. 

 Asia looks forward to improving the condition of her family. Her dreams in the future are to furnish the house with new furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Hamed Group

texts.en:
Hamed is a group consisting of four woman from Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 190,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Nasreen, 34 years  old, is married with two children. The older child is 6 years old and the younger one is 3 years old. Nasreen is the leader of the group. She has a diploma degree and works in a private school. Nasreen is the only one responsible for her brothers and sisters since their parents passed away few years ago and her salary hardly covers the expenses of her family. 

She is a good chef. She makes delicious sweets and cakes. She decided last year to take advantage of her talent and to start up her own enterprise of making sweets and cakes and then selling them to her neighbors. Currently she sells her products from her house and doesn’t have a store. This business helped her in improving her income. 

Nasreen  wants to buy a lot of ingredients for sweets and cakes, like sugar, to be ready for the increase of demand in the soon-approaching holy month of Ramadan when the demand for sweets and cakes increases, but she doesn’t have enough money. Thus she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Nasreen is looking forwards to opening a store for selling sweets and cakes and distributing her products to other stores.

loans.use: to buy a lot of ingredients for sweets and cakes

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.ru:
Далерчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 26 лет. Он женат и имеет  одного ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Далерчон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. У него имеется высшее образование. Жена Далерчон не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием ребенка.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Далерчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Жена также помогает Далерчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Далерчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Далерчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dalerjon is a happy and hardworking man of the age of 26 years. He is married and has a child. He turned to Arvand for the first time because he learnt that there was a possibility to get financial support. 

Dalerjon lives with his family in a village. He has higher education. Dalerjon's wife does not have any education and is a housewife. She manages the household chores and raises their child. 

In order to have an income for food, Dalerjon has his own business. He works with fattening and selling cattle. His wife helps him with the business. She sells the milk they get from the cattle. 

Currently Dalerjon would like to increase the number of cattle to expand his business. Therefore he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase cattle. Dalerjon hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zokir

texts.ru:
Зокир жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 31 года. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Зокир вместе со своей семьёй живёт в сельском посёлке. Он очень любит свою семью и делает всё возможное, чтобы у них было всё необходимое для достойного проживания. Зокир занимается земледелием, и от этого дела получает доход. Также он подрабатывает на разных тяжёлых работах, связанных с тяжёлой нагрузкой.

Этой зимой он много работал в холодную погоду, в связи с этим он сильно заболел. Сейчас он хочет пройти курс лечения, чтобы вылечиться и продолжить работать. Так как у Зокира сейчас нет достаточной суммы для лечения, он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку медикаментов для лечения. Зокир заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zokir is a happy and hardworking 31 year-old man. He is married and has one child. Zokir and his family live in a rural village. He loves his family very much and does everything possible to have all of the necessities for a decent living. Zokir is involved in farming and earns an income from this business. He also works on various hard jobs, involving heavy labor. This winter, he had worked a lot in cold weather and got very ill due to this. Now he wants to go through a treatment to get healthy and continue working. Because Zokir does not have enough money for the treatment, he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to purchase medicines for the treatment. Zokir thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru:
Рафоат позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Живёт она в большом сельском посёлке. С  молодости Рафоат помогала своим родителям ухаживать за скотом и научилась этому делу. Так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Рафоат выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой, которая ведёт своё дело. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Рафоат вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Она выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Рафоат получает хороший доход. Муж Рафоат также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Рафоат с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Рафоат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Rafoat is a positive and hardworking woman. She is married and has five children. She lives in a large rural village. Since childhood, Rafoat helped her parents looking after cattle and learnt this business. The circumstances were such that she was not able to get higher education due to her family's financial situation. Soon after finishing secondary school, Rafoat got married. Then she became a housewife. 

Together with her husband, Rafoat tries to do everything possible in order to provide her children with everything necessary. In order to have a stable income for food, Rafoat and her husband started a business. They work with livestock breeding. She raises cattle, and then sells the meat and milk from them. Rafoat gets a good income form this business. Rafoat's husband also works as a local master carpenter and his work brings the family an additional income. Their overall income is enough for living at an average standard. Still, they do not have enough money to cover all their needs. 

Currently Rafoat and her husband would like to purchase some additional heads of cattle to fatten. Therefore, Rafoat turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase cattle. Rafoat thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will improve the life quality for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, se dedica al cultivo de papa y zanahoria, para realizar esta actividad cuenta con un terreno  con nacimiento de agua esto le permite cultivar en cualquier mes del año, también se dedica a comercializar verduras, Héctor solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 4,000.00 para comprar semilla de papa y zanahoria e insumos, el sueño de Hector es comprar un terreno donde poder un poco más.
texts.en: Héctor is 33, single and lives in the Sololá municipality of the Sololá department. He makes a living by farming potatoes and carrots. In order to perform this activity he has a plot of land with a natural water source which allows him to farm in any month of the year. He also works in the commercialization of vegetables. Héctor is applying for a credit of Q. 4,000.00 to buy potato and carrot seeds and supplies, Héctor's dream is to purchase a plot of land allowing him to produce a little more.

loans.use: purchase potato and carrot seeds

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Умед молодой и добродушный парень в возрасте 27 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Умед очень трудолюбивый и он очень любит свою семью. Он старается, чтобы его семья не нуждалась ни в чем. Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход в семье, он занимается собственным бизнесом. Умед занимается животноводством. Данный бизнес он начал уже более двух лет назад. Жена его не работает, она сидит дома и занимается воспитанием детей. Так как их дети ещё совсем маленькие, за ними нужен хороший уход.

Умед уже неоднократно брал кредит для расширения  своего бизнеса. Данный бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, но потребности его семьи увеличиваются и ему необходимо получать больше дохода. Сейчас Умед хочет построить хороший забор для своего дома, так как прежний уже сломался. Ему необходимо закупить строительные материалы, а именно доски для построения забора. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку досок для построения забора. Умед надеется на поддержку и заранее благодарит Арванд.
texts.en:
Umed is a young and good-natured man of the age of 27 years. He is married and has three children. Umed is very hardworking and he loves his family very much. He strives for his family to not be in need of anything. In order to have a stable income for his family, he has his own business. Umed works with livestock breeding. He started this business already two years ago. His wife does not work, she stays at home and raises the children. As their children are still very small, they need good care. 

Umed already took a loan several times to expand his business. This business brings him a good income, however his family's needs are increasing and he needs to get an even higher income. 

Currently Umed would like to build a good fence for his house, as the previous one is broken. He needs to purchase building materials, specifically boards for building the fence. Therefore he turned to Arvand to bet a loan to purchase the boards. Umed hopes for support and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to purchase boards for building a fence

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 41-year-old woman from Maynaguri. She is a housewife. Her husband Sanjay is a manager of a local garden. She lives with her husband and two children. She and her husband both have completed secondary level education. Both of her children are now receiving education at graduation level.

Though her husband is a manager, his income is not sufficient for running household expenses and covering their children’s education as well. That is why Anima has to face lots of financial hurdles. For this reason she decided to help her husband and contribute to her family on her own. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine for making cotton garments: blouses, petticoats, frocks, etc. As she has a sound knowledge of stitching from her childhood, she has chosen this tailoring business to start. She hopes she can earn sufficiently from this business because there is no good tailor nearby. People have to go to the proper town to fulfill their need. 

Due to this demand for daily use garments in her locality, Anima started her new tailoring business with a hope that she will earn a big profit. With the profit, she hopes to give more education to her children, so as not to have them affected by poverty and to compensate for the family’s financial hurdles.
Now Anima is becoming a renowned tailor in her locality and gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start her own new tailoring business.

loans.name: Gelacio

texts.en:
Gelacio previously obtained a 13,000 PHP loan, which he used to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 19,000 PHP. He will use it to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and to pay the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness, and thankfulness in his heart.

Gelacio still dreams of having another tricycle unit, and hopes that his child will be able to finish schooling. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 36-year-old man from Kisumu city, in the western part of Kenya. He supports four people in his family. He has four children, who are eleven, eight, five and two years old. He supplies water to his customers, a business he has been doing for the past four years. He generates a monthly income of KES 8,900.

He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase another hand cart for water distribution. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business, and to educate his children. His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase another hand cart for transporting water.

loans.name: Justo Hugo Jacinto

texts.es:
Justo vive en Camaná con sus 6 hijos y sus nietos. Este hombre emprendedor desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como chofer para poder apoyar a su familia.

Es un hombre muy responsable y luchador a quien no le importa trabajar de noche y llegar casi en la mañana a su hogar solo porque quiere ver feliz a sus nietos.
