Day after day, Geyler pushes himself to get ahead; this is why he has been working as a farmer for four years, farming cacao. This has allowed him to generate income to be able to pay for household expenses and to get ahead.

Geyler is grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to maintain his crops as well as buy compost, fertilizer, and other things. Because of this, he will have a better harvest and be able to improve his income so that he can continue fighting to be able to realize his greatest dream: "To give my family a better quality of life."

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer, pay for maintenance, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Rostro de Jesús se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Manuel, tiene 38 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta salir adelante a través del trabajo, el trabaja como vendedor de una empresa de jugos por toda la ciudad, pero  también en sus ratos libres y con la ayuda de  su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa,  los fines de semana instalan un pequeño local en las calles del Mercado de Tarqui lugar en el cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, también en su casa tienen mercadería que su mujer se encarga de vender. Tiene más de 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual  salen adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para él. Sus sueños tener un gran local en el centro.
texts.en:
The credit group "Rostro de Jesus (Face of Jesus)" meets every 15 days in the Miraflores neighborhood, in the city of Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are heavily visited in all seasons of the year as well as for being a city whose beauty is unmatched with many tourist attractions.

Manuel lives here. He is 38 years old and married. From this union, he has three children. One is in college and the others are in school. His wife is a salesperson.

Manuel is a hardworking man who likes to get ahead through his work. He works as a juice salesman throughout the city, but in his free time, with the help of his wife, he also sells clothes. On the weekends, they have a small booth in the streets of the Tarqui Market, where many sellers peddle their products. In their house, they also have a store that his wife is in charge of running. Manuel has been in this business for more than 14 years, and he is doing well.

This loan will be used to purchase slacks, blouses, and shirts. Manuel has been in the credit group for two years, and he likes it because the loans are very helpful to him. His dream is to have a big booth in the city center.

loans.use: purchase slacks, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell in a business she started with an aim of having a source of income to help look after her family. 

Ever-changing customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital affect her business growth, while she dreams of owning a modern boutique. 

Consolata intends to use the loan to stock bedding, like bed covers and bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to stock bedding like bed covers and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 46-year-old married woman; she is the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for many years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she has become famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements efficiently. It’s her fourh year with Kashf Foundation. 

She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to be employed. She wishes to use part of profits on her husband’s health.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material to resell.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en:
Nermin has one child. She works in trade. She previously had no experience working, because her husband's business had been doing well. When her husband's business failed, the family faced a serious amount of debt. At that time, she found a job in a cleaning company. She knew how to clean a house from her experience at her own house. Her husband started working as a driver. The money she earned from the cleaning company was only enough to cover the debts, so she had to find extra work to do. She started to sell one of her friends' products, so she gained experience in selling. 

She is going to buy cleaning products with this loan and sell them, so that she can make more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nermin Hanım’ın  bir çocuğu var ve ticaretle uğraşıyor.  İş deneyimi hiç yoktu.  Eşinin işleri iyi ve güzeldi.  Ancak gün geldi eşi iflas etti ve ciddi borç yüküyle karşı karşıya kaldı.  İş başa düştü deyip,iş aramaya koyuldu.  Bu arada bir temizlik şirketinde iş buldu.  Çünkü,her şey yolundaydı ve iş gibi bir düşüncesi yoktu.  Tek bildiği iş temizlik yapmaktı.  Evden iş deneyimi zaten vardı.  Eşide şoförlük işi buldu.  Çalıştıkları borca gidiyordu.  Dolayısıyla başka işte yapması lazımdı.  İlk etapta,arkadaşının ürünlerini satmaya başladı.  Böylece deneyim kazanmış oldu.  Bu krediyle,temizlik ürünleri alıp kendisine ait ürünleri satacak ve daha fazla para kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 43-year-old married woman. She deals in a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market, and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base, and is able to earn enough through her business.

Balqees is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Zahoor

texts.en:
Zahoor is a 41-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past 10 years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. 

She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy reels of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. Zahoor dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 38-year-old married woman. She has two children.

A year ago, her husband (also shown in the photo) started a small barber shop. He is an expert in hair cutting and styling.  Over time, he has attained a regular list of customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Now he needs to buy packs of combs, scissors and facial products. For this reason, Jamila has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation for her husband.  

Jamila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy packs of combs, scissors and facial products.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 28-year-old married man with two children; he is living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in transport and farming, growing matooke. He faces challenges of competition, bad roads and increased fuel prices. However, he has hopes of having a bigger vehicle for transport, like a lorry or tipper. 

Richard needs a loan to buy tires, a gear box, and the general repair of his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires, a gear box, and the general repair of his vehicle.

loans.name: Gülhan

texts.en:
Gülhan has five children and sells small goods. She makes tarhana (a preserved yogurt soup mix) at home, and at the same time works on prayer rugs and embroiders muslin cloths. She buys children’s clothing to sell at stands in the city’s markets. Gülhan rents; the rent for her market stands, the rent for her home and household expenses add up to a lot. She will use the loan to buy towels and diversify the products at her stand. The more variety she has, the more she can earn. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Gülhan Hanım’ın 5 çocuğu var.  Pazarcılık yapıyor.  Evinde tarhana yapıyor aynı zamanda namazlık işliyor,tülbent oyalıyor.  Çocuk çamaşırı alıyor bunları semt pazarlarına gidip tezgah açıyor.  Bu sefer aldığı krediyle,havlu alıp tezgahını çeşitlendirdi.  Ne kadar çeşit olursa o kadar kazanç sağlıyor.  Kirada yaşıyor.  Ev kirası,tezgah kirası,ev giderleri oldukça fazla tutuyor.  Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy towels and diversify products

loans.name: Abalihamu Mbwera Group

texts.en:
Ambrose is a a mobile money agent in Hoima, Uganda. He is 25 years old, and has one child, age 2. He gets additional income from farming. 

He started a business so as to cater to his family's needs; he has hopes of buying a plot, despite the network problem that affects his sales. 

Ambrose is acquiring credit to increase his capital in mobile money business.

He is a member of the Abalihamu Mbwera Group, where members guarantee each other to access credit.

loans.use: to increase his capital in his mobile money business.

loans.name: Züleyha

texts.en:
Züleyha has three children; she works for a cleaning company. She doesn’t have to pay rent because her house belongs to her family. 

Due to health problems, her doctor has told her she is unable to work full time. Her friends at work have helped her; her husband comes and does the work she was unable to, and her coworkers look the other way so that she won’t lose her job. She has to work. 

On Sundays, she has a stand at the local market. She sells dried legumes. 

With this loan she will buy more products to sell.

Her dream for the future is to make home furnishings, a trade she knows. She’ll need more capital to do this, but she believes in time she will be able to.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Züleyha Hanım’ın 3 çocuğu var.  Temizlik şirketinde çalışıyor.  Ancak,bel fıtığı rahatsızlığı var.  Tam zamanlı çalışamıyor.  Doktor çalışmasına izin vermiyor.  İş yerindeki arkadaşları yardımcı oluyor.  Eşi gelip onun yapamadığı işleri yapıyor.  Arkadaşları göz yumuyor bu duruma,işsiz kalmasın diye.  Kendisi zoraki çalışıyor.  Pazar günleri ilçe pazarlarına gidip tezgah açıyor.  Kuru bakliyat satışı yapıyor.Kira ödemiyor ev ailesinin.  Bu krediyle daha fazla ürün alıp satış yapacak.  İlerideki hayali ve çok istediği,bildiği iş olan ev mefruşatları üretimi yapmak.  Bunun için biraz daha fazla sermaye gerek.  Zamanla bunu yapacağına inanıyor.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 41, is a married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. She buys small animals at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals. 

She is very experienced, and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. 

This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alioune, âgé de 65 ans, fait du commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Il est marié et père d’une famille nombreuse. Son activité consiste à vendre des médicaments traditionnels. Alioune vient pour la première fois demander un crédit à l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir acheter les médicaments. 
L’écoulement des médicaments peut ne pas être aussi rapide car il y a toujours un délai pour chaque soin, mais n’empêche Alioune possède une clientèle fidèle grâce à la qualité de ce qu’il vend. Et comme en matière de médecine traditionnel, la publicité se fait de bouche à oreille venant de chaque malade ayant été traité ou guéri par ces produits. 
S’il a les moyens, il aimerait agrandir son espace commercial et renforcer sa pharmacie.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune, 65 years of age, has been in business for over 15 years. He is married and has a large family. He works selling traditional medicines. This is the first time that Alioune is applying for a loan from IMCEC in order to buy medicines.

Medicine does not sell out quickly because healing time, but Alioune has a loyal customer following thanks to the quality of his products. In the field of traditional medicines, advertisement is done is done by word of mouth, by  patients who have been treated or cured thanks to these products.
If  Alioune had the means, he would like to expand his physical space and bolster his pharmacy business.

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines for resale.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 32-year-old married woman. Asia deals in a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Asia is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Asia wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store where she sells different types of cosmetics, bangles, and lace at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field; she has become famous for providing good quality products in her locality. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.

She is a mother of three children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business. 

Currently she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a variety of lace, ribbons, and spools of thread in different colors.  In this way she would be able to cater to more customers. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of lace ribbons, and spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Gloria Islay

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Rostro de Jesús se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 64 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive con ellos. El marido es radiotécnico. 
Doña Gloria tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, legumbres, frutas, carnes, aguas en bidón, sodas, artículos de bazar y variedad de productos,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si algún cliente desea de algún producto, su hija y su marido le ayudan cuando pueden pero es ella que siempre pasa en su local, lleva más de diez años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos para surtir su negocio. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos surte su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Rostro de Jesús Credit Group meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores, in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unequalled beauty, with many tourist attractions. Señora Gloria lives here. She is 64 years old, and she has a common-law marriage, from which she has three grown children, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a radio engineer.  

Doña Gloria has a grocery store in her house, where she sells a variety of products, including grains, oil, detergent, luncheon meat, legumes, fruit, meat, large bottles of water, soda, household products, and other items. She works every day from 6:00 A. M. until 9:00 P. M., and sometimes even later, if a customer wants something.  Her daughter and her husband help her when they can, but she is always in her store.  She has had this business for more than 10 years, which has allowed her to produce earnings that benefit her family. 

She will use this loan to add more stock to her store, purchasing rice, sugar, oil, detergent, luncheon meat, and other products to supply her business. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because she supplies her business with the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, luncheon meat, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman who has been blessed with six children, four of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dzame operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She joined Yehu to get financial support. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton materials for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia has successfully built her business stitching clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she attains a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colors. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and sorghum for processing local gin.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is in the business of shoe making with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). They make beautiful, fancy shoes for ladies. Over time, they have attained a good number of customers and earned a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures. 

It’s Zubaida's forth year with Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials including leather, colorful cloth and plastic soles, etc. In this way they can handle the growing demand of their shoes in the market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including leather, colorful cloth and plastic soles.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is a 22-year-old married woman living in the village of Debinagar at Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. Kanika has studied up to grade five and her husband has completed Madhyamik level education. She is a mother of two children. The elder one is now in grade two and the other is too small to go to school.

She wishes to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products in the local market. By occupation, her husband is associated with electrical works. Her husband does not earn enough, so she decided to start a milk-selling business to run her family smoothly. She has applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow to start her dairy business. Kanika is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dreams, which is to save money to give a good future to her children. She also dreams of building a Pakka (concrete) house for her family with her business profit.

She gives thanks to BJS and Kiva for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is a 41-year-old woman from the rural village of Sahapara in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school up to grade eight.  Her husband Sajal, 52 years old, is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live with their two sons who are students. One of her sons is appearing for Madhyamik (an exam at the end of the 10th grade) and the other is in grade 9
. 
She is a hard-working entrepreneur who struggles to give her children everything they need. Jharna and her husband are engaged in a business of making 'BORI' (a conical ball made of pulp used in vegetable curry in India).  They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family. For this reason, Jharna requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more ingredients for their product, in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business income from it.

Jharna dreams of earning more profit from her business and hopes to have a comfortable life, give a good education and better future for her sons, and further expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make 'BORI' (a conical ball made of pulses pulp)

loans.name: Mamuni

texts.en:
Mamuni is a 27-year-old married woman and her husband is 45 years old. She has completed her graduation. They have no children. Her husband is associated with a small business selling clothing door to door. Mamuni helps her husband in this business. But due to a lack of money, her husband could not purchase a large variety of good quality clothes. Thus, they are unable to fulfill the needs of their customers.
 
Mamuni decided to help her husband by taking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, of INR 5,000 to purchase a lot of different types of clothes as per the demand. They have a plan to open a shop of their own so they can do business on a larger scale and reach more customers.

Mamuni thanks BJS and Kiva a lot for their funding support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 31 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. He also supports two adult dependents. He is a farmer, driver, and also has a barber shop. He would like to develop his business.

He makes an estimated monthly income of 17,100 KES. He would like a loan of 30,000 KES, with which he will buy a new shaving machine to offer more and better services to his clients. 

He has one employee and has also successfully repaid all his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy another shaving machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been farming for five years. She would like to improve her her farming to support five people. 

Currently she makes an estimated monthly income of KES. 25,000 .She would like a loan with which she will buy more seed for planting and therefore increase her crop yield and income. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She would like a loan of KES. 20,000.

With her anticipated profits she will improve her farming. In future she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy more seed for farming

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 26 years old. He is single and has been running his business for the past 10 years. Currently he makes an estimated monthly income of KES.11,500. 

He would like a loan of KES.10,000 with which he will buy fertilizer for farming and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming and feed for the animals

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two children. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, through which she will expand her business. She has been running her business for the past two years.

She would like a loan of KES 20,000 to buy stock for her general shop, like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sweets. Her estimated monthly income is KES 55,000. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, such as dresses, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his 4 siblings and his parents. He is a first year university student majoring in accounting. Hasan also works as an accountant at a supermarket. He is planning to find a better job after graduation allowing him to support his family. But now he doesn't have the money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 50-year-old married woman. For about five years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to build a clientele that enables her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her work. With these, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 25-year-old lady. She has been running a beauty parlor at the corner of her house for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

Tahira needs to build her clientele of regular customers. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and is confident that it will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Aivazbiko

texts.ru:
Айвазбико хрупкая, но сильная волей и духом женщина. Несмотря на свою молодость она прекрасная жена и любящая мама шестерых детей. Четверо  детей выросли и стали ей помощниками и всячески помогают ей во всем - в хозяйстве по дому и в скотоводстве. Но Айвазбико не забывает о учебе детей и старается, чтоб ее дети выросли грамотными. У нее самой среднее образование и из-за обстоятельств того времен не смогла получить высшее образование, ведь со школьных времен ей пришлось зарабатывать и помогать родителям. Поэтому хочет, чтоб ее дети получили, то что она не смогла получить во время учебы, ведь сегодня вырасти грамотного ребенка входит в обязанности каждого родителя.
 У нее семи летный самостоятельный опыт в сфере скотоводства. На сегодняшний день у нее одна корова и три овец. Муж работает в строительстве и также помогает жене в скотоводстве. У них небольшой коровник, но большой сарай, куда каждое утро выводит скот. Айвазбико начинает свой "рабочий день" с рассвета и заканчивает закатом солнца, ведь у нее большой земельный участок и с весной начинается сезон посевов. И так это нежное создание своим трудом и потом зарабатывает на жизнь, помогая этим мужу и для благополучия своих детей. 
Айвазбико прежде никогда не брала кредит. Доверилась Арванду в этом плане и обратилась за кредитом. На приобретенные деньги хочет купить теленка и корм для скота. Очень надеется, что ей помогут и заранее благодарит "Кива" за содействие.
texts.en:
Aivazbiko is a delicate woman, yet she is  a person of fortitude and strong spirit. In spite of her youth, she is already the loving mother of six and a devoted wife. Four of her children are now old enough to help her out in every way: in the household as well as with the livestock. Still, Aivazbiko does not neglect her children's  schooling and wishes them to grouw up educated. She herself  has received only secondary education as she was unable to go to college back in the day, having to earn money and help her parents from her school days on. This is why she would like her children to have the opportunities she did not have, since today all parents' duty is to ensure their children's education.

Aivazbiko has seven years of experience in raising livestock. At present she has one cow and three sheep. Her husband works in construction and also helps his wife in the livestock business. They have a small cow shed and also a big barn to which they bring the animals every day. Aivazbiko starts her work day at dawn and ends at dusk since she has a large land plot, and spring is the planting season. And thus this fragile woman works extremely hard, helping her husband support the family and ensuring the well-being of her children.
Aivazbiko never took out any loans before.  This is the first time she felt comfortable reaching out to Arvand and applying for a loan. She would like to use this money to buy a calf and animal feed. She really hopes to obtain support and thanks Kiva for its help in advance.

loans.use: to buy  cattle  feed and a calf.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman who is in the business of selling animals. She buys small animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices. After raising them for a year or two, she sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For the improvement of her business she applied for a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Twelve years ago she started business selling milk with the help of her husband. Now she has 3 cows and 4 buffaloes. She has attained a good number of customers. She has a very good credit behavior with Kashf and currently she is in her 4th loan cycle; she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She wants to increase milk production to meet customer needs and demands. She wishes to use part of her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata lives in the small town of Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri District with her husband Kartik. Mamata is a 46-year-old married hardworking woman. Mamata has one daughter who is already married.
  
Her husband is a farmer by profession. They have their own land where they cultivate a variety of crops. His husband sells the crops to the wholesale market after the harvest. Now Mamata and her husband plan to cultivate jute and decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy seeds and fertilizers. She has decided to grow jute as jute is in demand and profitable in their area. She hopes she can generate more income through this harvest. She hopes to purchase a mini-tractor for her agricultural work with the profit from her jute business. Now Mamata is running her business successfully.
 
She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for jute Cultivation.

loans.name: Manaka

texts.en:
Manaka is a 31-year-old housewife from the remote village of South Gobindanagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Together with her husband, she is raising three children.  She is married to Jatindranath who is 36 years old.  Both Manaka and her husband studied up to grade eight.  All of their children are engaged in their studies and go to school. They live in their own small mud-built house.

Manaka's husband runs a grocery shop in their locality.  It is the only source of income for the family. He purchases various grocery items needed for his business from the wholesale market.  His earnings were not sufficient to bear their children's educational and household expenses.  They are facing problems due to the growing price of essential commodities. 

Manaka has decided to help her husband.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to expand the business.  With the loan, she wants to purchase grocery items like rice, oil, biscuits, lentils, flour, soft drinks etc. to increase the stock in her business.  If they can increase the stock in their grocery shop, they can attract more customers and earn more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children’s educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Manaka dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to build a concrete-made big grocery shop.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for their existing grocery shop.

loans.name: Menoka

texts.en:
Menoka is a 26-year-old housewife. Her family consists of her husband and two daughters. Her husband Jagannath, 30 years old, is engaged in agriculture. They live in their own house in the small village of Upenpally in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Menoka’s husband is an experienced farmer. With the help of his wife Menoka, he works hard in their agribusiness.  They grow green vegetables on their own piece of land. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, and that is an important source of the family income.   To continue running the agricultural business in a sustainable way, Menoka has decided to cultivate jute. Menoka heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives loans to rural women for business.  She needs the loan to purchase jute seeds and buy some fertilizers to start cultivation of jute.  She has chosen this business as the product is in great demand and value in the market. She dreams of providing the family with a decent lifestyle and give s proper education to her children with the profit from their new business.

Menoka and her husband sincerely rely on the goodwill of the lenders (BJS and Kiva) and will appreciate their support for giving them the needed loan.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 25-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the best living.

Amer started working, fixing car bodies, when he was eight years old. His childhood wasn't impressive at all since he didn't know the meaning of being a child. In 2002, Amer started his own business. He started working in the backyard of his house, which is located in a Palestinian camp, and still does. 

Amer has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles. His previous Kiva Youth Loan was used to build a roof for his workplace, which improved his business and helped him update his tools. Now he has applied for a new Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, which he will invest in establishing an additional business to cover his family's increasing needs. He will open a fruit and vegetable shop that will provide him with a daily income and cover most of his family's needs.

He hopes to stay capable of expanding his business, increasing his income and providing his family with a good living and his children with a special loving and caring childhood.

loans.use: To open a fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas  está en el 1er ciclo, son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren mejorar sus vidas, motivo por el cual incorporaron  actividades varias aparte de sus actividades actuales.
Una de ellas es Ursulina, una mujer muy trabajadora que vende bebidas, y es por medio de este trabajo que ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, empezó con muy poco pero se fue abriendo camino, es por eso que pide este préstamo, ya que quiere surtir su negocio y comprar más bebidas para seguir vendiendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is in its first cycle. Every woman is very entrepreneurial and wants to improve her life, which is why they incorporated various activities aside from their current activities. 

One of these women is Ursulina, a very hardworking woman that sells drinks, and it is by way of this work that she helps her family and loved ones. She began with very little but she has been making headway. This is why is is asking for this loan, as she wants to stock her business and buy more beverages to continue selling. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy various types of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman who has been blessed with four school-going children. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mupa operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. 

Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. With this loan, Mupa wants to purchase charcoal for resale and pay for transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 25-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Safia’s husband. She is providing cooking services in her locality with the support of her husband. She enjoys making food and has become famous in her town for proving these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then delivers it to the respective places. She is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of oil, rice, flour, grains and spices. In this way she will be able to increase her sales. Safia wishes to utilize her earned profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, rice, flour, grains and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 61 años de edad, casado, con 7 hijos, de los cuales 6 son mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 22 años que cursa su cuarto año de carrera universitaria. Desde hace más de 3 décadas, estableció  su taller de mecánica y vulcanización. Con el objetivo de ampliar su microempresa solicita financiamiento para comprar equipos y materiales para su taller: angulares, laminas y varillas para soldar, máquina de soldar y taladro. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y salir adelante, debido a que hace 7 años fue víctima de un robo en su taller  y poco a poco ha venido prosperando, con capital propio y los prestamos anteriores con PANA PANA.
texts.en:
He is a hardworking man, a native of Puerto Cabezas, who is 61 years old and married with seven children. Six of his children are independent adults and the youngest, who is 22 years old, is in his fourth year of university. 

More than three decades ago he opened his machine and vulcanization shop. With the objective of expanding his micro-business, he is requesting financing to purchase equipment and materials for his workshop: angle braces, sheeting and welding rods, a welding machine and a drill. 

His dream is to expand his business and get ahead because seven years ago he was the victim of a robbery in his shop and he has been prospering little by little with his own capital and earlier loans from PANA PANA.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials for his shop: angle braces, sheeting and welding rods, a welding machine and a drill.

loans.name: Manobala

texts.en:
Manobala is a 32-year-old married woman from Maynaguri. She lives there with her husband Dino and two children (one son and one daughter). Both Manobala and her husband are illiterate and able to sign only their names. Both the children are now studying in different classes (grade seven and one). Though Manobala is illiterate and ignorant, her full intention is to care for her children and not allow poverty to affect them.
  
Manobala’s husband is a small farmer who cultivates limited vegetables and sells them in the local market. He is the only income holder in Manobala’s family. As the children are growing up, Manobala is facing many problems running her family and paying her children’s education expenses. For this reason, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation. She chooses to cultivate jute, as it is one of India’s most valuable crops and it is in great demand in her locality. She hopes she will gain a huge profit by selling jute in the wholesale market. With the profit from her jute business, she dreams of giving a better education to her children and admitting them to higher secondary schools.  

Manobala is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi, who is 25 years old, is married and a mother of two sons, both of whom are below school age.  She attended school up to grade nine due to her parent’s poor financial condition. They live in the small village of Mauyamari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Madhabi’s husband Prodip, 27 years old, is involved in agriculture.  The financial condition of the family fully depends upon their agribusiness. He grows vegetables and sells them to the neighbors, relatives and others. But his income is too scant to meet all the necessary expenses of the family.  In order to increase their household income, Madhabi has decided to cultivate chilies on their farmland. This crop is in demand in their area.

Madhabi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase chili seeds as well as fertilizers. She is very much hopeful that the business will be a lucrative one. Her plans and goals for the future include expanding their agribusiness for the family's well being and enhancing their financial status to build a stable lifestyle. As a mother, she wants to give her continued support to her children as much as possible with the profit from her business.

She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating chilies.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
San Ramon es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, donde cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar y mejorar sus vidas.
Lourdes es una de las integrantes, que busca mejorar su vida, a través de su trabajo, que es la venta de ropa, ayuda a su familia con esto, y les da todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Ramon is a new group. It is in its first loan cycle where each of the members is doing her best to get ahead. They are taking the poverty elimination survey, which will enable them to become familiar with their circumstances, and to work accordingly to improve their lives.

Lourdes is one of the members who is looking to improve her life through her clothes selling business. She helps her family in this way and gives them everything that she was not able to have. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a variety of garments since the cold season is coming and she wants to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase winter garments to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Bertha

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudadela Divino Niño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Divino Niño  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, uno aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es conserje de una universidad local.
Doña Rosa tiene una  tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, legumbres, frutas, carnes, aguas en bidón, sodas, entre otras cosas, allí también vende productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas),  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si algún cliente desea de algún producto, también en ocasiones sale a vender sus productos de catalogo aunque estos también los vende en su local, ella llevan más de 18 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo propio y con esto  cada día mejorar su calidad de vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, etc.  para surtir su negocio. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los crédito mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son tener la mejor tienda del lugar.
texts.en:
Ciudad del Divino Niño Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Divino Niño neighborhood in the city of Manta.  Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Rosa lives.  She's 52 years old and married, and has two adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives with them.  Her husband is a caretaker in a local university.

Rosa has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of products: grains, oil, detergent, cold cuts, vegetables, fruits, meat, containers of water, and soda.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).

She works every day from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m., sometimes later if some customers needs something.  She also occasionally goes out to sell her catalogue products, although she also sells them in her store.  She has had her business for more than 18 years, which has allowed her to earn her own money and, as a result, improve her quality of life every day.

She's going to use this loan to stock her store more.  She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, etc. to stock her business.

Rosa has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because she improves her business with the loans.  Her dream is to have the best store in the area.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, etc.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбару 44 года. Она живет и работает в столице Таджикистана. Дилбар воспитывает одного ребенка. Ее муж таксист. Она занимается собственным бизнесом. Дилбар продает фрукты. Ее лавочка находится на местном рынке. Дилбар постепенно развевала свой бизнес. 10 лет назад она начала с маленьким оборотным капиталом. Вначале ей было очень трудно, так как конкуренция была очень большая. Благодаря упорному труду и терпению она развевала свой бизнес. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал, так как летом все люди покупают фрукты больше всего. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для покупки разнообразных фруктов для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilbar is 44 years old.  She lives and works in Dushanbe, the capital city of Tajikistan.  She is also raising one child.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and she is involved in her own business, working as a fruit vendor. She has a small shop at the local market.  Dilbar has been able to gradually develop her business.  She started 10 years ago with a small working capital.  In the beginning, things were very difficult because the competition was fierce.  However, thanks to her hard work and patience, she managed to develop her business.  She now wants to increase her working capital, because everyone buys more fruits in the summer season.  She is taking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy various fruits in order to increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fruits in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 48-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Aida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James owns a piece of land in Muranga, where he farms to earn a living. He has been doing farming for the past 20 years. This is the main source of income for his family, which includes two school-aged children. He sells milk, eggs, tea, coffee, and vegetables.

One of his major challenges is insufficient money to carry out his farming activities. With this loan he wants to build a grazing unit for his dairy cows. This will give them a good environment for producing more milk, thus increasing his milk sales. He says that his family will benefit through the increased income.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mir

texts.ru:
Мир добродушный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Он женат  и имеет несколько детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Мир живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Мир  занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь для этого. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле  Мир занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  

Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Мир  хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Сейчас он хочет купить несколько голов скота, но у него хватает денежных средств для этого. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Мир заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mir is a kind 55-year-old man.  He is married and has a few adult children who all have their own families.  Mir lives with his wife in a small house in the countryside.  In spite of his age, he is full of energy and of the desire to work for his family.  He works as a farmer and cattle breeder, and owns his own plot of land.  Eight hectares of his land are rain-fed and a smaller portion consists of irrigated land.  Mir grows crops on his land, and his wife helps him by raising and taking care of the livestock.

Since Mir and his wife own a large plot of land, they use it as pasture for their livestock.  They make a good income from their animal husbandry business, and this is the reason why Mir wants to expand his business and increase his livestock headcount.  He currently wants to buy a few head of cattle, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.  He has therefore turned to MDO Arvand to receive a loan and buy some livestock.  Mir thanks Arvand in advance for all their support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a hardworking woman who greatly thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support that has greatly improved her living standards over the years.

Besides the vegetable stall business that Mwanaidi operates, she also runs a charcoal selling business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 21-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her six siblings and her parents. She is a university student majoring in Business Administration in her first year. She is planning to continue her studies until she gets her Master's degree to find a good job in her field, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Adidjétou

texts.fr: Femme d’un chauffeur, Adidjétou est âgée de 45 ans et  est maman  de 04 enfants qu’elle ne cesse de chérir. Adidjétou  est revendeuse de profession. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de vêtements en friperie  au marché de Hedzranawoé . Elle mène son activité toute seule  depuis les années 2003 . C’est la seconde fois que  cette cliente de WAGES sollicite un crédit de 600 000 F C FA remboursable en 12 mensualités. Avec ce crédit, elle compte acheter divers habits à la mode .
texts.en:
Married to a driver, Adidjétou is 45 years old and is the mother of four children she continues to cherish.

She is a retail merchant by profession. Her business is to sell second-hand clothes at the Hedzranawoé market, and has been performing this activity on her own since 2003.

For the second time this client of WAGES has requested a loan of 600,000 CFA francs, repayable in 12 monthly installments. With this loan she intends to buy various fashionable clothes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maya 1 Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Maya 1 group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Zeinab is a 20-year-old single lady who is the sole breadwinner to three other members of her family. She has been working as a tutor since 2012, and is selling women's veils from her house to support her family and cover their living expenses since six months ago.

Today, Zeinab is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released veils for her summer collection.

She hopes that one day she will open her own separate shop selling veils to develop her business and living.

Zeinab is the lady sitting at the far left side of the picture. Maya is at the center, while Batoul is the lady at the far right.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released veils for her summer collection

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr:
Fallou est un jeune de 30 ans qui s’active dans le commerce depuis quelques années. Il est célibataire sans enfant et vit encore chez ses parents. Il fait parti des premiers clients de ce guichet de l’IMCEC ; et a besoin d’un crédit puisse que son capital n’étant pas consistant, afin d’acheter des tissus pour les revendre. Fallou fait du « bana-bana » comme on appelle ici les marchands et avec les recettes, il participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. 
Fallou rêve de devenir un grand commerçant, d’ouvrir un magasin de tissus et de diversifier la marchandise pour cela il a besoin de l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en: Fallou is 30 years old and he has been actively involved in retail for a few years.  He is single with no children and still lives with his own parents.  He is one of the first customers of this particular branch of the UIMCEC.  He needs a loan because his capital is inconsistent and he wants to buy fabrics for resale.  Fallou is involved in what the local people call "bana bana", which means that he works as an itinerant seller.  With the money he makes, he contributes to his family's day-to-day expenses.  Fallou's dream is to become an important retailer one day, to open a fabric shop and to diversify his merchandise.  For all this he needs support from the UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fish by the carton, fufu (starchy food made from cassava), etc.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
In the last year, Suad applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders and purchased new living room furniture. That loan helped her improve the condition of her house.  

After she finished the repayment of the installment of the first loan, she applied for a second loan of 190,000 YER (Yemen rials) from Kiva lenders in order to purchase the furniture for the rest of her home. She is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the rest of her home.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es: Es un señor amable, tiene 32 años de edad, casado, con 2 hijos menores de edad que cursan su pre-escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de 11 años de ser docente. Desde hace 5 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, clavos, madera rustica y madera cepillada. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas y apoyar al desarrollo profesional y humano de sus hijos.
texts.en: He is a nice 32-year-old married man with 2 young children in preschool.  He has 11 years of experience being a teacher.  For 5 years, he has lived in a stilt house made of wood.  Towards the aim of improving his home, he is asking for his third loan to buy construction matierals: zinc metal sheeting, nails, crude lumber and planed wood.  His dream is to offer his family a home in adequate condition and to support the professional and personal development of his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: zinc metal sheeting, nails, crude lumber and planed wood

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es un grupo nuevo, que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y cada una ayudar a sus familias. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia quien es vendedora, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida donde vende todo tipo de productos a las personas de su barrio.
Julia quiere salir adelante por medio su esfuerzo y su sacrificio, y es por eso que está luchando. Ella pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is a new group whose members strive to move forward and help their families.  One of the members is Julia, who is a saleswoman.  She has a well-stocked small grocery where she sells all kinds of products to the people in her neighborhood.  

Julia wants to move forward through her efforts and sacrifice, and this is what she fights for.  She is asking for this loan to be able to supply her business with all kinds of products, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other products. This will allow her to continue growing and working.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other products

loans.name: Hasna Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hasna's Group and it consists of three women. They have applied for a second loan from Kiva lenders of 90,000 YER.

Hasna asked for the first loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase construction materials for the maintenance and renovation of her house. 

Now Hasna has finished the repayment of the first loan installment, she has applied for a second loan. She will use her portion of 30,000 YER from this second loan to expand her business by purchasing more women's clothes for resale. 

She and the rest of the members of the group thank Kiva lenders warmly for funding them in their first loan and they hope to be funded again. Hasna is waiting gratefully for your second loan.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old, single Palestinian refugee, who has been working as a barber for eight years. Mohamad was only 11 years old when he had to quit school and start working as a barber to support his family and cover his living expenses.

In 2012, he established his current business and he is working hard on developing it as much as he can. For this reason, he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's Field Partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary updated tools, which will help him improve his business and provide new requested services to his customers.

He hopes to continue developing his business as much as he can to make sure that he can meet most of his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to buy necessary updated tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas trabaja y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo de todas las integrantes el grupo tienen una excelente referencia.
La Sra. Eva que es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata que comenta empezó a vender de a poco,   y que gracias a su trabajo se hizo de muy buena clientela. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por salir adelante.
Solicita de este prestamo para la compra de variedad de joyas, lo que le ayudará a  concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Women Entrepreneurs) Group is in its 11th loan cycle and all the members work and help each other get ahead.  Through much effort and continued work everyone in the group has an excellent credit record.

Eva is one of the members and she sells silver jewelry.  She started out selling a little at a time but thanks to her efforts she now has a very good customer base.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur who struggles to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of jewelry.  This will help her business plan so she can improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried sea cucumber business in the Philippines.

Alicia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her sea cucumber business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, wood, a lamp, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, wood, a lamp, etc. for her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Avelina requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Santos Marina

texts.es:
Santos, opta por un nuevo préstamo por ser de mucha utilidad para fortalecer de manera rápida su negocio comprara yuca, aceite, gas propano, papas, mangos, melones, sandias e insumos agrícolas, seguirá cultivando granos básicos, podrá elaborar la venta de fruta picada y los diferentes antojitos.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha podido mantener se vendiendo y logro tener una cosecha abundante, su economía es más estable y junto a su familia viven en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Santos is requesting a new loan to strengthen her business more quickly.  She will buy yucca, oil, propane gas, potatoes, mangos, melons and watermelons, as well as farm supplies.  She will continue to grow basic grains and sell sliced fruit along with other snack foods.

Her previous loan was used to continue with sales and to produce an abundant harvest.  Her economy is more stable and her family is enjoying better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy yucca, oil, propane gas, potatoes, mangos, melons, watermelons and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ivan Antonio

texts.es: Ivan de 20 años de edad, desde hace 2 años, es el propietario de un Gimnasio de físico culturismo. Él ateniendo sus capacidades técnicas, pues adelanta una licenciatura de Educación Física en la Universidad, decidió  aplicar este importante potencial al emprendimiento de su microempresa, así fue como,  buscando   generar  ingresos asociados a sus aptitudes y fortalezas profesionales invirtió en maquinarias, que les permitieran a la comunidad,  mantener su salud física y mental, mediante el ejercicio físico individual y colectivo, de  los músculos de su cuerpo, agregando como valor a este servicio  asesoría en cultura física.  Sus clientes acuden al local donde se encuentra ubicado y pueden pagarle a crédito o de contado,  pues han sido bien referenciados.  Ivan trabaja diariamente de lunes a domingo,  desde las 7 de la mañana,  hasta las 9 de la noche. Sus   principales compradores son sus vecinos  y los que estos recomiendan, para que aprovechen la buena técnica que ofrece Ivan en su negocio. Su meta es comprar nuevas máquinas, y dotar con aire acondicionado  su local, para ofrecer a su clientela un ambiente confortable. Ivan tiene el gran propósito de terminar sus estudios universitarios y perfeccionarse cada día más. Pues su mayor desafío es fidelizar a su clientela con un servicio de calidad, a precios óptimos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará nuevas máquina de hacer ejercicios, y con ello disponer de recursos suficientes, para hacer el mantenimiento de las mismas, mejorando así su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivan, 20, has been running a fitness gym for two years.  He was studying toward a Physical Education degree but decided to go ahead and apply his technical skill by setting up a small business.  He wanted to earn an income based on his professional know-how and skills, and bought equipment so the community could take care of their individual and collective mental and physical health.  Apart from weight training he also offers a consultancy service.

His customers pay on a credit or cash basis, and always come with good references.  Ivan works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  His main customers are his neighbors and people they refer to him because of Ivan's expertise.

His goal is to buy new equipment and install air conditioning in his locale so customers are more comfortable.  His goal is to finish his university studies and perfect his technique.  His greatest challenge is keeping customers loyal through quality service and good prices.

Ivan is requesting a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy exercise equipment.  He wants to have sufficient resources and be able to carry out maintenance as required to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy new exercise equipment.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Fe has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya is a 21-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. She is a diploma student majoring in Accounting, and she is in her second year. She is planning to find a job in her field in the future. Now she is applying for this loan to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon)

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and married, and together they have been blessed with two children. 

She has been selling clothes for the past three years now, and she currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 50,000. She is taking out her first loan of KES 30,000 with which she will buy more clothes to sell to her clients.

She will use her anticipated profits to educate her children and boost her business further. In the future, she hopes that she will be financially stable, will have a successful business, and can educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, utilizo el financiamiento anterior para renovar el inventario de prendas de vestir que ofrece en su negocio, ha logrado recuperar lo invertido con buenas ganancias que le han servido para mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y dan respaldo al pago de la deuda.
Nuevamente solicita capital para mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio, comprara vestidos, ropa interior para ambos sexos, camisas, faldas, blusas y trajes para niños y niñas, con dicha compra podrá mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Mario used his previous loan to buy new inventory for his business.  He was able to earn a good profit which improved his family's life style and enabled him to pay back the loan.

This new loan is to improve the profitability of his business.  He will buy dresses, men's and women's underwear, shirts, skirts, blouses and children's clothing.  This will allow him to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy dressses, men's and women's underwear, shirts, skirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Norma Eugenia

texts.es:
Norma de 43 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos de 21, 23, 18 y 13 años de edad los cuales 2 de ellos estudian, Norma estudió hasta tercer grado y ya no siguio sus estudios, porque era el tiempo de la guerra. Norma trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 25 años, trabajo que aprendió de su mamá, porque su papá falleció cuando Norma tenia la edad de 12 años, para llegar a su trabajo Norma camina 1 kilometro, también se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y mano de obra; para poder obtener una mejor cosecha lo cual aumentara sus ingresos y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Norma sueña con mejorar su vivienda, ampliar su trabajo y darles estudio a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma, 43, is married and has four children, ages 23, 21, 18 and 13, two of which attend school.  She has a third grade education and was unable to continue her education because of the war at that time.  For 25 years she has been working in agriculture, a trade she learned from her mother, since her father died when she was 12 years old.  Norma walks a kilometer to get to work.  She also sells products by catalogue.

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy farm supplies such as corn seed, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and to hire workers.  This is so she can improve the harvest and increase her income in order to give her family a better quality of life.

Norma's goal is to renovate her house, expand her work and give her children an education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and to hire workers.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Mangoty Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras de Mangoty está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, luchando por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia quien a través de la venta de verduras lucha por poder salir adelante. Comenta que al principio empezó con muy poco, pero que con su trabajo y el apoyo de su familia fue creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras frescas para la venta, y así seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
'Emprendedoras de Mangoty', a group of enterprising women, is in its first cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.  They all work and help each other to get along. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which shows two members are below the poverty line, striving to improve each day.

One of the members is Cynthia who struggles to get ahead by selling vegetables. She says that at the beginning she started with very little, but with her work and the support of her family it started to grow.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fresh vegetables to sell.  This way she can continue striving to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and makeup for resale

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Don Ramón     a sus 72 años no deja de ser el primero quien riega sus siembras en su pueblo. El agricultor no deja pasar un día para sembrar maíz desde hace 55 años, cuando ayudaba a su papá a cultivar pipián, ayote y por supuesto, maíz. Poco a poco se fue independizando y 25 años después con su propio esfuerzo y con la ayuda de sus 6 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad, obtuvo su terreno y motores de riego para no dejar de trabajar en temporadas secas.
Don Ramón no fue al colegio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, pero pudo salir adelante. Ahora les da trabajo a personas quienes quieren superarse, también puede sustentar a su familia con los ingresos de la producción y con una pequeña remesa por parte de una hija que vive en Estados Unidos. Sin embargo, ahorita desea aprovechar el invierno pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para cumplir bien su trabajo, es por esto que necesita de un préstamo para comprar abono para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y así ofrecer un producto de buena calidad. Entre sus planes esta solicitar otro préstamo para extenderse a la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ramon, even at 72 years of age, never fails to be the first person watering his crops in his village. This farmer has not skipped a day of planting corn for 55 years.  

He started helping his dad to cultivate pumpkin seeds, squash and, of course, corn. Little by little, he became independent and 25 years later, thanks to his own hard work and the help of his six grown-up children, he got his own land and irrigation engines so he did not have to stop working in dry seasons.

Ramon did not go to school because of a lack of economic resources, but he was able to get along. Now he gives work to people who want to get ahead as well.  He can also support his family with the income from the produce together with a small amount of money from his daughter who lives in the United States. 

However, he now needs to take advantage of the winter, but does not have enough money to carry out his work as well as he wants.  Therefore he needs a loan to buy fertilizer for the corn crops so he can offer a high quality product. 

Among his other plans, he would like to take out another loan to branch out into the rearing of pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crops.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pyapy Mbarete se formó en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad lejana de la zona aun en crecimiento donde muchas de las integrantes hacen actividades eminentemente rurales.
La Sra. Noelia es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos y demás, comenta que con mucho trabajo y lucha pudo empezar su trabajo y que hoy y le va muy bien.
