Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Kuna Pyapy Mbarete is a group that was formed in the city of Curuguaty.  It is an isolated town in an area which is still growing and where most of the members work in predominantly agricultural activities.

Noelia is one of the members.  She breeds and sells barnyard animals, such as chickens, ducks and others.  She says that with a lot of work and effort she was able to start up and now it is going very well.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy animal feed and continue with the work she is doing. 

Everyone is grateful for the opportunity they get to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos todos ellos ya mayores, ella trabaja con su marido, y comenta que empezaron su negocio de venta de materiales hace aproximadamente 14 años, todo lo que obtienen es gracias a sus esfuerzos  y  viven dignamente y pudieron darle una  educación a sus hijos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Silvia, 49, has two children who are now grown up.  She works with her husband.  They started up in business selling building materials approximately 14 years ago.  All they have achieved is thanks to their hard work and they can lead a dignified life and could pay for their children's education.

She is asking for this loan to buy building materials since she has many orders and wants to be able to satisfy all her customers' demands. She is grateful for the opportunity she gets to continue growing.
.

loans.use: to buy building materials to sell.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian hoy tiene 24 años, sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanías, y es por medio de este trabajo que esta saliendo adelante y se gana la vida. El utilizó su préstamo anterior de kiva para poder invertirlo en la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y demás, los que vendió y pudo tener un mejor ingreso.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar sabanas, sobrecamas, hamacas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando y trabajando. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian, 24, continues to work in the sale of handicrafts, and it is through this work that he gets along and earns a living. He used his previous Kiva loan to buy hammocks, blankets, woven sashes and other things, which he sold making himself a better income.

He is now asking for a new loan to buy sheets, duvets, hammocks and others, so he can carry on with his sales, working hard and striving to get along. 

He is grateful for this new opportunity that he is receiving

loans.use: to buy sheets, duvets, hammocks and other things.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Lorenzo está en su ciclo 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan tienen sus actividades que le generan ingresos que les ayuda para una mejor calidad de vida. 
Una de ellas es la Sra. Epifania ella se dedica en criar animales, se mantiene con una actitud de seguir trabajando de manera constante con la ayuda de sus hijos teniendo como propósito mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Epifania solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los productos de suma necesidad para su  trabajo, como ser balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group San Lorenzo is in its 7th cycle of the Women's Committee Program.  All the women work in activities which generate an income for them to have a better quality of life. 

One of the members is Epifania who works in raising animals.  She has a good attitude and works consistently with the help of her children with the aim of improving their lives.

Epifania is asking for this loan to buy products that she needs for her work, such as animal feed.  This will allow her to continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano, las integrantes son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades diversas para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas, y tiene una pequeña despensa, vive con sus hijos y su marido, donde todos en la casa colaboran en el trabajo de la casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne y de más insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
In the San Cayetano group all the members work together and support each other.  They work together in various activities in order to help their families.

Maria is the president of the group.  She sells agricultural products, and has a small food store.  She lives with her children and her husband, who all collaborate with the housework.

She is asking for a loan to buy various products for her food store, such as vegetables, fruit, meat and other supplies.  In this way, she will be able to maintain her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat and other products for a food store.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 12 del programa de comités, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder crecer y salir adelante.
Lucila se encuesta mejorando su situación de pobreza, gracias a su trabajo en la confección que hace, ella es muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que va mejorando gracias a su trabajo.
La Sra Lucila solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas, agujas, para poder seguir vendiendo ropas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is in its twelfth cycle of the Women's Committee Program.  They are all hard working women who above all are fighters.  They are also doing the poverty elimination survey so that they can grow and get ahead.

Lucila is improving her poverty situation according to the survey.  This is thanks to her work in clothing.  She is very good at what she does, which is why her situation is getting better.

Lucila is asking for this loan to buy fabrics and needles so she can continue selling clothes. She is grateful for this opportunity which will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and needles to continue making clothes.

loans.name: Carlos Raúl

texts.es:
Desde pequeño Carlos, de 34 años, empezó a trabajar junto a su padre en actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Poco a poco la necesidad fue creciendo y tuvo que abandonar el colegio. A los 15 años decidió iniciar a trabajar debido a que le fue heredado dos terneros que inmediatamente comenzaron a ser su fuente de ingreso, que luego sirvieron para comprar lo necesario para iniciar en invierno la siembra de frijoles y al poco tiempo de maíz. Sus 18 años de trabajo lo han convertido en un empleador y el responsable de sustentar a su esposa y a sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 10 y 7 años, quienes diario asisten al colegio.   
Este hombre trabajador, comercializa su producto en su comarca, pero sueña con llevarlo al extranjero, donde pueda obtener mejores ingresos. En temporadas es ayudante en un bus y afortunadamente tiene una familia que lo apoya siempre. Ahorita solicita de un préstamo para comprar abono e insecticidas, como el Gramoxon o el Glisofato, para tener una mejor siembra de frijoles. Sus expectativas son altas, pues va a seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su ganado también. Entre sus planes está comprar más tierras para seguir creciendo y realizar con éxito sus trabajos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Since he was little, Carlos, 34, has worked alongside his father in agricultural and livestock activities. Gradually the need for him to work grew and he had to leave school. At the age of 15, he decided to start work because he inherited two calves that immediately became his source of income.  These then served in winter to buy what was necessary to plant frijoles beans and after a short while, corn. 

His 18 years of work have made him an employer and also the person who is responsible for supporting his wife and their two children aged ten and seven, who attend school daily.   

This hard-working man sells his products in his region, but he dreams of selling them abroad, where he can make more profit. At times he works as a helper on a bus and luckily he has a family which is always supportive. 

He is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides, such as Gramoxon or the herbicide Glyphosate, in order to obtain a better harvest of beans. 

His expectations are high, because he is also going to continue working and investing in his cattle. Among his plans is to buy more land to continue to grow and successfully carry out his agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Adjo Afefa

texts.fr: Adjo est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires et ne se fait aider par personnes  vu qu’elle maitrise très bien son activité. Âgée de 55 ans , elle est mariée à un électricien- Industriel dont les revenus ne sont pas fixe. Adjo  a commencé  son commerce en  2011 où elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. C’est ainsi qu’elle  sollicite pour une première fois un crédit de 300 000 F CFA auprès de WAGES remboursable en douze mois pour financer l’activité exercée. Adjo a connu WAGES il y a pas longtemps et a besoin de ce prêt pour l’achat des marchandises insuffisantes sur son étalage. Pour améliorer et accroitre sa capacité, elle pense ouvrir une boutique en bonne et due forme. Ce coup de pouce permettra à cette dernière de mettre de l’argent de côté pour mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Adjo is a retailer of food products who gets help from no one as she truly masters her business. She is 55 years old and is married to an industrial electrician without a fixed income. Adjo started her business in 2011 and gets her supplies from the main market in Lome.

For the first time she is requesting a credit loan of 300,000 CFA francs from WAGES, repayable in twelve months, to fund her business activity. Adjo learned of WAGES not long ago and needs this loan because she has insufficient goods to display in her stall.

To improve and increase the volume of her business, she is thinking of opening an actual store. This boost will enable her to put money aside for future development.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Agbandi

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 36 ans, Agbandi est la maman de deux enfants de 9 et 4 ans qui sont tous les deux scolarisés.  Revendeuse de profession, elle  exerce son activité dans le marché de Hedzranawoé depuis 14 ans déjà.  Agbandi  est une mère formidable pour ses  enfants, elle se bat pour que ces derniers ne manquent de rien. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite serait   essentiellement destiné à l’achat de produits alimentaires. Agbandi compte maintenir son mot d’ordre de toujours « travailler dur pour l’épanouissement des enfants ».Avec ses efforts elle espère un jour agrandir son étalage  et épauler davantage son mari qui est un chauffeur de poids lourd.
texts.en:
Agbandi is a married woman, 36 years old and with two children, a nine-year-old and a four-year-old.  Both her children attend school.  She has been selling food products at the market in Hedzranawoé for fourteen years now.  

Agbandi is a wonderful mother who works very hard to ensure that her children don't lack anything.  She plans to use her loan to buy food products for sale on her food stall.  She always abides by her motto which is 'work hard to improve conditions for the children'.  

In the future, Agbandi would like to expand her stall and be able to help her husband more with the responsibilities of their household.  Her husband is a heavy-goods vehicle driver.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale on her food stall.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse  de profession et âgé de 47  ans, Falilatou est une femme  célibataire avec un enfant. Ayant  le sens des affaires, elle  s’est lancée rapidement dans le commerce et a déjà 22 ans d'expérience dans le métier. Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine dans le marché de Hedzranawoé .Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de  Lomé . Falilatou a une vision très positive de son commerce. Elle détient à son actif 4 crédits de WAGES et avec sa  maitrise de gestion du crédit et de l’épargne , elle sollicite une fois encore un crédit de 300 000 F CFA pour s’approvisionner .sûre de sa  capacité de maitrise des coûts et des sources d’approvisionnement Falilatou à espoir de laisser un bon patrimoine à ses enfants   qu’elle aimerait toujours épauler dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Falilatou is 47 years old, single and has one child.  She is an accomplished business woman who started selling goods 22 years ago.  She sells kitchen utensils at the market in Hedzranawoé, and buys her supplies at the main market in Lomé.

Falilatou has a clear vision for the future of her business.  She already has four loans with the field partner, Wages, and will use her keen business sense to manage this loan of 300,000 francs CFA.  She plans to use the loan to restock her shop and is confident of her ability to manage her costs and sources of supply.

Falilatou would like to support her children in their activities in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags of pure water and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 22 years old and lives in the remote village of Petkathi in Maynaguri town in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Rameshwar, 33 years old and one daughter.  Parbati completed education up to grade 10 at the village school. Her husband studied up to grade eight.  Their only daughter is too small to go to school.

Parbati's husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates different crops in his field. 

Parbati wants to give financial support to her family, so decided to start a milk-selling business. Parbati is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, who provides loans to rural women. She plans to buy a dairy cow.  She will sell milk to her neighbors. Her dream is to have more dairy cattle for enhancing the business to secure their future. 

She is thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Agée de 30 ans, ayaba habite dans le quartier tokoin et vend à la criée des habits fripés dans les environs de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne au marché Hédjranawoé et souhaite diversifier son activité en ajoutant à son commerce des jupes et culottes neuves. 
Ayaba sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son stock par 1 ballot d’habit fripés, 100 culottes neuves et 60 jupes. 
Ce stock lui permettra de réduire les coûts de transport et d’augmenter ses profits.
texts.en:
Ayaba is 30 years old and lives in the Tokoin neighbourhood.  She sells second-hand clothing in her district, and buys her supplies at the market in Hédjranawoé.  She would like to expand her business and begin selling skirts and new underwear.

Ayaba has requested this loan in order to increase her stock by buying a bale of second-hand clothing, 100 items of new underwear and 60 skirts.  This stock will allow her to reduce her transport costs and therefore, increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 1 bale of second-hand clothing and 100 items of new underwear for resale.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. The elder child is studying in class IV (grade four). Both Pratima and her husband have received a primary level education. She lives in the small town of Maynaguri. Her husband is a mason by profession, engaged in a business of centering work on houses. Centering is a type of falsework where the temporary structure upon which the stones of an arch or vault are laid during construction. 

Pratima is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. Now her husband wants to buy some tools and wood for his business. Pratima decided to help her husband and take a loan to purchase materials for the business. With the help of Pratima, her husband will be able to buy wood and prepare foundations for many houses.  With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status.

Pratima is thanking BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: To buy wood to prepare foundations for many houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère  de trois  enfants, Adjo est âgée de 35 ans. Ensemble avec son mari transitaire  ils prennent soin de leurs trois enfants de 15, 12 et 6 ans.  Dans le souci du  bien-être, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de Maïs en 2008.  Pour  accroître   son activité et  toujours maintenir le bon  cap, Adjo souhaite prendre un cinquième  crédit de 500 000 F CFA remboursable en douze mensualités. Elle  avait remboursé les précédents  avec aisance. Ce nouveau prêt servira  à acheter plus de maïs pour augmenter son stock. Adjo travaille du lundi au dimanche  pour augmenter sa capacité de distribution en tant que grossiste et  assurer un meilleur épanouissement pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is 35 years old, married and mother to three children.  Together with her husband, who is a forwarder, she takes care of their three children, aged six, twelve and fifteen years old.  In order to do this, she started selling maize in 2008. 

This will be Adjo's fifth loan with the field partner.  She has requested 500,000 francs CFA which she will use to improve her business by buying more stock of maize.  All her previous loans have been fully and correctly repaid.

Adjo works from Monday to Sunday to improve her wholesale business and to be able to provide better for her family.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Raili

texts.en:
Raili is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in the village of Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and three children (two daughters and one son). She is illiterate and just knows how to sign her name.  All of her children are receiving an education. Raili's husband is a small businessman.  Raili, being a housewife, is very energetic and hard- working.  She is managing her household works. Nevertheless, they live in poverty because their income is not sufficient for their five-member family.

Raili decided to start a milk supply and dairy products business.  She asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Raili will place the cow in a shed located in her yard and start her business of selling milk and milk products (butter, curd, paneer, etc).  She hopes her husband’s business and the family's living conditions will significantly improve with her business profit, and she will be able to give a better education and a better future to her children.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva,

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Akpé Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi vit à Cassablanca, un périphérique de Lomé. Elle a 49 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Ablavi est couturière de profession et a ouvert en 2012 une mercerie où elle vend de divers articles. 
Ablavi s’approvisionne 02 fois dans le mois au grand marché de Lomé.
Elle sollicite un micro crédit pour se constituer un stock et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 20 doublures, 18 lots de fermetures et 03 garnitures.
texts.en:
Ablavi lives in Cassablanca on the outskirts of Lomé.  She is 49 years old and has five children.  By profession, Ablavi is a dressmaker, she opened a haberdashery shop in 2012 and sells various items there.

Ablavi buys stock for her shop, twice a month at the main market in Lomé.  She has requested this loan from the field partner in order to increase her stock holding and improve her business results.  She plans to use her loan to buy 20 rolls of fabric lining, 18 zips and 3 decorative items for resale in her shop.

loans.use: to buy 20 rolls of fabric lining and other items for sale in her haberdashery shop.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Mariée et agée de 50ans, Kafui réside à Lomé dans le quartier Cassablanca. Elle tient une petite boutique des produits alimentaires et de première nécessité depuis 2012.
Kafui vit dans un ménage de six personnes. Elle s’occupe seule de son activité et y consacre plus de 12h par jour.
Très dynamique et pour répondre au besoin de sa clientèle,  elle sollicite ce micro crédit pour acheter 5 bidons d’huile végétale, 4 sacs de riz, 6 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de lait marque PEAK.
texts.en:
Kafui is 50 years old, married and lives in the Cassablanca district of Lomé.  She has been running a small stall selling food products and other necessities, since 2012.  She lives in a household of six people.  She works alone and spends more than twelve hours a day at her stall.

Kafui is a dynamic business woman who wishes to respond to the needs of her customers.  This is why she has requested a loan from the field partner.  She plans to use her loan to buy five drums of vegetable oil, four sacks of rice, six sacks of sugar and two cartons of Peak brand milk.

loans.use: to buy 5 drums of vegetable oil, 4 sacks of rice, 6 sacks of sugar and 2 cartons of milk for resale.

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma is a 28-year-old housewife who is married to Ashim, 41 years old. Their only son is studying in class I (grade one). She has completed her higher secondary education and her husband is a graduate. 

Throughout the day, she manages all the household work and her husband makes himself busy selling his medicines to the local medicine shops. Ruma wishes to extend this business because their medical appliances and medicines are in great demand in her area. There is only one shop far away in the village where the villagers usually buy their prescribed medicines, so she wants to grow her business with more of the necessary medicines and medical appliances but they have no capital to sustain the demands of their locality. 

She came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and requested a loan to buy more necessary medicines and medical appliances for her pharmaceutical business. In the future, she wants to become a good entrepreneur and wants to improve her business gradually with the profit. She hopes, with the profit from her business, to improve her family's condition and admit her children to a renowned school. 

Ruma sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and medical appliances

loans.name: Afiwa M'bana

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans, Afiwa est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique où elle vend des céréales. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs d’haricot et 03 cartons de biscuits.
texts.en:
Afiwa is 49 years old, widowed and mother to five children.  She owns a shop where she sells cereals.  Afiwa buys her stocks twice a month, from wholesalers at the main market in Lomé.

In order to increase her working capital, Afiwa has requested this loan from the field partner.  She will use it to buy four sacks of maize, three sacks of beans and three boxes of biscuits.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of maize,3 sacks of beans and 3 boxes of biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Mawousse

texts.fr: Mariée et mère  de trois  enfants,  Mawousse est âgée de 25 ans et habite dans la ville de Lomé. Ensemble avec son mari informaticien ils prennent soin de leurs enfants de 10, 5 et 1 an. Dans le souci du  bien-être, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des produits cosmétiques et de bijoux dans son salon de coiffure. Dans la perspective d’accroissement de son activité et de toujours maintenir le cap elle souhaite prendre un premier  crédit de 300 000 F CFA pour faire face à ses défis. Ce  prêt servira  à l’achat de mèches et de bijoux. Mawousse  travaille dur pour assurer un meilleur épanouissement pour sa famille, elle prévoit même agrandir son salon dans un avenir proche.
texts.en:
Mawousse is 25 years old, married and has three children.  She lives in the town of Lomé.  Together with her husband, who is a computer technician, she takes care of their children.  The children are ten, five and one years old.  In order to provide for her family, Mawousse sells cosmetic products and jewellery in her hairdressing salon.

She has requested this first loan with the field partner for 300,000 francs CFA.  She will use her loan to expand her business by buying hair extensions and jewellery.

Mawousse works hard to improve the living conditions of her family and would like to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and jewellery for sale in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a 46-year-old lady married to Sudhir in Maynaguri village. They have two sons. One son is graduating and another is in class VIII (grade eight). Shibani and her husband both have completed Madhyamik (an exam after 10th grade) and their Higher Secondary education. 

Her husband runs a business selling clothes door to door and she is a housewife. Due to the lack of money, her husband could not purchase a large variety of good quality clothes, so their products are not up to the mark. They have faced lots of problem running their family and making money. 

Shibani decided to help her husband by taking a loan of INR 10,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase different types of good quality clothes as demanded by the market. There are some risks that clothes, if not sold, will be ruined by rats, ants or water. In spite of that, Shibani’s idea it is a very profitable business for her family’s well-being. She has a future plan to do the business on a larger scale and reach more customers. 

Shibani is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 24-year-old woman married to Jyotish, 30 years old. They live in the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is blessed with three children. Two of them are now totally involved in their studies and one is too small to go to school. Swapna, as well as her husband, is basically less educated and did not complete their school level education. In spite of being less educated, they have a keen interest in giving an education to their children.
 
Swapna is busy with housekeeping work while her husband is a mason who makes foundations for houses in their rural area. The income from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses along with their children’s education. Swapna now decided to give financial support to her husband by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), so that she can help her husband buy more raw materials or supplies like wood, ropes etc. for making more firm foundations for houses. She is very much confident that she can earn more profit by increasing the quantity and quality of those raw materials. In the future, she wants to extend her business to provide her family with better living conditions and to give her best to establish her children. 

She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: To purchase wood and rope to build house foundations

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 33 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two children. She has been running her general store in Tala for five years now. She would like to boost her secondary business, which is farming. Her estimated monthly income is KES 25,000.

Faith would like a loan of KES 15,000, which she will use to buy seedlings and fertilizers for farming. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her anticipated profits will be used for adding farming materials.

Faith hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy farming products such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Antony, a very hardworking farmer who lives in Muranga where he has a small piece of land. 

Antony sells milk, vegetables and eggs. He has been farming for the past 10 years. He is married with two children. His biggest challenge is getting enough laborers for his farm.

Antony wants to purchase an additional dairy cow, which will produce more milk for sale and also for his family’s consumption. He says that this will lead to an increase in his income. As a result, he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of "gari" (cassava) grains to expand her business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Madelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Madelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina works hard to support her family. Silvina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Silvina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Silvina has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Silvina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janette is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Janette has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Janette has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 30 years old and married with two children.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Jenelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina works hard to support her family. Charina is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Charina has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Charina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy a pig to raise and additional feed.

Eva has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pig to raise and additional feed.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 36 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jenny has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Jenny would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 45 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, coffee, milk, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, coffee, milk, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. 

Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, coffee, milk, soft-drinks and laundry soap to sell.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra works hard to support her family. Lyra is married and has a welding business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her shop.

Lyra has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Lyra would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her welding business

loans.name: Lilian Aracely

texts.es:
Lilian, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos, su esposo es Agente de Seguridad Nacional, sus hijos estudian, viven en casa propia, Lilian es enfermera pero no ejerce por el momento su profesión, por la necesidad de cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia instalo una venta de ropa y otros artículos, no representa ninguna dificultad por el momento.
Con el crédito contara con los recursos económicos que le permitan realizar la compra de blusas, camisas, toallas, pampers entre otros artículos que necesita para surtir bien su inventario y hacer que su negocio se mantenga ofreciendo los productos que sus clientes buscan.
Su sueño es tener una mejor situación económica pare remodelar su casa y brindar a su familia un techo más seguro.
texts.en:
Lilian lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is an National Security Agent. Her children go to school. They live in their own home. Lilian is a nurse but she doesn't practice her profession right now. In order to cover her family's basic needs, she opened a store to sell clothing and other items. She has had no problems with it at this time. 

With the loan, she will have the financial resources to buy blouses, shirts, towels and diapers, among other items that she needs to stock her inventory and maintain her business by offering products that her customers seek. 

Her dream is to have a better financial institution to remodel her house and offer her family a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, towels, diapers and more.

loans.name: Hamamt Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
Hamamt Al-Salamt is a group consisting of four members. They have applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB.

Hana is the leader of the group. In the beginning, Hana asked for a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase food materials including flour and sugar to make traditional food and sell to her customers. That loan helped her in developing her business. After Hana and the rest of the members of her group finished the repayment of the first loan, Hana applied for a second loan of 70,000 YER from Kiva's lenders. She and the rest of the members of the group thank Kiva lenders for funding them in their first loan and they hope to be funded again in this group. Hana will use the second loan to enlarge her business through purchasing ready-made women's clothes to sell to the customers in her area. She found this business is more profitable than selling food.

loans.use: to enlarge her business through purchasing ready-made women's clothes to sell to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Nael

texts.en: Nael applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders last year to buy more honey and natural oils, and that loan helped him to meet the demands of his customers. After he finished the repayment of the first loan, he applied for a second loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase more of the excellent honey to sell to his customers. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for the first loan that helped him to improve the condition of his business and his family.

loans.use: to purchase more of the excellent honey to sell to his customers

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 32 years old, married and has two children. He has a pharmacy. He has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 60,000 and he plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of drugs and injections to sell in his business. 

He will use the generated income to pay the loan and save for future use. He hopes to expand his business by opening other branches and be a top pharmaceutical technologist.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 55 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Tita works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as lotion, tissue paper, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and beer to sell.

Tita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, tissue paper, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and beer. 

In the future, Tita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as lotion, tissue paper, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo de 51 años de edad  ofrece desde hace 14 años, servicios de refrigeración técnica. Él inicialmente trabajaba para un taller de refrigeración donde obtuvo su mayor conocimiento y posteriormente decidió ser independiente. Su meta empresarial,  mas adelante es tener un local bien dotado y trabajador a quien ofrecerles la posibilidad de generar ingresos. Para el logro de este propósito diariamente trabaja con mucho esfuerzo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus clientes reciben servicios de mantenimiento preventivo y de reparación en la línea de  refrigeración, a quien Arturo provee estos servicios a créditos y de contado, todos los días  desde la s8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su propósito familias, es lograr potencializar el éxito de sus 3 hijos,  propiciándole la oportunidad de obtener estudios superiores.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para neveras y para aires acondicionados.  Con esta inversión Arturo podrá brindar un servicio integral/a todo costo, y generar ganancias por la venta de los repuestos, lo que se convierte el éxito de su credikiva..
texts.en: Arturo is 51 years old. For 14 years, he has offered the services of refrigerator technician. Initially he worked for a refrigeration workshop where he obtained most of his knowledge and later he decided to go off on his own. His business goal for the future is to be have a well stocked and hardworking locale that will offer the possibility of earning income. To achieve this, he works hard every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. His customers receive preventative and repair services for refrigeration. Arturo provides services on credit and for cash every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. His family goal is to maximize his 3 children's potential, offering them the opportunity of obtaining a post secondary education. Right now, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy replacement parts for refrigerators and air conditioners. With this investment, Arturo will be able to offer a complete service at all costs, and generate earnings by selling parts which will make his Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for refrigerators and air conditioners.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 25 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry, se dispone abastecer su negocio por lo que requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar controles, Dvd, Cds y carteras, al adquirir estos productos seguir trabajando y teniendo su fuente de ingresos.
Con el crédito anterior su negocio se ha mantenido funcionando, sus clientes se encuentran más satisfechos y su familia lo sigue apoyando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Henry wants to buy merchandise for his business, which is why he is requesting a new loan. He will buy remote controls, DVDs, CDs and wallets. With these products, he will be able to continue working and keep his source of income.

With the previous loan he was able to keep his business afloat. His customers are more satisfied now and his family continues to support him so that he can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy remote controls, DVDs, CDs and wallets.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 29 years old and has six children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Merlyn has been in this business for a year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is a 49-year-old married woman, from the village of Sanakhshire. She lives with her husband, school-aged son and daughter. Tsiala's husband works at a bus terminal and generates 300 GEL monthly. Tsiala doesn't have her own job, but she puts much effort in her agricultural business. Particularly, she cultivates nuts and takes care of her vineyard. She gets her income from selling agricultural products in the local market, and always has high quality products and her own costumers. This hard-working couple does everything to provide financial stability for their children, but their business needs investments to make more profits and increase productivity. 

Tsiala has a great desire to expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming. That's why she requested a loan and was approved for the amount of 1,500 GEL. She plans to purchase a cow and after that she will produce milk products and start selling it locally. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 

Tsiala will be grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to purchase cow and produce milk products.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 46-year-old woman, lives in the village of Argveta. Her husband died at an early age and Maia was obliged to lead the family. Since then Maia has been engaged in agricultural activities. She cultivates a plot of family-owned land, harvests nuts and sells them locally. Also she takes care of a small vineyard and gets grapes seasonally. Maia has two school-aged sons, and she does everything to try and ensure they have a better style of life. She has great desire somehow to increase her income and expand her business. 

Maia requested a loan and was approved in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives people chance to start or re-start businesses. So Maia plans to set up a poultry farm, purchase chickens and food for them. After raising them, Maia will sell them at a good price and get a good profit. 

The loan is really necessary for her, as she will get chance to improve her financial situation and give a good education to her sons. Maia and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, ya que sus ganancias mejoraron, su cosecha ha sido abundante, lo suficiente para abastecer su hogar y comercializar otra parte, esto lo ha logrado con la ayuda del crédito anterior.
Nuevamente solicita capital para comprar abono, semilla, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas, de esta manera seguirá fortaleciendo su negocio y cumpliendo con los compromisos económicos y familiares que tiene.
texts.en:
Jose provides better conditions for his family, as his earnings improved from an abundant harvest, enough to stock his home and the rest to put in the market. He achieved this with a prior loan.

Yet again, he requests capital to buy compost, seeds, pesticides, herbicides and insecticides. This way he will continue strengthening his business and complying with his business and family obligations.

loans.use: comprar abono, semilla, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas

loans.name: Francia Ines

texts.es:
Franci es caracterizada por una mujer fuerte, trabajadora y multifacética, quien no le tiene miedo a nada, pues sus metas para salir adelante siempre están bien ubicadas. A sus 45 años es considerada una mujer luchadora, quien dejo de estudiar cuando se casó, pero que luego decidió sacar un técnico como secretaria. Al mismo tiempo, su esposo le enseño a manejar y le obsequió un taxi, en el cual no tiene miedo en trabajar cuando no tiene alguien a cargo. De igual forma, hace 11 años empezó a vender gaseosa, agua helada, recargas telefónicas y helados en la casa de su madre. Además alquila una casa, la cual ayuda a pagar la mensualidad de la universidad de sus 2 hijos de 20 y 21. 
Franci es una mujer que no se cansa de trabajar, ella necesita de un préstamo para comprar bebidas, ya sean jugos, aguas y gaseosas; también para poder darle mantenimiento a su taxi. Esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio en ambos casos y tener confianza de parte de los clientes, por ende tendrá mayores ingresos. Desafortunadamente su mamá está enferma, es por esto que sueña con ver crecer más su negocio lo más pronto posible para poder apoyarla con la salud. Su meta por el momento es terminar de remodelar la casa de alquiler.
texts.en:
Francia is a strong, hardworking and multifaceted woman. She is not afraid of anything because she has set very clear goals in order to get ahead. She is  a hardworking 45-year old woman who quit her studies when she got married but later decided to pursue a degree as a secretary. At the same time, her husband taught her how to drive and gave her a taxi. She is not afraid of driving it when there is no one else to do it. She also started selling sodas, cold water, ice creams and prepaid minute refill cards eleven years ago at her mother’s house. She also owns a house which she rents out. This helps her to pay for her children’s university; they are aged 20 and 21.

Francia is a tireless woman. She needs a loan to buy beverages (e.g. juice, water or sodas) and to give maintenance to her taxi. This will help her to offer a better service in both of her businesses and gain her customers’ trust. All this will result in more income. Unfortunately, her mother is sick. She hopes to see her business grow fast so that she can help her with the healthcare expenses. Her short term goal is to finish refurbishing the house she rents out.

loans.use: to buy beverages (e.g. juice, water and sodas) and give maintenance to her taxi.

loans.name: Candelario De Jesús

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 72 años de edad, es agricultor, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa,  habita en la zona rural del Cantón Candelaria, Municipio de San Jorge, sin ningún tipo de grado académico, tiene dos hijos uno está soltero, vive con él en la casa y el otro está acompañado.

Él tiene alrededor de cuatro años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado,  este negocio le ha resultado muy  rentable ya que  con cuido de los bovinos ha mantenido a su familia durante casi 4 años y medio lo realiza de la siguiente manera; todos los martes hay tiangue (lugar donde comercializan bovinos) en un municipio cercano al cantón donde él vive, él compra el ganado a la gente que vive cerca de la comunidad y lo saca a vender al tiangue todos los martes y la ganancia que le queda es lo que le sirve para el diario vivir.

Él préstamo lo utilizará para comprar un vehículo, ya que será de mucha utilidad para su negocio,   lo ocupará para transportar el ganado que compra y vende.

Candelario tiene un gran sueño en la vida desde hace varios años y es poder construirle a su esposa una vivienda digna en donde puedan vivir tranquilos ya que la vivienda que tienen es de lámina y madera y no es tan segura, él sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Candelario is 72 years old. He is a married farmer and his wife is a housewife. He lives in the rural area of the Candelaria canton, town of San Jorge. He has no academic degree. He has two children and one of them is single and lives with him. The other one is married.  

For about four years, he has worked buying and selling cattle. This business has been very profitable and caring for cattle has supported his family for almost four years and a half. He does it in the following way: every Tuesday there is a "tiangue" (a place where they sell cattle) in a market in a nearby canton. He buys and sells the cattle to people who live close to his community. He takes the cattle to sell in the tiangue every Tuesday and he uses the profits to pay for daily expense.

He will use the loan to buy a vehicle, which will be very useful for his business. He will use it to transport the cattle that he buys and sells. 

Candelario has had a big dream in life for several years, and that is to be able to build his wife a dignified house where they can live in peace. The house they have is made from sheet metal and it is not very secure. He knows that he can achieve this with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle that he will use to transport cattle that he buys and sells.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Hello World! Here is Joseph, who lives in his farm in the Muranga area, an area which is a heavy pineapple producing area. He has been doing farming there for the past 20 years. He sells eggs, milk, tea, and different varieties of crops, and he also has a retail business in the local area. He has a great passion for farming as it generates profits, and he gets his income out of it. His major challenge in farming is marketing his farm produce due to the very high competition.

Joseph wants this loan so that he can expand his poultry farm by adding more poultry. This will lead to more egg production and also selling more poultry meat. He says that the income he gets out of this farming will help him get enough food for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena de 30 años de edad estudió docencia y trabaja en las horas de la mañana es profesora de un colegio. Desde hace 3 años decidió dedicarse en las horas de la tarde a ofrecer refuerzos escolares y poco a poco organizó su clientela, atendiendo a los niños en su propia casa, la que fue dotada de pequeños asientos y mesas para que estuvieran cómodos al hacer las tareas que le habían asignado en el colegio. Hoy 3 años después trabaja todos los días hábiles desde las 2 a las 5 de la tarde y tiene como meta más adelante, emprender un colegio  y cada día tener mas estudiantes, lo cual es su mayor desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sillas infantiles, y dulcería para hacer de la estadía de sus niños todo un deleite. Milena conoce muy bien como estimular el buen comportamiento delos niños, pues estudió para ello, además de ser madre de una niña de 1 año. Su inversión generará mejoramiento a su negocio, pues potencializa el ingreso de nuevos niños a su aula de  refuerzos escolares, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Milena is 30 years old. She studied teaching and works mornings as a teacher in a school. Three years ago, she decided to work afternoons offering academic reinforcement, and little by little she organized her clientele. She teaches the children in her own house, which is set up with  tables and chairs  so that they can be comfortable while doing their homework that has been assigned in school. Today, 3 years later, she works every workday from 2 until 5 in the afternoon. She has a goal in the future: open a school and have more students every day, which is her biggest challenge. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy children's chairs and candies to make the children's stay pleasant. Milena knows very well how to encourage good behavior from children. She studied for it and she is the mother of a 1 year old girl. Her investment will generate improvements for her business. It will potentialize the influx of new children into her academic reinforcement classroom, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy children's chairs and candies.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from a restaurant. Jonalyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 18 years old and married with one child. Rosie works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosie's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosie has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosie has taken a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish. Daisy is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
Ovidio, tuvo un impacto positivo en su negocio con la inversión del crédito anterior entrego sus trabajos pendientes con mayor calidad, sus clientes están más satisfechos, ha mantenido la estabilidad económica y familiar, sigue ofreciendo empleo a su personal.
Para continuar fortaleciendo su negocio requiere más capital para comprar lijas, hierro, láminas, tubos, electrodos, pintura, un compresor y pagar algunas reparaciones a su equipo. De esta manera seguirá con la continuidad de los trabajos que sus clientes le han solicitado.
texts.en: Ovidio had a positive impact to his business with the investment of his previous loan. He delivered his pending jobs with more quality. His customers are more satisfied. He has maintained financial and personal stability. He keeps on offering employment to his personnel. In order to keep on strengthening his business, he needs more capital in order to buy sandpaper, iron, steel in sheets, pipes, electrodes, paint, a compressor, and to pay for repairs to his equipment. In this way he will continue working on the jobs that his customers have ordered from him.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, iron, steel in sheets, pipes, electrodes, paint, a compressor and to pay for some repairs to his equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a las condiciones económicas de sus padres, actualmente está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre quien ya no puede trabajar.

La actividad que realiza Ramón es la siembra de granos básicos pero el año pasado las cosechas no dieron resultados esperados, no tuvo  utilidades sino perdidas ahora él también tiene dos vacas lecheras las cuales le producen leche y la vende a un comprador que pasa por la zona, él necesita aumentar el número de vacas para poder aumentar la producción de leche.

El dinero de este préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos vacas más ya que necesita aumentar la producción de leche, él cuenta con un capital pero no es suficiente por lo que necesita que se le ayude con el préstamo.

Sus planes a futuro son hacer un corral y tener su ganado más seguro ya que por el momento deja las vacas amarradas cerca de su casa, pero su mayor sueño es que su madre este gozando de salud y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito ya que tendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramón is 49 years old.  He didn't have the opportunity to go to school due to his parents' economic situation. He currently is single, he doesn't have any children, and he lives with his mother who no longer can work. 

Ramón work is growing basic grains, but last year the harvest didn't produce the expected results. He didn't have profits, rather he had losses. Now he also has two dairy cows which produce milk that he sells to the purchaser who travels through the region. He needs to increase the number of cows in order to increase the milk production.

The money from this loan is needed to purchase two additional cows since he needs to increase his milk production. He has some capital but it is not enough, so he needs the help of this loan.

His future plans are to build a corral and have his cattle more secure since currently he has the cows tied near his house, but his greatest dream is that his mother enjoy good health and he knows he can achieve this with the help of the loan since he will have increased earnings.

loans.use: to purchase two cows since he needs to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis, es un pequeño productor del norte de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposa y dos hijos; laboran en la caficultura desde hace 14 años, tiempo en el que, con mucho esfuerzo, ha logrado mejorar la calidad del manejo y los rendimientos de su pequeña finca.
Luis logró, con trabajo y éxito, que sus dos hijos culminaran sus estudios de secundaria. Su producción de café en los tres últimos ciclos ha aumentado de manera significativa, y es que este productor está consciente de la importancia de un buen manejo, como medio para la obtención de mejores resultados en su plantación.
Para este ciclo Luis desea mantener el buen manejo nutricional de su plantación, por lo tanto; solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que aplicará a su cafetal para garantizar una mejor cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a small producer in the north of Nicaragua. Along with his wife and two children, he has worked growing coffee for the past 14 years.  In this time, with much effort, he has managed to improve the quality of his management and the yields of his small farm.

Luis managed, with work and success, to have his two children finish their secondary education. His coffee production in the past three planting cycles has increased a significant amount, and this is because this producer is aware of the importance of good management as a means of getting better results from his plantation.

For this planting cycle, Luis wants to continue the good nutritional management of his plantation. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase agricultural products that he will apply to his coffee plantation to guarantee a better harvest and, with this, increased income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Parcelles Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de crédit composé de 5 femmes, toutes épouses et mère de famille porte le nom de « Takku Liggey Parcelles » Elles se sont réunies parce qu’habitant le même quartier mais surtout parce qu’ayant des affinités entre elles. Elles ont toute une activité génératrice de revenus et veulent un financement pour améliorer ces activités. 
La présidente, madame Yacine qui est la 2ème à partir de la droite sur la photo, évolue dans le domaine de la vente d’huile de palme, et de produits halieutiques. Elle fait cette activité depuis plusieurs années et possède une clientèle fidèle. Avec cet argent, elle ira au sud, en Casamance pour acheter les produits et venir revendre ici. Elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Yacine désir diversifier son activité pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
This loan group, Takku Liggey Parcelles,  is made up of five married women, with children.  The women have joined together because they live in the same area but, more importantly, because they get on with one another very well.

The women all sell goods in order to generate an income, and would like this loan in order to improve their businesses.

Yacine (standing second from the right in the photo) is the group president.  She has been selling palm oil and fish products for several years and she has a loyal customer base.  She will use her loan to travel south to Casamance to buy products for resale in her area.

Yacine wants to diversify her business and maximise her profits.  She supports her husband in providing for the expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, fabric and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gebah

texts.en: Gebah of Sky Electronics seeks a Kiva loan to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell retail. Sky Electronics, owned by Gebah, started small, just a few cell phones.  They then added some electronics, small radios and television sets. They have now grown to become one of the more established Liberian owned businesses on Carey street, with a reputation for quality products at affordable prices.  A perfect partner for Sjedi Green Energy.  And just as they started small with just cell phones and added products, they will now add clean cookstoves, or improved cookstoves to their product list.  Hopefully soon, they will also add small pico solar home electric light systems and other SE4ALL products, in line with SJedi's mission.

loans.use: to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell them retail.

loans.name: Mauricio Ramon

texts.es:
Mauricio es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad en su vivienda que ha logrado construir con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su finca es de 3.51 hectáreas y el principal cultivo es el café, el cual maneja bajo procesos de certificación Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ.
Para este ciclo, este productor está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos y materiales que requiere su plantación de café, a fin de asegurar una buena cosecha y con esto mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
Su sueño es incrementar el área de su finca y de café, para continuar construyendo oportunidades para el futuro de su hijo, y asegurarle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a small producer in the northern region of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and their three-year-old son in the home which he managed to build with much effort and work.  His farm is 3.51 hectares and its main crop is coffee, which he operates under the certified processes of Fair Trade, C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ.  

For this cycle, Mauricio is asking for a loan that allows him to guarantee the purchase of supplies and materials that his coffee plantation requires in order to ensure a good harvest and thus improve his family's income.  His dream is to expand the area of his farm and his coffee, in order to continue creating opportunities for his son's future, and to secure better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is 52 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Silva runs a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional Avon products to sell.

Silva has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Silva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Michelle Joy

texts.en:
Michelle Joy is 23 years old and single with children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michelle Joy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Michelle Joy has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 21 years old and has one child. Janice is married and has one child who is in school.

Janice and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Janice is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Janice has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her business raising livestock.

With your help, Janice can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Hawa is the president of the Nancy Doe Market Women, in Sinkor.  She and the Nancy Doe Market women will sell Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products purchased from Sjedi Green Energy and use the profits to help build their new office at the Sinkor market.

loans.use: To Purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) Products

loans.name: Patrick B.

texts.en: Patrick is the relation coordinator at the Liberian Marketing Association (LMA), responsible for getting goods to the Liberian market.  Patrick and the staff at the LMA have bought into the idea of Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) and will use Kiva micro-lonas to help businesses in the market bring these important SE4ALL goods into the Liberian market.

loans.use: To Purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) Products.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is the president of Bajor Mother's Club which engages in village savings and loans for its members, and micro-credit so that its women members can engage in business.  The Banjor mother's club is building a club house, a place for its women members to meet and learn best practices in business.  The process from sales of SE4ALL products will go towards building their new club house.

loans.use: To purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris sells dry goods at the ELWA Market.  A single mom with two boys and a wonderful little girl, Doris will use the profits from selling Sustainable Energy For ALL (SE4ALL) products purchased from Sjedi Green Energy, to buy a storefront of her own at ELWA market, improving her sales and her profits.

loans.use: To Purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es: Bernabe vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, papa y otros, él pertenece al banco comunal " Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Bernabe lives in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco in the south of Peru.  He is a respectful and simple person who works in farming and with livestock.  He has fields where he plants different products, including wheat, barley, potatoes, and others.  He is a member of the Intipaqreq II community bank.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  He is grateful to all of the lenders for the support provided and promises to make his scheduled payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Annabeth

texts.en:
Annabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable to sell in her vegetable business. 

Annabeth has been in this business for 5 years. Annabeth earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. Ana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ana has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Joel Andrés

texts.es: Joel de 20 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo al sur de la ciudad. Él, para generar ingresos dirigidos al bienestar de su familia, se dedica a ofrecer el servicio llamadas,  recargas a celulares, videojuegos, y vende dulces y productos alimenticios empacados. A Joel desde muy pequeño le ha gustado jugar play; por eso aprovechó sus capacidades y aptitudes para ponerlo al servicio de los demás mientras generaba ingresos. Cuando terminó la educación secundaria, su madré lo impulsó a que trabajara y generara sus ingresos, mediante esta actividad. Así fue como poco a poco, fue creciendo personalmente y lleno de sueños, creó su propia actividad emprendedora en el lugar donde habita. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde las 9 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche, durante todos los dias de la semana, porque es muy trabajador  y sus metas son muy amplias, pues quiere que su negocio crezca, para aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor desafio es es lograr recursos financieros, que aun son insuficientes, para el logro de sus objetivos. En la actualidad está aplicando a unc credikiva, primer fianciamiento, que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante este finaciamiento comprará, 2 equipos Play Stations, 2 controles, 2 memorias USB. Con ello planea el incremento de su clientela, para hacer de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en: Joel, 20 years old, lives with his spouse and small child in the south of the city. In order to generate income for the well-being of his family, he works offering a call service, cell phone charging, video games, and sells sweets and packaged food. Since he was very young, Joel has liked to play on the Play Station. For this reason, he took advantage of his skills and aptitudes in order to serve other people while generating income. When he finished his secondary education, his mother pushed him to work and generate income with this work.  So it was, little by little, that he grew personally and filled his dreams.  He created his own entrepreneurial activity in his home. He does his sales in cash from 9 in the morning until 9 at night, every day of the week, because his is a very hard worker and his goals are expansive. He wants his business to grow, in order to enhance his family's quality of life. His biggest challenge is to get financial resources, which are still insufficient to achieve these objectives. At the moment, he is applying for a Credikiva loan. It is his first loan that he has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with this financing, he will purchase 2 Play Station consoles, 2 controllers, and 2 thumb drives. With this, he plans to increase his customer base, in order to make his loan a successful investment.

loans.use: 2 Play Station consoles, 2 controllers, and 2 thumb drives

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 45 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Generosa runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Generosa requested a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as candies, biscuits, hair conditioner, beers, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, Generosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase candies, biscuits, hair conditioner, beers, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un pequeño productor de café que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 7 hectáreas, de las cuales 0.88 ha dedicado para el cultivo de café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.
En los últimos tres años, Marco ha incrementado su producción de café pasando de 5 a 10 quintales oro. Esta mejora sumada al potencial económico que ve en este rubro lo motiva a seguir invirtiendo en su pequeña finca. Por tal razón, está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, y con ello obtener mejores rendimiento en este nuevo ciclo.
Su expectativa es que su finca produzca mucho más y que sus hijos puedan heredar una finca productiva que les permita construir un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marcos is a small coffee producer who lives with his wife and two children in a community in northern Nicaragua.  His farm is seven hectares; 0.88 of which are dedicated to growing coffee and which he operates under the criteria of the Fair Trade certification.

In the last three years, Marcos has increased his coffee production from 5 to 10 gold quintals.  This improvement, paired with the financial potential that he sees in this field, motivates him to continue investing in his small farm.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan that allows him to guarantee the purchase of manure and fertilizers in order to maintain his coffee plantation and thus get a better yield in this new season.

His hope is that his farm produces much more and that his children will be able to inherit a productive farm that allows them to build a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton material for resale.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David tiene 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que cuando él era un niño vivía en una zona  rural alejada y no había ningún tipo de servicio que el gobierno brindar, ahora él está acompañado  y tiene una hija cual está trabajando en una clínica como enfermera.

Él se ha dedicado prácticamente toda su vida a la agricultura, cuando era joven sembraba maíz y frijol pero trabajaba mucho y no obtenía las ganancias esperadas, hoy en día se dedica al cultivo de la jícama, tiene 5 años de trabajar en esto,  requiere de menos gastos y  trabajo, ya que solo hay que estar  muy pendiente a la hora de la siembra y de revisar el cultivo por las plagas.
 
Utilizará el crédito para sembrar dos hectáreas de jícama ya que el año pasado le dio una excelente producción agrícola,  en este año ya se está preparando para sembrar y necesita rentar las tierras que cultivará y la otra parte del dinero será invertido en la compra de semillas para la siembra, abonos, foliares entre otros más.

David tiene planeado poder comprar unos bueyes para llevar lo necesario hasta las tierras donde cultiva la jícama, además estos le servirán para ganar dinero extra ya que la escases de agua es muy frecuente donde él vive y la gente paga para que lleven agua hasta sus hogares.
texts.en:
David is 63 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school since when he was a boy he lived in a distant rural area and there no type of government services were provided. He is now partnered and has a daughter who works in a clinic as a nurse.
