He has worked practically his entire life in agriculture. When he was young, he planted corn and beans but he worked a lot and didn't get the earnings he hoped for. Now he works cultivating jícama, and has worked with this for 5 years.  It requires fewer costs and work, since one only has to be very attentive at the time of sowing and to check the crop for infestations.  

He will use the loan to plant two hectares of jícama since last year it gave an excellent agricultural production. This year he is already preparing to sow and needs to rent the land that he will cultivate and the rest of the money will be invested in purchasing seeds for sowing, fertilizer, and liquid fertilizers to spread on the leaves, among other items. 

David plans to be able to purchase some oxen to bring the needed things to the land where he grows jícama, in addition they will serve him to earn extra money since water shortage is very frequent where he lives and people pay in order to bring water to their homes.

loans.use: to plant two hectares of jícama and to purchase seeds to sew, fertilizer, and liquid fertilizers to spread on the leaves, among other items.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion de muebles en melamina,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles.El socio solicita el credito para comprar melamina y herramientas.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos continues working at his business making melamine furniture.  He has done this work for many years and it is going well.  His dream is to expand his furniture sales business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase melamine and tools.

He is happy with the loan and promises to make his scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase melamine and tools.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Hello!!! Meet Joyce a very hard working farmer living on her piece of land in Litein where she has cows, poultry, and tea which he sells in the local market. Farming is her main source of income, which enables her to take care of her 3 children. She wants to venture into horticultural farming, which she believes will boost her income since it is an area where there are easy markets.Therefore, she has taken this KIVA loan to boost her horticultural farming. She believes that with this loan she will be able to accomplish this project, which will bring in more income. Her family will live comfortably and her children will go to good schools.

loans.use: For horticultural farming.

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en:
Al- Nada is a group of six women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 320,000 YER from Kiva lenders. 
Jobrana is the leader of the group. Last year she applied for her first loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing more cosmetics and clothes. The first loan assisted her in improving and enlarging her business. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for her first loan. After she finished repayment of the first loan, Jobrana applied for a second loan of 70,000 YER from Kiva lenders to further expand in her business through purchasing more of clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense to resell. She hopes to get another loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more of clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos  mayores le ayudan con los gastos de la casa, y con el estudio de dos hermanos, y su otra hija se esta recuperando de un accidente que tuvo. 
María es una mujer muy emprendedora y a pesar de los problemas que le ha tocado enfrentar ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos brindándoles los estudio, un hogar digno y una buena educación inculcándoles el respeto a las demás personas, ella se vio en la necesidad abrir un negocio que le produjera una pequeña ganancia, desde hace tres meses vende verduras (repollo, lechuga, tomates, pepino, aguacate, cebollas) y frutas aunque sea para ir pagando la cuotas de la universidad de sus hijos. 


El crédito solicitado lo necesita para invertir mas en su mercadería y así poder ofrecer mas opciones de compras para sus clientes.

Ella sueña con tener un negocio rentable y que le genere ganancias a corto plazo y así poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old.  She is a single mother with five children.  The two oldest help with the household expenses and school costs for their two siblings, and her other daughter is recovering from an accident that she had.

María is an enterprising woman who has been able to succeed in spite of the problems she has faced.  She has provided her children with schooling, a decent home, and good manners, including respect for others.  She saw the need to open a business that produced a small income, so for three months she has sold vegetables (cabbage, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, avocado, onions) and fruits.  This has helped pay the university fees for her children.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise so she can offer her customers more options.  She dreams of having a profitable business that generates profits on a short cycle so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases cream, baby oil and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 40 años y es un productor de café que vive al norte de Nicagraua. Su finca es de 7.86 hectáreas, de las cuales 5.72 ha dedicado al cultivo del café, el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo. En los últimos años, él ha venido incrementando su producción, logrando pasar de 160 a 215 quintales de café oro.

Su meta es continuar mejorando la productividad de su finca, y para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café mediante la compra y aplicación de insumos requeridos para una buena nutrición de las plantas.
Francisco dice que su esfuerzo y trabajo es para mejorar las condiciones de su esposa y sus 4 hijos y poderles brindar un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Francisco is 40 years old and is a coffee producer who lives in Northern Nicaragua.  His farm is 7.86 acres, of which 5.72 are dedicated to coffee production.  He manages his crop under the parameters of fair trade coffee.  In recent years, he has been increasing his production, reaching and surpassing 160 to 215 quintales (each quintal is 100 kilograms) of gold coffee.  

His goal is to continue improving the productivity of his farm and for this loan cycle he is asking for a loan that will permit him to guarantee maintenance of his coffee fields through the purchase and application of the feed required for the good nutrition of his plants.  

Francisco says that his efforts and work are done in order to improve the living conditions of his wife and his four children and in order to offer them a better future.

loans.use: To purchase plant fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is trying to expand her pig business in Oroquieta City. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project, and has applied for a loan to purchase animal feed.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a forty-three-year-old woman from Oroquieta. She is married and has a sari-sari store in their barangay (area). She is coping well with the challenges of her business and has confidently decided to expand. 

She joined Paglaum MPC for the opportunity to gain access to loans. She is now requesting a loan to purchase construction materials for housing repairs.  She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in future. She dreams of concreting their little house and to start saving now for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for housing repairs

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is thirty-two years old, married and has a small hog-raising business to support her family's needs. With determination and courage she applied for membership at Paglaum MPC, having heard of its loan windows. 

The small business is going so well that she decided to expand, so she has requested a loan to purchase animal feed. She has high hopes that God will bless her business and that she will hopefully build concrete pig pens when her profits allow. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, her family's personal and household needs, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her business profits will help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Nedy

texts.en: Nedy finds pleasure in her gardening activities. Not only is gardening her hobby, she earns an income through it as well. At the age of forty-one and being married, she busies herself so she can sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with the capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is forty years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta. Because it is hard for her family to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with starting capital of 3,000 PHP. The store's primary customers are Sarah's neighbors. Happily, Sarah was able to manage the store well, and she covered the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to access previous loans, all of which she repaid religiously. Now, she applies for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventory

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is fifty-seven years old and happily married to Norberto. Life is hard but by the grace of God, she and Norberto were able to start their own business. They work together to support their family.

Yolanda owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is connected to or just inside their house. A variety store is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then sells the items per piece for a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, people passing by and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help, as it will allow her to add more products to her store.

Yolanda hopes to have more customers and that her business will continue to expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Fedila works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Fedila is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs, for her pig fattening business. Fedila has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. She has been enrolled in a technical training school since 2009 and she hopes to graduate in 2016. 

Since education is very expensive, she has decided to request a loan for her education. With this loan, she wants to pay her school fees and buy other related scholastic materials. After completing technical school, she hopes to pursue her further studies in another higher education institution in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees and buy other scholastic materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks such as beer, soda, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
While in the military, Anthony started a tradition of wrapping custom boat paddles as tributes for those in the Marines and the Navy.  These wooden paddles are wrapped with various colored cords and engraved with custom emblems to make the perfect award or retirement gift for those in the military.  These meaningful mementos were such huge hits that Anthony decided to turn his art of paddle-making into a business. 

Anthony's business is one of the few commemorative military paddle-makers in the world. Anthony treats his creations as unique works of art, taking time and patience to ensure his customers are truly receiving a one-of-a-kind gift. He currently makes everything himself, taking pride in his carefully detailed craftsmanship.  

Recently, Anthony received a proposal letter from a local military base asking him to come in and become a permanent vendor on base, which is a huge opportunity for this budding entrepreneur. 

Anthony will use his $3,500 Kiva loan to build out his new shop and purchase new equipment, including a laser engraver and other miscellaneous tools to create even more specialty products for his customers on base.

Anthony has high hopes for his business and believes he has found the perfect niche for his talents.  He is excited about this new opportunity, and believes it is exactly what he needs to bring his business to the next level.

Visit Anthony’s website and check out some of his creations at: http://www.wrightspaddles.com

loans.use: to build out his new shop and purchase new equipment, including a laser engraver

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more peanut butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cup to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es:
Simeón es un pequeño productor de café de 67 años, que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Posee una finca de 2.11 hectáreas, de las cuales 1.40 ha dedicado al cultivo del rubro de café, el cual se encuentra certificado bajo el sello de comercio justo.
Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su producción de café en los últimos años, y para este año está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal.
Su sueño es incrementar los rendimientos de su café, a fin de mejorar los ingresos para facilitar a su esposa y sus dos hijos mejores condiciones. El está seguro que este rubro tiene un gran potencial y que le permitirá seguir garantizando los ingresos que necesita para su hogar.
texts.en:
Simeón is a small coffee producer of 67 years old. He lives in a community located at the northern part of Nicaragua. He has a farm of 2.11 hectares, of which 1.40 are used only for his coffee plantations, which are certified with the Fairtrade Labelling. 

This small producer has improved his coffee production in the past few years. For this year, he’s requesting a loan that will allow him to buy supplies and fertilizer for the maintenance of his crops.

His dream is to increase the yield of his coffee plantations, so he can get more incomes and offer his wife and children better living conditions. He is certain that this activity has a lot of potential, and that it will provide him with the enough income to sustain his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a 40-year-old woman from the rural village Dakshinpara in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Nimai, aged 45 years, attended school up to grade 4. They live with their two sons, who are students. One is in grade 5 and the other is in grade 9.

She is a hardworking mother who struggles to give her children everything they need. Sima and her husband both are engaged in a business of making bori, a conical ball made of pulp used in vegetable curry in India. They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They work hard to generate income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family. 

Sima requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase ingredients for making bori, in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business income from it. Sima dreams to earn more profit from her business and hopes to have a comfortable life while giving good educations and better futures to her children and further expanding her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for expanding the existing business of making bori.

loans.name: Santos Amado

texts.es:
Santos es un pequeño caficultor, con más de 12 años de experiencia en este rubro. Vive en una pequeña comunidad al norte de Nicaragua con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Antes se dedicaba a la producción de tabaco, pero debido a los altos costos de producción y comercialización de este rubro, optó por dedicarse al cultivo de café, el cual considera es un rubro bastante rentable.
El ciclo anterior la plantación de café de Santos fue afectada por la Roya, lo cual hizo que su producción disminuyera. Para este año, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita mejorar su producción mediante la compra y aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su finca.
El sueño de este productor es contar con una finca productiva que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su familia, brindándole a sus hijos mejores oportunidades que las que él ha tenido.
texts.en: Santos is a small coffee farmer with more than 12 years of experience in this field. He lives in a small community in the north of Nicaragua with his wife and three children. He worked in the production of tobacco before, but due to the high costs of production and commercialization of this field, he chose to work in the cultivation of coffee. He considers this field rather profitable. The last cycle, Santos' coffee farm was affected by la Roya (coffee rust) which caused his production to be smaller. But this year, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to improve his production through the purchase and application of supplies and fertilizers that his farm requires. The dream of this producer is to depend on a productive farm that allows him to improve the conditions of his family, affording his children better opportunities than what he has had.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is a businesswoman who has a hog raising business in her backyard. She wants to expand her business. She wants to earn a higher profit and to have enough money to sustain her family, especially her children. In order to make her wish possible, she needs additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to purchase animal feed. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, age 63, is happy tending her little store in Lopez Jaena. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. She keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase inventories for her sari-sari (convenience) store. She wants to have enough stock of canned goods, sugar, milk and oil. 

Norma hopes to sustain her business and dreams to have a mini mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her sari-sari (convenience) store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has children. He is a farmer, planting corn and beans. He is from Oroquieta City. He is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. 

Francisco wants to increase sales. He requested a loan, which he will use to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, so that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is seventy years old and busies herself managing the farm that supports her family.

She has found comfort in her financial needs through Paglaum MPC. For this, she is thankful with all her heart. Luisa wants to increase sales, so she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer. This will allow her to continue putting bread on the table for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita  is 49 years old, married and a resident of Plaridel.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She sells the fish he catches at the public market or to their neighbors.

They want to buy additional materials for fishing like fishing nets and request a loan from  Paglaum MPC.  Aside from the financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed other benefits like insurance and savings.  She hopes that with Paglaum's help and patience and her own hard work, she will be a successful vendor someday.

loans.use: to buy fish nets.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda has reached her fourth year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan for her store. She wants to purchase inventories of canned goods, noodles, oil and sugar. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She is confident that she can maintain her current membership in good standing. "Its already tested", she said. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, so that she can afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of canned goods, noodles, oil and sugar

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married and helps her husband in operating their own farm, raising vegetables to sell. She has been involved in the farm for many long years. Aside from this, she also had a retail business that adds income for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming and is now requesting a new loan to purchase more farm products to sell.  She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more farm products to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is forty-three years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and an additional pig.

Helen has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and an additional pig

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 33 years old, and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Cheryl works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Cheryl has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Janet has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Evelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is 40 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling pearls in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bundles to sell.

Morena has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pearl business for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bundles of pearls to sell

loans.name: Lenny Ann

texts.en:
Lenny Ann is 38 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lenny Ann has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 53 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Elsa has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail of charcoal for five years and also earns an income from selling coconuts. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en: Donna works hard to support her family. Donna is married and has a fish vending/fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials. Donna has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Donna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Simil

texts.en:
Simil is a 29-year-old married woman from the rural village Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Haren, and three children (one son and two daughters). All her children go to school in grade 7 and grade 10, respectively. Both Simil and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Simil's husband is a small businessman who has been working in his business for more than seven years. Simil is a very hardworking, energetic and enthusiastic woman. After managing her household work, she works for her husband’s business.
 
Now she wants to start her own business to give a decent lifestyle to her family. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow for supplying milk and cow dung cakes to her neighbors. Cow dung cakes are traditionally used as fuel for making fire in India in domestic hearths called chulhas, especially in rural areas.  

She wants to sell her products in her locality. Her clients will be her neighbors, friends and relatives. Simil will put a lot of effort toward growing her business. She wants to make her dreams come true with the profit such as providing financial up-gradation to her family, providing higher education to her daughters and enhancing her business.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for funding.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a business of dairy milk and cow dung supply.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joan is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Joan has a general store business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Joan has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Monalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Monalie works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Monalie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to weave for her bamboo weaving business.

Monalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to weave

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, sardines and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Raylin

texts.en:
Raylin is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Raylin requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Raylin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Smritikana

texts.en:
Smritikana is a 36-year-old lady married to Ratan in Maynaguri village. They have one son, who is receiving higher secondary education. Smritikana has completed higher secondary level.
 
Her husband runs a business selling clothes door to door and she is a housewife. Due to lack of money her husband could not purchase a large variety of good quality clothes, so their sales are not up to the mark. They are facing lots of problems running their family and continuing to make money.

Smritikana decided to help her husband by taking a loan of INR 12,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase different types good quality clothes as per the demand of the market. There is some risk that clothes, if not sold, could be ruined by rats, ants or water, but in spite of that, Smritikana hopes to earn a good profit from her business. She has a future plan to do the business on a larger scale and to reach more customers.
 
Smritikana is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes for retail sales.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista obtained her initial capital from Paglaum MPC for her livestock business. Fortunately, the business is doing well and she  requests another loan to purchase additional animal feed. 

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow, benefit her family, and complement her husband's income. Someday, she wants to become a supplier to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia lives in Plaridel and has a small hog raising business that is doing very well.   

She decided to expand the business and requests a loan to purchase animal feed.  Rosalia has been able to repay her previous loan in a timely fashion, and is a member in good standing.  

She has high hopes that God will bless this business and that she will hopefully own a motor cab of her own when the profits allow.  In the future, she wants to see that all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a businesswoman from Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta, Philippines. She has a transport business that provides income for the family. She earns well doing this type of business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle and spare parts. Teresita constantly seeks help from PMPC for her financial needs. She hopes to sustain her business and add two more motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle and spare parts

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a  37-year-old resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Josefino and they have children. They manage their own household and operate the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer sells processed meat products. What she basically does is buy meat products from the wholesaler and sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products include ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a daily minimum of 300 PHP.

To help continue her business, she requests a 9,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her  inventory.

Jennifer dreams of owning and managing her own restaurant and to give her children a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to restock frozen food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Karen Ann

texts.en: Karen Ann earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband works abroad. For three years, Karen Ann has earned well and sustained the business. She has also bought some home improvements like appliances. Karen Ann had competitors in the village but she never worried because she had loyal customers who visited her store and make some purchases. To add inventory capital, she is taking a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house and sustaining the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
This is Ludivina, a 55-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She has one child and manages their own household as she works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ludivina makes and sells Puto and other varieties of "kakanin". Puto is a steamed rice muffin, which is a popular as snack or dessert in the Philippines. In its traditional form, puto is of a plain white color. Adding certain common Filipino ingredients like coconut milk, ube and pandan (made from pandan leaves) slightly changes the flavor and completely changes the color of the finished product. These foods are commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meal for desserts. She sells it per order and it is in demand for special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Ludivina hopes to grow her business and dreams to gain more regular customers. She meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of ingredients needed for making puto and other foods.

loans.name: Necifura

texts.en:
Necifura is 51 years old and married with six children. Necifura works very hard to provide for them.

Necifura's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Necifura has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Necifura has taken a 5,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay the costs of construction.

Necifura is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.en:
Maria Azucena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria Azucena is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Maria Azucena has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric for her business. Maria Azucena has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married mother with one child; she works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from weaving bamboo.  Nancy requests 1,1000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her  business.

Nancy has sustained her business activities through her previous 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 38 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

Jenilyn has borrowed and successfully repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Tapati

texts.en:
Tapati is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two sons. Both the sons are grown up, receiving secondary and higher secondary education. They live in the village Mouyamari of Maynaguri town in the district Jalpaiguri. Tapati is a housewife who attended school till grade 5 and could not study further as her parents could not afford it.

Tapati's husband, Shankar, 37 years old, is engaged in a fishery business. They have their own pond where they grow fishes and sell them in the local market. Tapati helps her husband in selling fish in the market and in her locality. The demand for fish in this region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people for their daily food item. This is the only source of income for Tapati’s family.
 
Tapati is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase a variety of fingerling fishes to grow more variety of fishes in their pond, as well as fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying. She hopes that this will help her in strengthening their fishery business and fulfill the demand of the local people.  She hopes this will enable her to earn more profit to provide a steady financial status to her family and develop her business. 

With the profit, she will give further education to her sons.

She wants to be a good entrepreneur and thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fingerlings, fishing net and insecticides to improve their existing fishery business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 30-year-old mother of five children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to help with labor costs and buy fertilizers for rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 35 years old and a house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her brother-in-law is also living with her family. He owns a fruit shop in the market which is also the source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he would like to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her brother-in-law to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit her brother-in-law wants to grow his business in the future. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has been doing embroidery with a machine at home for the past few years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work at home, but earns insufficient income to support family. So she helps him in his tasks related to the embroidery; she sells embroidered dresses in her town. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery with a machine, and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easily cope with the increasing demands. This is the reason Asma has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, which is an active field partner of Kiva. She will buy embroidery materials such as pearls, sequins, various color threads etc. 

She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Asma thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 32 years old and single. He would like to use a Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a 24-year-old married woman with two children. Her children are receiving education. Her son is in class III (grade 3) and her daughter is in class I (grade 1). She and her husband both attended school up to grade 7.

She is a housewife and her husband has a small agricultural land where he grows various vegetables in different seasons and sells those vegetables in the local market. She wants to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. So she has applied for the loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating yams, known as "kochu" in Bengal. Yam is the edible starchy tuber of a climbing plant, widely distributed in tropical and subtropical countries. In West Bengal, yam is very famous and people prepare dishes with it.

Suchitra will use the profits from her sales to increase her business, support her family and pay for her children’s education. She hopes she will earn huge profits from this cultivation due to the great demand for this plant in her rural area as a delicious food.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating yams (an edible root plant).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
BENKAN est un groupe de l’association SANOUYA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de fruits et légumes  à l’image de BINTA qui est la deuxième  personne  debout de la droite  vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de légume : bananes, choux, carotte, ananas et tomate.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
BINTA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kilogramme de banane et une quantité importante de choux, carotte, ananas et tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de légumes.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is a member of the Sanouya de N'tentou association. It is made up of women who met through neighbourhood and family ties. On average they are 34 years old. Married with an average of four children, they have various activities such as the commerce of fruit and vegetables like Binta, who is the second person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in N'tentou in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali).
They have been working in small business for several years and are very sought after in the vegetable trade: bananas, cabbage, carrots, pineapple and tomato.
In an attempt to satisfy the increasing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme. This is their second solidarity loan.
Binta plans to use her loan to buy 10 kg of bananas and a large quantity of cabbage, carrots, pineapple and tomatoes. She buys her stock locally from wholesalers and sells her merchandise retail at Ouelessebougou, for cash or for credit to a clientele of men and women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 15.000FCFA which will enable her to reimburse her loan and reinvest the remainder in her vegetable business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en: Due to insufficient income, Maggie aims to improve her small retail store to generate a higher income. She is 46 years old and blessed with three children. She and her husband agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will found a good job someday. Maggie planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs to help raise money for this goal. Having inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, beverages, laundry soaps, eggs, noodles and snack foods to sell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, beverages, laundry soaps, eggs, noodles and snack foods to sell

location.town: Brgy. La Torre South, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maroun's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé le  28 Mai 2002. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles du fait de 23 cycles passés ensemble. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maroun (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04  enfants (03 Garçons et 01 fille). Elle s’active dans la transformation des produits locaux plus précisément la pâte d’arachide, elle vend aussi de la crème glacée à base de pain de singe. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience pour avoir fait plus d’une décennie dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 40 sacs de graines d’arachide à 10 00 le sac, du sucre pour 02 sacs et 05 sacs de pain de singe.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront en d’épargner d’aider et d’acheter de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who are all very active in this banc villageois, which was set up on 28 May 2002. They are all from the same neighbourhood and get on well as they have already received 23 loans together. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Maroun (pictured sitting on the right with her hand in the air) is the star borrower of the group. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children (three boys and one girl). Her work involves processing local products, more specifically groundnut paste. She also sells baobab fruit ice cream. She has a good deal of experience as she has been working in this area for more than a decade.

With this loan Maroun is planning to buy 40 bags of groundnuts at 1000 CFA francs a bag, two bags of sugar and five bags of baobab fruit.

The income from her business will enable her to save money and buy small ruminants.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of groundnuts at 1000 CFA francs a bag, two bags of sugar and five bags of baobab fruit.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 46 years old, married, and a businesswoman in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She has a retail business that sells a variety of items. She has been doing this business for 8 years. In need of financial assistance, she seeks a loan from Paglaum to purchase construction materials for house repair. Elsa hopes to live comfortably with her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino settled in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with his family. Over the past fourteen years, Saturnino was able to managed his farm so that he absolutely met the market primary demands. The farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. He is taking a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in order to increase sales. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Saturnino expects an increase in sales that will expand his business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 60 years old, married, and a resident of Plaridel.  Her husband is a manual laborer. They are blessed to have a successful farming business.  She manages it well and is able to finance the daily needs of her family. 

She became a member  of Paglaum Cooperative April 2007 and  successfully repaid previous loans. She applied for a new loan to purchase fertilizer and compost. She looks forward to sustaining the business and providing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is thankful that she joined Paglaum MPC. With very little capital, she was able to start a retail business to sell a variety of items. Her daily sales help to meet the family's needs. She was also able to save  her extra income. 

She has applied to Paglaum MPC for additional capital to purchase plastic ware and kitchen utensils. Dulce was attracted to Paglaum MPC for the cooperative's savings and insurance services. 

Dulce wants to gradually expand her business and taste the good life someday.

loans.use: to purchase plastic ware and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a woman who stands out because she searches for all possible ways to obtain resources that will allow her to feed her family. 

Four years ago, she started a business selling groceries.Despite the difficulties of running the business, Annabel is asking for a loan to purchase  grocery items to restock her store.  This will allow her to continue to seek her dream which is to grow as an entrepreneur and look after the well being of her family, by the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to restock her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita finds pleasure in gardening. This is her hobby and also the means of earning an income. 

As a married, 70-year-old woman, she  provides for the family. She took the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for loaning the capital to support her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aprile

texts.en:
Aprile is 28 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like chips, soft drinks, spices, eggs, etc. to sell. 

Aprile has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like chips, soft drinks, spices, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more traditional clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 57 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed. Lydia has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 28 years old. He has spent seven years in the business of farming. He would like to use a Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cover labor costs for rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Lydia

texts.en:
Maria Lydia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria Lydia is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Maria Lydia has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business. Maria Lydia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 25 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Arlene has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Arlene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Agée  de 46 ans, elle a commencé la restauration de viande de porc et la pâte à base de Gari en 1992. Soucieuse de l’éducation de ses enfants et pour se faire de profits, Abra consacre à son activité plus de 45h par semaine. Très accueillante, sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir et elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois pour satisfaire ses clients.
Pour réduire les coûts de transports et augmenter ses revenus, Abra sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat de 3 porcs. Les revenus lui permettront de mieux préparer la rentrée prochaine de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abra is a widow and the mother of four children. She is 46 years old and has been running a business selling pork and "gari" mash (made from manioc or cassava flour) since 1992. 

In the interest of her children's education and to earn money, Abra dedicates more than 45 hours a week to her business. Her welcoming approach means that her customer base is growing, and she buys supplies three times a month to meet demand.

In order to reduce transport costs and increase her turnover, Abra is requesting this loan to help her buy three pigs. The income will help her prepare for her children's forthcoming return to school at the start of the year.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr:
Mana vit à Bè avec ses 04 enfants. Elle a commencé en 2013 la vente des produits de première nécessité. 
Mana suit avec attention les formations de l’équipe Assilassimé et souhaite augmenter son stock pour augmenter ses revenus.
Elle sollicite un crédit pour s’acquérir 2 sacs de charbon de bois, 03 sacs de riz et 02 sacs de riz.
texts.en:
Mana lives in Bè with her four children. In 2013, she began her business selling household staples. 

Mana is attentively completing the training provided by the Assilassimé team and would like to increase her stock to improve her income.

She is requesting a loan to buy two bags of charcoal and three bags of rice.

loans.use: to buy two bags of charcoal and three bags of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a taxi for transportation

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Her son owns a clothing business, buying clothing from wholesalers and selling it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers, which becomes his advertisement and increase in sales as well.

Rukiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son will be able to buy more clothing to cope with the demand. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior; she has already taken the loan from BRAC and been investing in the business. She hopes that the savings will increase and she will arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

Rukiya dreams for the bright future of her son, the establishment of business and for a better living standard of her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her son's clothing business.

loans.name: Maranatha De Samarie Group

texts.fr:
Rosena est le coordinatrice de son groupe Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3. Elle est marié, ell a 2 enfants. Rosena habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Elle dirige son commerce d' articles divers pendants les 13 dernières années Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. 

Des autres membres Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3 ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que: ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. Elle déclare que son défi principal est de venir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Elle dit son but principal c'est d'avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Rosena is the coordinator of her group, Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3. She is married and has two children. 

Rosena lives in the north-east of Haiti, where electricity and water supplies are very limited. She has been managing her business selling various items for 13 years and hopes that this loan will help her expand her business. 

The other members of Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3 need loans for their businesses, which include sales of food products, fizzy drinks, shoes and clothing, among others. 

Rosena says her main ambition is to become a major trader in the northern region. Her aim is to have a large business so she can build a big house with the support of Esperanza International.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneau Group

texts.fr:
Kercita est la coordonatrice de son groupe Le Modele de Dorneu. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants. Kercita habite dans la région de nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Kercita a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 10 dernières années. 

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle a vendu l'artisanat. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du Vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Kercita espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres Le Modele De Dorneau ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, la nourritures, cosmetique et chaussures. Kercita dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Kercita is the coordinator of her group “Le Modele de Dorneu”. She is married with five children. Kercita lives in the north of Haiti, where electricity is rarely available and the water supply extremely limited. She has been managing a business selling various products for the past ten years. 

Before starting this business, Kercita sold craft products. She would like to use the loan to invest in clothing, shoes, cosmetics and other products. 

Kercita hopes that this loan will help grow her business. The other members of Le Modele de Dorneu need loans for businesses selling charcoal, food, cosmetics and shoes, among others. Kercita says that her main ambition is to become a major trader.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics, among other products.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en:
Prudencio is from Oroquieta City and has a retail business. He has successfully handled his business and supports his family's needs. Prudencio has a membership with PMPC and received several loans. 

He wishes to acquire a loan to renovate his home. Prudencio hopes to maintain his good repayment record with the cooperative.

loans.use: to renovate his home.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association MARIAMTON de KELEYA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de restaurant à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KELEYA dans la  préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : riz, maïs et mil.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a neuf ans. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire.  
MAIMOUNA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à KELEYA, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz et 5 sacs de mil.  Elle s’approvisionne à KELEYA et environnants  et effectue ses ventes à KELEYA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a subgroup of the borrowing group Mariamton of Keleya. It is made up of women who came to know each other through family and neighbors. The women are on average 39 years old, married, and have an average of 4 children each. They operate various small businesses, such as the purchase and resale of spices and the restaurant business, like Maimouna, pictured as the first person standing from left to right in the photo.

The women live in traditional extended families in Keleya, in the Bougouni district (in the Sikasso region of Mali.) They have all been in business for several years ,and are much sought after in their various businesses of purchase and resale - rice, corn, and millet.

With the goal of meeting the growing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to work with the lending program of Soro Yiriwaso nine years ago. They are on their eleventh group loan.

Maimouna, who is a member of the group and very well known in Keleya, excels in her sale of spices. She plans to use her loan to purchase 2 bags of rice and 5 bags of millet. Maimouna stocks up in Keleya and its surroundings and makes her sales in Keleya at retail, for cash and credit, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Maimouna hopes to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest the remainder in her business of purchase and sale of cereals.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
BENKAN est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de ASSAN qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : maïs et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y'a six ans elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
ASSAN, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de riz et 5 sacs de  maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à TIELE et villages environnants et vend ses marchandises à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Benkan is a group in the Benkadi de Tiele association. It is made up of women who know each other through being relatives and neighbours. They have an average age of 26, and are all married with have two children on average. 

The women are involved in various businesses, such as selling cereals, like Assan who is pictured standing on the left. They live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

They have all been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the cereals they sell: corn and rice. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme six years ago. This is their seventh solidarity loan. 

Assan is requesting another loan to buy ten sacks of rice and five sacks of corn. She buys her supplies in Tiele and the surrounding villages, and sells her produce in Tiele, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.

Assan hopes to make 35,000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her cereals business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
FAIDA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de friperie à l’image de AWA  qui est la troisième personne assise  de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de friperie, d’’habillements : pagnes et wax. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire. 
AWA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un  balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Faida is a group in the Benkadi de Tiele association. It is made up of women who know each other through being relatives and neighbours. They have an average age of 28 and are all married with four children on average. 

The women are involved in various businesses, such as selling second-hand clothing, like Awa who is pictured sitting third from the left. The women live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

They have all been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the second-hand clothing they sell, which includes traditional wax cloth pagnes.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme four years ago. This is their sixth solidarity loan.

Awa intends to use her loan to buy one bale of second-hand clothing. She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her products to individuals in Tiele, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Awa hopes to make 20,000 CFA francs a month, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda  has had a retail business for more than eight years and earns good money for the family. 

With her generated revenue, she had successfully repaid her previous loan and bought grocery items. She has to add more stock in order to meet the needs of her costumers and improve sales. 

Wilfreda plans to improve her business and expand by adding a refreshment and snack area.  This will help her to gain income and provide a better future for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma helps her husband to manage their own farm and earn a living. With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She started selling farm produce in the market and gains additional income. 

To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase more farm produce to sell. She always finds ways to support the needs of her five children and augment their living. She plans to save a portion of her revenue to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
As a married woman of three children, Aisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from nipa roofing making. Aisa requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

Aisa has sustained her business activities through 10 previous NWTF loans. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to build her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia is 58 years old and married with four children. 

Melicia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was destroyed. 

Melicia is taking out a 9,500 housing loan to purchase building materials and pay the cost of construction labor to build a house for her family. Melicia has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Melicia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay the cost of construction labor.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is the age of 30; she is a mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others.
