Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Asma requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Asma hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand of her family. Asma thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for the general store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 54 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy addtitional household goods to sell like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, etc. Letecia has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, salt, juice, etc. Alejandra has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, dedicó toda su vida al comercio para poder darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro, vive solo con un hijo de 35 años de edad, quien se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, ella es quien le va a dejar los alimentos. 

Santos ha realizado esta actividad desde que tenía 14 años, ella acompañaba a su madre cuando iba a dejarle los alimentos a su padre. Por el momento se dedica a vender panes rellenos dentro de la escuela del cantón, con esta actividad que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar. Pero la actividad fuerte de donde obtiene los alimentos es la agricultura.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar los fertilizantes y demás productos que se utilizan en la producción, los cuales están a un precio más alto de lo que el año pasado estaban. Santos necesita apoyo, pues por el momento no cuenta con los fondos suficientes para comprarlos.

En un futuro ella desea poder reparar su casa, pero por el momento su prioridad es poder cultivar ya que es de donde obtiene los granos básicos que forman parte de la alimentación en el hogar.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old. She is a plucky woman who, for all of her life, has worked in business in order to give her children a better future. Santos lives with just her 35-year-old son, who also works in farming. Santos provides his food.

Santos has had this business for 14 years. When she was a child she helped her mother to prepare food for her father. Santos currently makes a living selling sandwiches at a local school. This job allows her to cover some household costs, but she grows her in food in farming.

This loan will be used to buy fertiliser and other farming products, which are now being sold at a high price than last year. Santa needs support as, for the moment, she does not have enough money to buy them.

In the future Santos wants to be able to make improvements to her house. Her priority for now, however, is growing crops, as this helps her to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and other products for farming.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 26-year-old married woman with three children; 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susan's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Susan requests a 9,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for the costs of construction  to build a house for her family.

Susan has been with NWTF since 2012 in order to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start over in a new home. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay the cost of construction.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 54 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

Lucy has borrowed and successfully repaid 18 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 8 years and earns an additional income from direct selling personal products.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SALUD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catalina ella es soltera y tiene 61 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Salud" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of the same name.

One member of the group is Catalina, a single woman who is 61 years old and has two children. Catalina has a restaurant. She prepares different meals such as chicken and chips, and stir fries. Catalina works from 10am until 5pm. She has had the business for seven years, and it is going very well for her. Catalina's dream is to expand her restaurant. She is applying for this loan in order to buy products to cook, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The members of the group in the smaller photo could not come to the meeting where the group photo was taken as they had to work.

The other members of the group have businesses selling clothes, selling artisan goods, a grocery store, and a business selling beauty products.

Catalina is grateful to those who are helping her to achieve this dream through this loan; she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to cook, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 51 years old and lives in Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental. She has retail business where she generates income and provides for her family's everyday consumption. For almost twelve years, she has been a retailer. She has many avid customers who regularly buy from her. She needs additional capital for her business and to pay for repair of her side car. She asks PMPC for financial assistance to help her achieve what she wants and thus generate more income.

loans.use: to repair her side car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 42 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy juice, coffee, cereal, detergent, canned goods, and soft-drinks.

Merlina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy  juice, coffee, cereal, detergent, canned goods, and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.  Rosa has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain the motorcycle.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop in which he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, and earrings. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.
  
Her husband has only one source of income. He has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children and household expenses. He wants to increase daily sales, but he is unable to buy additional products due to high costs.

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy expensive jewelry for reselling.

She hopes that she will be able to construct her house soon so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy expensive artificial jewelry for her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is the age of 48. She is the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her elder son works in dairy products like milk, curd, and butter for sale. He owns a small dairy farm which consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning's from milk sales. He speaks in a calm manner which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He is in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sale business so Safia requested this loan. In this way, she can support her son's business.

Safia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's milk sale business.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran is a 47-year old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Her son just started to drive a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester which is not strong enough to withstand the wear and tear of local roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his Moto Rickshaw. Naziran has requested a loan so that her son can buy the rickshaw body and can drive it smoothly. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Osmín Antonio

texts.es:
Osmín tiene 45 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y tiene 5 hijos. 

Osmín se dedica a la agricultura, se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas, el oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen y en la tarde Osmín se dedica a vigilar una finca donde obtiene un ingreso adicional para el sustento de su familia.
Él necesita el crédito  para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para elaborar cuajada, crema, y requesón que vende  su esposa en los alrededores de su residencia.

Sus planes son mejorar el techo de su vivienda con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Osmín is 45 years old and completed up to sixth grade at school. Osmín is married and has five children.

Osmín works in farming. He wakes up at 5am with his wife, who supports him in his farming work by milking the cows. Osmín learned this trade from his parents. He works in the morning, while his wife looks after the household chores and looks after the cows. In the afternoon, Osmín works as a security guard at a small estate, thus allowing him to earn an extra income to support his family.

Osmín needs this loan in order to buy a cow and increase production. Osmín uses the milk to produce, cream, curd and cottage cheese, which his wife sells in the area around his home.

In the future, Osmín wants to use his profits to make improvements to the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Voilet

texts.en:
Voilet is 48 years old and has four children. She is house wife and looks after her family. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a stall in the market to sell ice and manage his household financial needs. He purchases blocks of solid ice on a daily basis and sells it to the customers at a profit. The summer season has started in Pakistan and the demand for  ice has increased. 

He decided to increase his current business. He wants to buy more blocks of ice to sell. Voilet requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to support her husband’s business. 

She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ice for business.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her children are all studying. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 3 years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Sobia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothes selling business.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de granos básicos, así como también a ofrecer el servicio de un molino nixtamal, es un negocio que heredo de sus padres, es una persona que ha luchado por dar a su familia lo necesario para vivir, vive junto a su compañera de vida y un hijo de 20 años de edad. Todos le colaboran en las diferentes actividades.
El capital que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, pesticidas, herbicidas y semilla, que le serán de utilidad para acondicionar las dos hectáreas de terreno en las que sembrara sus cultivos, espera mejorar su producción y protegerla de posibles plagas.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta, como lo es la agricultura, mejorar la rentabilidad, mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y resarcir lo más pronto posible su deuda.
texts.en:
For 20 years José has been growing crops and selling basic grains. He also grinds corn for customers. José inherited this business from his parents. José has fought hard to give his family everything that they need to live. José lives with is partner and 20 year old son. All of the family helps out with the farming work.

José needs this loan in order to buy manure, anti-disease treatments, week-killers, pesticides and seeds. These items will help him to prepare the two hectares of land where he will grow his crops. José hopes to improve production and protect them for possible diseases.

José's dream is to continue work in farming, which he likes. He wants to increase profitability, improve his family's quality of life, and to pay off his debt as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy manure, anti-disease treatments, week-killers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 26-year-old married women with 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has driven a Taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband's taxi needs to be repaired. Due to insufficient funds, he is unable to repair his taxi. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Asma's husband can easily afford the maintenance, provide better transportation services, and earn a profitable income. Asma plans to save the profits to meet her family's future needs.

Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the age of 50. She is a mother of two children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well. His relatives like to purchase items from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town. That is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Irshad requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergent, biscuits, etc. 

Irshad gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergent, biscuits, etc. for her son's general store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria esta casada y tiene un hijo. Maria vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Maria es auditora y requiere hacer el pago de su Maestría. Maria recibe ayuda de su esposo pero lo que ganan no es suficiente por eso necesita su ayuda para completar su formación académica
texts.en: Maria is married and has a child. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that she owns. Maria is an accountant and needs to pay for her Master's degree. She receives help from her husband but what he earns is not enough, and so she needs help to complete her academic training.

loans.use: to pay for her Master's degree.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es una joven muy sacrificada y que quiere salir adelante, y es por eso que se esta esforzando mucho.
Esta cursando la Carrera de Trabajo social, ya que su meta siempre fue poder ayudar a las demás personas, y por medio de este trabajo sabe que podrá hacerlo.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su Universidad, para que de esa forma siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Luz is from the city of San Ignacio. She is a self-sacrificing young woman. She wants to prosper and is putting in a lot of effort to do so.

Luz is studying social work as her goal is to be able to help other people. 

Luz is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees and continue studying.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
SEWA est un groupe regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de SARAN  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou, dans la Préfecture de KATI. 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : balle de tissus et prêt à porter.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
SARAN, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  3 balles de tissus.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA  qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sewa is a group of women who met through family and neighbourhood ties. They are on average 25 years old. They are married with an average of three children. They have various activities such as the clothing trade as is the case of Saran, who is the second person standing from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture.
They have been working in small trade for several years and are very sought after for their clothing business: bundles of fabric and ready-to-wear.
Hoping to satisfy the increasing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme. This is their first solidarity loan.
Saran plans to use her loan to buy three bundles of fabric. She buys her stock in Bamako and locally from the wholesalers and sells her merchandise retail in Ouelessebougou for cash or for credit to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20.000FCFA   which will enable her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old and married. She engages in the buying and reselling of bags and footware within the public market. She has been in the business for almost 21 years. 

Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve the business and generate sufficient income. 

Having inadequate capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy an additional stock of bags, shoes, sandals and slippers to sell. 

Through this loan, she believes that she will increase her  product offerings and income.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of bags, shoes, sandals and slippers to sell

loans.name: Teosan

texts.en: Teosan is a hardworking mother from Ozamiz City. She enjoys her retail business selling cosmetics. Teosan supports her husband doing this type of job. As a PMPC member, she applied for a loan to restock cosmetics to sell. She hopes to sustain her business and continuously provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to restock cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn works hard in selling a variety of items. Sometimes there are good sales and sometimes she may experience low sales. With her savings, she welcomes the idea of expanding her business. She has requested a loan from PMPC to purchase more clothing and dry goods to sell. She feels assured of Paglaum’s help should there be a need for working capital in the future. She smiles at the thought of seeing her children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia manages an internet shop. This is where she gets support for the family. As a mother of four children from Ozamiz City, she hopes to sufficiently provide for her children's education. For the opening of the new school year, she applied for a loan for her children's school fees. She smiles to see in the future all her children with their college diplomas.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a full pledge member of PMPC. She wants to expand her piggery business. She wants to gain more profit and have enough to sustain her family, especially her 5 children. In order for her to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 40,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to purchase additional heads of pigs to raise. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of pigs to raise.

loans.name: Delie

texts.en:
Delie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Delie has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Delie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, desea seguir trabajando en su negocio y un nuevo crédito es de mucha importancia para llevar a cabo la compra de abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, fertilizantes y semilla, son los materiales necesarios para cultivar granos básicos.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a lograr una producción mayor de granos básicos, lo que le facilito tener mejores ganancias, actualmente con muchos esfuerzos, sacrificio logro cancelar la deuda y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marina wants to continue working at her business. A new loan will be of great importance as she needs to buy manure, insecticides, anti-disease treatments, fertilisers and seeds. These materials are necessary for growing basic grains.

Marina's previous loan helped her to increase production of basic grains and this allowed her to earn higher profits. With a lot of effort and sacrifice she was able to pay off her debt and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, anti-disease treatments, fertilisers and seeds.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 45-year-old married women. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is responsible for 3 children. Her husband is running his own jewelry shop. Her husband wants to increase his business by selling to a lot of customers on a daily basis.

Her husband wants to buy some more jewelry and some stones for his business but due to insufficient financial support he cannot buy these materials. That is why Imtiza applied for a loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to meet his expenses.

Imtiaz is very thankful to Kiva and sends her kind regards.

loans.use: to increase her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen’s husband is a kind and hardworking person. He has grown old and is not able to work as hard as when he was younger. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs, so continues his carpenter work in his old age. 

He is involved in his own business and has a regular income. He manufactures wooden shoe molds for  the shoe manufacturing firms. Yasmeen stays at home and is ill. This business provides a good income for her husband but her family's needs increase each day and he needs to earn more money. He wants to buy raw materials to make wooden shoe molds. She came to BRAC Pakistan to obtain a loan for her husband to buy raw materials to make wooden shoe molds. 

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for both his business and his family.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make wooden shoe molds.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa como estudiante se esmera bastante para salir adelante, trabaja como limpiadora, y comenta que tiene hijos a los que cuida, cuida su casa y entre todo eso estudia.
Tiene 41 años y su hijo mayor le ayuda a solventar con los gastos de sus estudios quien también trabaja y estudia. Su sueño es poder ascender en su lugar de trabajo, es por eso que está estudiando para ser abogada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su matrícula y otros gastos de estudios, de esa manera poder seguir con su sueño.
texts.en: As a student, Rosa works very hard to succeed. She works as a cleaner, and says that she has children who she takes care of. She takes care of her house, and through all this she studies. Rosa is 41 years old and her oldest child, who also works and studies,  helps her manage her schooling expenses. Her dream is to be able to move up in her workplace, and that is why she is studying to be a lawyer. Rosa requests this loan to invest in paying for her tuition and other schooling expenses; this way she can continue with her dream.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and other expenses.

loans.name: Djantoyerela I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. .
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil   avec  KADIA FASELIBA , deuxième personne assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djantoyerela I group are married women who are on average 38 years old with two children. They live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural activities during the winter.
This is their third agricultural loan with the institution, they have repaid the previous loans.
Kadia Faseliba, who is the second from the right sitting down in the photo, cultivates peanuts and millet.
With her loan she plans to buy fertiliser and seeds and to pay labour costs for the work on two hectares of land.
After the harvest, they sell the production in the village and in Sanankoroba to a mixed clientele made up of retailers and consumers.
She hopes to make an average profit of 95.000FCFA per field.
This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and assist her husband in day to day expenses.

loans.use: To pay labour costs, and to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Valle Sagrado De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VALLE SAGRADO DE URUBAMBA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa tiene 24 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir tajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a las telecomunicaciones, tienda de abarrotes, docente, transporte, venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the communal bank Sacred Valley of Urubamba.  The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  Rosa is 24 years old and has one child who lives with her.  She spends her days working in a grocery store and selling different types of products such as rice, milk, and other items.  She has enjoyed working in this field and things are going well thanks to her dedication which is shown every day in her work.  She hopes to continue growing the business in order to support her family. 

She is requesting credit to buy rice, sugar and other items.  She feels thankful for the loan that is being offered and she promises to comply with the repayment plan.  The other members of her group work in telecommunication, groceries, transportation, education, and sales.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites has been growing and harvesting vegetables to sell in town. She has had this business for more than four years, and it is the primary source of income for the family. Marites took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él compra ganados pequeños y los hace engordar para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias ganaderas del departamento del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal " Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un pequeño ganado. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Juan lives in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco in the south of Peru.  He is a respectful and simple person who works in agriculture and livestock.  He purchases young cattle, fattens them, and then sells them in different cattle markets in the department of Cusco.  He belongs to the communal bank "Intipaqareq II" and currently he needs a loan in order to buy some small livestock.  He is thankful to all the investors for the help they offer and he is committed to repaying his loan with great responsibility and punctuality according to the prescribed repayment plan.

loans.use: To purchase small livestock.

loans.name: Peter June

texts.en: Peter June is married with three children. He operates a farm where he plants crops to make a living. His wife vends the produce in their village. He has been in this field of business for eight years, and he earns money to better provide for his family. Recently, he requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional seeds and organic fertilizer. In the future, the couple want to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 53 years old and has four children.  She is married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. 

Francisco requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Francisco has been in business for six years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisco would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Generosa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, ha teniendo experiencias positivas con el uso de créditos en su negocio, pues poco a poco ha mejorado el local, su equipo y ha diversificado los productos que ofrece en su cibercafé, su familia se mantienen viviendo en mejores circunstancias y logro cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
Esta solicitando más capital para invertirlo en la compra de discos duros, tintas, memorias USB, papel, audífonos, bocinas, tarjetas de video, etc., está inversión le ayudara a continuar prestando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Israel has had positive experiences with the use of loans in his business; little by little he has improved his commercial space and his equipment and diversified the products that he is offering in his cybercafé. His family is living in better circumstances and he managed to pay off his debt with a good credit record.

He is requesting more capital to invest in the purchase of hard drives, ink, USB memory sticks, headphones, speakers, video cards, etc. This investment will help him to continue providing good service.

loans.use: to buy hard drives, ink, USB memory sticks, paper, headphones, speakers, video cards, etc.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 25-year-old married woman, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband provides services troubleshooting refrigerators, air conditioners and water dispensers. From time to time, he has to buy refrigeration parts such as compressors, condensers, relays, overload and copper pipes. Mehwish has requested a loan so her husband can buy these parts so he can get maximum turnover.

She wishes for the bright future for her family, and her dream is to provide a better education to her coming children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy parts for refrigeration, such as such as compressors, condensers, relays, overload and copper pipes.

loans.name: Marbin Herith

texts.es:
Marbin tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y tiene 3 hijos.

Marbin se dedica a la agricultura, se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas mientras sus hijos estudian, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres;  trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar las vacas, y el resto del día Marbin trabaja en otras parcelas 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Sus planes a futuro son tener una mejor vivienda ya que actualmente es de bahareque, y espera lograrlo con las ganancias de su trabajo y la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Marbin is 35 years old; he studied up to high school, is married, and has three children. 



Marbin works in agriculture. He gets up at 5:00 a.m. with his wife who helps him with the farm chores while their children study. He learned this skill from his parents; he works in the morning and his wife tends to the house and the cattle. The rest of the day Marbin works in other fields. He needs this loan to buy a cow for increasing milk production so he can sell it and have more income. His future plans are to have a better home since his current one is a "bahareque" construction (made of branches, mud, and other natural materials). He hopes to achieve this with the earnings from his work and the help from the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a businessman based in Nairobi. He has a family of five children, and has one wife. He has, over the years, been able to maintain high customer standards in his hotel business and in turn, earned high yields and developed a need to expand his businesses as well as venture into new ones. 

He wishes to diversify his investments, and therefore seeks a loan to help him put up and run two Fresh Life toilets. 

He says that the franchise will grow to be a successful venture due to the great need for sanitation facilities in his area. 

He plans to use the income from the franchise to repay his loan and expand it in order to improve sanitation standards. This to him will be a way of giving back to the community.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a community leader and businessman based in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. He owns rental houses, a retail shop and a water vending business in the expansive urban informal settlements of Mukuru. 

Peter hopes to see a cleaner environment in his community so that his businesses could thrive and help him to lead a quality lifestyle. This gave him the urge to learn about more about the Fresh Life Toilets and the impact they've had on the community. Peter seeks a loan to help him purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet. He chose the Fresh Life Franchise since he saw an opportunity to make money as well as to ease access to sanitation facilities for community members. Income earned from the franchise will be used to repay his loan as well as to keep diversifying his businesses and create employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine of The Montserrado Village Savings and Loan Association seeks a Kiva loan to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell retail. Josephine is President of the Village Savings and Loan Association of Montserrado County, Monrovia, Liberia.  The Association is a conglomerate of over 600 women's groups ranging from 25 - 30 members, who combine saving through small monthly membership fees, then make small micro-loans to their women entrepreneurs to pay back over time.  Josephine also owns "Winning Business Center" in the city, where she has a tailor shop, sells water and other food snacks, and buys clothes wholesale in order to sell them retail.

Josephine will use her new Kiva loan to purchase 25 clean cookstoves at wholesale and resell them to her women's group at a very small markup.  Josephine also wants to establish her credit with Kiva micro-loans so she can apply for business loans in the future.

loans.use: To purchase Sustainable Energy for All products to sell to women's groups at affordable prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for manual labor to tend her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
En estas tierras es en donde Andrés planea sembrar papas.  Él también es propietario de otros terrenos. En ellos cultiva repollo, maíz y frijoles. Ya cuenta con treinta años de experiencia en el sector agrícola y sus productos han logrado una buena aceptación en toda la región. KIVA Mi Crédito ha sido un pilar fundamental en su trabajo, porque siempre  les brindan apoyo a  pequeños agricultores como él.
Andrés solicitó otro financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, abonos foliares, insecticidas, también necesitará contar con personal que lo ayude sembrar y a dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Las ganancias las utilizará para establecer un proyecto, que es la venta de leche.  Su sueño es ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, asimismo, invertir en la educación de sus hijos para que cuenten con un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
This land is where Andrés plans to plant potatoes. He is also the owner of other land where he grows cabbage, corn, and beans. He already has thirty years of experience in farming and his products have been very well-received throughout the region. Kiva MiCredito has been a fundamental pillar in his work because it always offers support to small farmers like him.

Andrés requests other funding to buy fertilizer, fungicide, foliar fertilizer, and insecticide; he will also need to hire workers to help him plant and tend to his crops. He will use his earnings to start a project, which is selling milk. His dream is to offer better living conditions to his family and to invest in his children's education so they can have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide, foliar fertilizer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and seven children. Her husband has been running his own restaurant and shop in the local market for many years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Parveen's husband needs to buy different types of restaurant and shop accessories (e.g., tables ,chairs, and food items). But, due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to obtain these restaurant accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her husband's restaurant and shop.

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.ru:
Далерчон жизнерадостный молодой человек в возрасте 26 лет. Он женат имеет двух детей. Далерчон со своей женой живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми, он и его жена очень рады растить своих детей. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Далерчон занимается своим любимым делом. Далерчон вот уже как 5 лет работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и сейчас находится в нерабочем состоянии. 

Поэтому сейчас он планирует произвести капитальный ремонт своего автомобиля. Этот бизнес приносит Далерчону хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание. А для того, чтобы купить все необходимые запчасти для ремонта автомобиля требуются денежные средства. Поэтому Далерчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку запчастей для автомобиля. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dalerjon is a cheerful young man of 26. He is married and has two children. He and his wife live happily and are trying to raise their children to be good people. To earn a living, he works in his preferred occupation: for five years he has been working as a taxi driver, using his own car for this purpose. But this vehicle has served him for a long time and now is in need of repairs.

Dalerjon needs to get his car fixed. His business brings in a good income but only enough to cover his living expenses, and he doesn't have enough to buy the necessary parts to repair his car. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase car parts. He hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy car parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née en 1985 à TIELE, MARIAM vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de  BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
MARIAM n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, très vite elle  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : tissus, et pagnes.    
Après avoir remboursé le premier  prêt individuel précédent, MARIAM est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante de pagnes et  de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au BURKINA FASO    et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile,  à TIELE et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte.  
MARIAM  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1985 in Tiélé, where she lives, in Baguineda subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali). She lives with her two children and husband in a nuclear family.

Mariam never had a chance to go to school. Early on, she's shown an interest for money-earning businesses, especially buying and selling clothing: fabrics, pagnes (colorful African cloth).

After having repaid her first personal loan, Mariam is now seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. She will use it to buy a large quantity of pagnes and fabrics.

She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso and retails to a mixed-gender clientele, for cash and on credit, at her home, in Tiélé, and in the surrounding fairs.

Mariam hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000, to be used to help her husband provide for the family's needs, as well as to repay the loan. The remainder will be reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of pagnes (colorful African cloth) and fabrics

loans.name: Eva América

texts.es: Eva de 40 años de edad está casada y tienen 5 hijos todos menores de edad (15, 11, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad). Su esposo trabaja de seguridad en una colonia Residencial. Eva se dedica a vender minuta (hielo raspado que se le agrega diferentes sabores de fruta y jalea de piña, tamarindo u otra fruta). La venta la realiza de lunes a viernes ubicándose en la entrada de una escuela pública del cantón de donde vive. Las paredes de su humilde vivienda es de lámina vieja y muy deteriorada; por lo que Eva ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comenzar a levantar paredes de Bloque de concreto sustituyendo la lámina existente que no presenta ninguna seguridad para su familia. Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de bloque de 10x20x40cms, hierro, cemento, arena y otros materiales necesarios para levantar paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Eva is 40 years old, married, and has five minor children (ages 15, 11, 10, 7, and 2).  Her husband works as a security guard in the residential neighborhood.  Eva sells minuta (shaved ice to which she adds different fruit flavors, pineapple jelly, tamarind, and other fruit).  She makes her sales Monday through Friday and sets up at the entrance to a public school in the settlement where she lives.  The walls to her humble home are made of old metal and it’s very deteriorated, so Eva is asking for a loan through FUSAI to build cinder block walls to replace the metal, which doesn’t provide any security for her family.  She will use the money to buy 10x20x40cm blocks, iron bars, cement, sand, and other necessary materials to build the walls.

loans.use: to build walls.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
TERIYA est un groupe de l’association BALIMAYA de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements à l’image de AMI qui est la deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à MISSION dans la  Sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’habillement : pagnes wax et friperie. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. 
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de pagne wax et de 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Teriya is a group belonging to Balimaya association in Ouelessebougou. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 36 years of age and five children each, and live in large traditional families in Mission, in Ouelessebougou Subprefecture, Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali.

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling clothing, just like Ami, the second person seated from the left in the photograph. They've been in the retail business for several years, buying and selling clothing: pagnes Wax (colorful African cloth) and secondhand clothing, and they are very much in demand.

Eager to satisfy the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, four years ago. They are seeking their seventh solidarity loan (group loan).

Ami, the president of the group, is very well known in Ouelessebougou and she excels in selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy 5 pieces of pagnes Wax and one bale of secondhand clothing.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and retails her clothes in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000, which will enable her to repay the loan, and reinvest the remainder in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy 5 pieces of pagnes Wax (colorful African cloth) and one bale of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, esta ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Mabel ella es conviviente y tiene 27 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de queso, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cereales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Wiñay Kury” is located in the district of Quiquijuana, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco. One of the members, Mabel, is 27 years old and in a relationship. She has a grocery store and sells trout. Mabel sells all kinds of essential products, such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has had this business for a year and does very well. Her dream is to expand her business.

Mabel is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The picture pasted on the top, to the right, was taken after the meeting and is from a member who had to work when the group met. The members of this group sell clothes, cheese, groceries and cereals.

Mabel wants to thank all of those who make part of this dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en: Jerlyn is married with three children who provide transportation services in their village with her tanant while her husband works as a security guard.  he couple plans to improve their house while their children are still young. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Jerlyn wants to improve the general living situation of her family

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita owns and manages a retail store, selling a variety of fruit in the market for a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family and she was able to successfully repay her previous loans. She always find ways to augment her family's income because she solely provides for their needs. 

Recently, Benita took a new loan to purchase more fruit to sell in order to gain more income. She plans to expand her business and use her generated income to repair her house, in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry, requiere un nuevo crédito para comprar vidrio, aluminio, hierro, tubos, pegas y algunos repuestos para su vehículo, contara con los materiales que necesita para finalizar sus trabajos en su negocio de vidrio.
El efecto que tuvo de la inversión anterior en su negocio ha sido positivo, pues hoy cuenta con mayor popularidad por la calidad de sus servicios, tiene mejor estabilidad económica, su familia se mantiene y continúan esforzándose por lograr tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Henry needs a new loan to purchase glass, aluminum, iron, tubes, adhesives and some parts for his vehicle.  He will have the material that he needs to complete his work in his glass company.

The effects of his previous loan for his business have been positive. He has more popularity for the quality of his services, he has better economic stability, his family is supported, and they continue to strive to be able to have their own home.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum, iron, tubes, paste, and other materials for his vehicle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married, with three children who are in school.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Susan has been pig-fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Carolina Suleyma

texts.es:
Carolina, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para abastecer su negocio de venta de tortillas, con el que comprara leña y maíz por mayoreo, de esta manera estará preparada para la época de invierno, auemntara su productividad, tendra nuevos clientes y no dejara de recibir sus ingresos que son de utilidad para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Para Carolina los créditos le ayudan a crecer cada vez más con su negocio lo que le da una mejor estabilidad económica y le permite tener una mejor calidad de vida. Está pensando en construir un chalet para tener otro rubro.
texts.en:
Carolina decided to get a new loan to stock her business where she sells tortillas, she will purchase firewood and corn wholesale. In this way, she will be prepared for the winter, she will increase her productivity, have new clients, and won´t stop having a profitable income in order to meet her economic obligations.

For Carolina, the loan will help her to continue to grow her business which gives her better economic stability and permits to have a better quality of life. She is thinking of building a detached house in order to have another occupation.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn wholesale

loans.name: Arnulfo Del Transito

texts.es:
Para muchas personas  la  Coca Cola, Big Cola y agua purificada es para consumo solamente. Sin embargo, Arnulfo les da otro uso a  estas bebidas.  El las comercializa al por mayor en su vivienda desde hace once años. Ha logrado buenas ganancias en este negocio y clientes fijos que lo prefieren por su seriedad y profesionalismo. 
Su éxito ha sido gracias al apoyo de KIVA y MiCrédito. Esta institución es un soporte fundamental en su negocio,  porque le brinda el capital necesario para adquirir productos. Arnulfo  planea invertir en la compra de agua purificada embotellada, jugos, gaseosas entre otros porque con el aumento de temperatura, la gente opta por consumir mayor liquido. El solicitó otro préstamo  y espera  lograr buenas ganancias con este proyecto.
texts.en: For many people Coca Cola, Big Cola, and purified water is for consumption only. Nevertheless, Arnulfo gives another use to these drinks. He has been selling them at wholesale in his house for 11 years. He has achieved good profits in this business and set clients who prefer him for his responsibility and professionalism. His success has been thanks to the support of Kiva and MiCredito. This institution is a fundamental support in his business because it affords him the necessary capital to acquire products. Arnulfo plans to invest in the purchase of purified bottled water, juices, and soda among other things because with the increase in temperature, the people choose to consume more liquid. He requested this loan and hopes to earn better profits with this project.

loans.use: to buy purified bottled water, juices, and sodas among other things.

loans.name: La Poderosas Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio. Ella se dedica a la venta de asaditos que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender. Es muy conocida en el barrio por sus buenos productos.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para la elaboración de sus asaditos, carne, pancitos, condimentos, etc.
texts.en:
There are 17 women that make up this group; all are doing the poverty elimination survey to learn about the situation of each member and be able to work accordingly.

One of the members is Rossana.  The latest survey indicated that she was at stage 2 poverty level, which is a medium level. She sells roast food which she prepares herself and then goes out to sell. She is very well known in the neighborhood for the quality of her products.

She is asking for this loan to buy products to prepare her roast food such as meat, bread rolls, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread rolls and condiments.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Alpha. He is married and has four children, aged 12, 9, 6 and 3 years, two of whom are going to school. He also has his mother living with him. 

In 1994, Alpha established a vehicle tire shop. He began his business because he was forced to drop out of school in class 6 because of poverty. He became a truck apprentice, learning maintenance and driving. He learnt tire patching also and was later employed in a company doing this. He worked for some years, and the salary he accumulated was used to start his own tire business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,600,000. Alpha requires a loan in order to buy different sizes of tires needed by his customers. He was able to achieve his previous plans. He has bought other pumping machines and also rents another store for his business.  

In the future, Alpha still plans to educate his children and to build on his piece of land. This loan will help him to buy a vehicle, buy machines for his business and build a house. This loan will help him to improve his business and also to achieve his plans. 

He is a committed and hardworking businessman. He thanks you for your generosity towards the business people in his country and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different sized used tires for his tire store.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, 42, is married and has two children aged seven and four years old. The older child goes to school.

Albert received some business training, so in 2012 he opened a store where he sells general merchandise. Working eleven hours a day, seven days a week, he earns about 678,000 SLL every month. Competition from other shops and rain are challenges he faces.

Albert needs more capital if he is going to improve his shop, so he is applying for a 3,000,000 SLL loan through ARD. With it he will buy more jewelry, clocks, picture frames and body cream.

Albert’s plans for the future are to improve his business and his family’s standard of living. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise in large quantities, such as breads, meats, packaging, napkins, and potatoes to stock his fast food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice and seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Botirjon

texts.ru:
Ботирчон жизнерадостный и доброжелательный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат  и имеет четверых детей. Ботирчон очень любит свою семью, в особенности своих детей. Он старается со своей женой трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи. Он хочет, чтобы его дети получили хорошее образование и стали образованными людьми. 

Сама Ботирчон занимается животноводством. Этому делу он научился в юности от своего отца и знает все тонкости данного дела. У Ботирчона также есть старший брат, который живёт отдельно со своей семьёй. И вот сейчас брат Ботирчона хочет поехать на заработки в Россию, так как здесь он не может найти высокооплачиваемую работу. Для этого ему нужно купить билет и всё необходимое для поездки. Ботирчон хочет помочь своему брату в этом и поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку авиабилета для своего брата.
texts.en:
Botirjon is a happy and kind 35 year-old man. He is married and has four children. Botirjon loves his family very much, especially his children. He and his wife try to work hard to earn money to satisfy all of the family's needs. He wants his children to obtain a good education and become educated people.

Botirjon is involved in animal husbandry. He learned this business in his youth from his father and knows all of its nuances. Botirjon also has an older brother who lives separately with his own family. And now Botirjon's brother wants to go to Russia for work because he cannot find a high-paying job here. He needs to purchase a ticket and all of the necessities for the trip. Botirjon wants to help his brother and this is why he came to Arvand in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of the airline ticket for his brother.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for his brother

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijas de 18 años y 27 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de fruta picada desde hace 13 años. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un pozo de absorción para el tratamiento de aguas grises. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento,arena, grava, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and her daughters, aged 18 and 27 years old. For the past 13 years, Ana has made a living selling chopped fruit. That is how she makes a living and brings sustenance to her home and, together with her partner, maintains their household finances.

Ana is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wishes to construct a collection tank for the treatment of grey water. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, etc. for the construction of a water collection tank.

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.es: Elena de 53 años de edad tiene casa propia y vive con su hijo y su nuera. Elena tiene varios años de vender productos de belleza por catálogo y ropa, labor que hace de forma ambulante en el municipio de donde habita. Las paredes de la vivienda de Elena actualmente son de lámina galvanizada y están deterioradas. Elena ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para sustituir las paredes de lámina y construirlas de bloque de concreto. Con el dinero comprará el bloque de concreto, cemento, hierro, arena, grava. Espera pronto iniciar con los trabajos.
texts.en: Elena is 53 years old, has a home of her own and lives with her son and daughter in law. Elena has been selling beauty products via catalog and clothing on foot in her town.  The walls in Elena’s home are currently made of galvanized metal and are deteriorated.  Elena is asking for this loan through FUSAI to replace the walls with concrete block walls.  She will use the money to buy concrete blocks, cement, iron bars, sand, and gravel. She hopes to begin the work soon.

loans.use: to replace her walls.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: Norma tiene 42 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento una bodega pequeña en su vivienda hace 06 mese  y a la vez se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos arroz azúcar bebidas golosinas. Norma en el grupo “LAS PALOMITAS” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Norma es la primera persona parada del lado derecho viste casaquilla ploma.
texts.en:
Norma is 42 years of age, married with two dependent children. She set up a small general store in her home six months ago and, at the same time, she makes a living selling beauty products.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more products: rice, sugar, beverages, candy. 

Within the group "Las Palomitas," Norma performs the role of treasurer. The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided.  

Norma is the person standing first from the right, wearing a grey jacket.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, candy and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods with the loan.

loans.name: Milton Marcelo

texts.es:
Desde temprana  edad,  Milton se entusiasmaba por armar y desarmar motocicletas de juguetes que le obsequiaban sus padres. Esa pasión  lo llevo a trabajar como ayudante en un taller de mecánica muy popular en su comunidad, y  fue allí en donde adquirió todos sus conocimientos.  Sin embargo,  Milton tenía otra visión, no quería ser un simple empleado sino ser el dueño de  su  propio negocio.  
En la actualidad ya cuenta con su propio taller de reparación de motocicletas.  Las personas  lo prefieren por  la calidad de su trabajo, y por supuesto, por  ser un mecánico confiable y eficaz.   Milton desea continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades  de  todos  los clientes que lo visitan. El recurrió a un financiamiento en KIVA Mi Crédito,  para la compra  de aceites, accesorios de motos, lubricantes  y repuestos. De esa manera  su negocio estará siempre activo.
texts.en:
At an early age, Milton became interested in assembling and taking apart the toy motorcycles that his parents gave him. This passion carried over into his job as an assistant at a popular repair shop in his community. This is where he acquired all of his knowledge. However, Milton had another vision. He did not want to be another employee, but the proprietor of his own business.

Today Milton already has his own motorcycle repair shop. Customers prefer the quality of his work because he is a reliable and efficient mechanic. Milton wants to continue satisfying the needs of all of the customers who visit him. He turned to MiCrédito for a Kiva loan so that he can buy oil, motorcycle accessories, lubricants, and spare parts. This will allow him to maintain an active business.

loans.use: to buy oil, motorcycle accessories, lubricants, and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 45 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has a vocational education and the only source of income for his family is his butcher’s business which he is already been doing for 15 years.

He works at the food market where he rents a stall and sells meat which he buys from several farmers from nearby villages. The meat that he buys he knows is always fresh and clean. He is very attentive also to keeping his working place clean and accurate, so his customers are many and they know the meat they buy from him is of good quality and safer.

Tigran asks for this loan in order to buy a large amount of meat which he will store and gradually sell to his customers, the income from which he hopes will help him to overcome the costs of his children's school graduating activities (school graduation party, new dresses, etc.).

loans.use: to buy a large amount of meat

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 44 years old and lives in Dilijan city. She is married and is a mother of three children; her elder daughter is 20 years old and she works as a nurse. The other two children are still school-age. Narine works as a cleaner at the bank. Her husband on his own track, and transfers firewood around their region. Together they try to provide for their three children and their mother, who is retired and lives with them. 

Narine usually is very active, and as she says, she never feels tired.  But lately she is very worried about her health, since she feels not good and she wants to find out what is wrong with her. 

She asks this loan in order to have an examination at the polyclinics, and if needed, for some course of treatment.

loans.use: to have an examination at the polyclinics and if needed, to pay for some course of treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en: Thanks to lenders, according to Kristina, she built the stable with the previous loan and now she wants to expand it by opening more room to fit more animals. This will be her second loan on Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, onion, oil, fish, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, palm oil, and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is ready for her second Kiva loan to help Claytime Ceramics into its second location! 

When Caroline took over Claytime Ceramics 11 years ago, it was just a small ceramics studio offering patrons a creative space to make ceramics and other crafts.  Since then, Caroline has grown her shop into a Pacific Beach staple, offering a variety of hands-on experiences, workshops and summer camps in ceramics painting, mosaic, pottery and clay modeling

It has always been Caroline’s goal to expand her business to another location, and she recently had the opportunity to take over a small gift shop that she will now convert into a second ceramics studio modeled after the original. 

Her second Kiva loan will help with the operating expenses and payroll of Caroline’s second Claytime Ceramics and gifts store. She feels fortunate to have found such a reliable employee for her second location and believes that this employee is just the partner she needs to help this second location thrive.

Caroline’s passion for art and ceramics is as strong as when she first took over this business and she continues to work hard to share this joy with others.  

Find Claytime Ceramics on the web at: http://www.claytime-ceramics.com

loans.use: to cover operating and payroll expenses for her new shop

loans.name: Francisca De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Francisca de 32 años de edad ha procreado con su compañero de vida tres hijos (17, 13 y 12 años de edad). Hace tres años adquirieron el terreno donde han construido su vivienda. Francisca se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Francisca ha adquirido un crédito con FUSAI para comprar ladrillo de obra, cemento arena, grava para la construcción de una fosa séptica y pozo de absorción. Con esto espera evitar cualquier foco de infección que pueda afectar la salud de todos los miembros de su familia.
texts.en: Francisca is 32 years old and she and husband have three children (ages 17, 13, and 12).  Three years ago they acquired the land where they built their house.  Francisca provides domestic services and is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a septic tank and absorption pool.  With this she hopes to prevent any source of disease from affecting her family.

loans.use: to build a septic system.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 32 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, pues siendo el mayor de sus hermanos decidió abandonar sus estudios para ayudarle a su padre en las actividades agrícolas. Él vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, por quienes el desarrolla esta dura actividad pues su padre hoy está un poco más cansado por su edad.

La actividad que realiza es un poco fuerte pero él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde los 13 años de edad, pues él acompañaba a su padre. En su tiempo libre el también sale a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, esta actividad la aprendió de uno de sus tíos, aunque es una actividad temporal le ayuda mucho en los gastos del hogar.

Francisco necesita este crédito para comprar algunos insumos que utilizará para la siembra y cosecha de granos agrícolas, pues es de la agricultura de donde obtiene la alimentación de su familia.

En un futuro Francisco desea establecer una tienda, para obtener de ahí los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su familia, y mediante ahorros remodelar su casa ya que el techo está dañado.
texts.en:
Francisco, 32, is a very determined person.  He studied his basic education up to fourth grade.  Being the oldest of his siblings, he decided to leave school to help his father with the farming activities. He lives with his parents and two siblings.  He works very hard hard for them because his father is a little more tired due to his age.

His job is somewhat hard but he has worked in agriculture since the age of 13 because he helped his father.  In his free time he also goes out to work as a bricklayer's helper, which he learned from one of his uncles.  It's a seasonal job, but it helps him a lot with the household expenses.

Francisco needs this loan to buy some agricultural inputs for planting and harvesting agricultural grains because he obtains food for his family through farming.

Francisco wants to set up a store in the future so he can earn the income he needs to support his family and, with savings, remodel his house because the roof is damaged.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for growing grains

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE UNIDAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Presidenta.
